Company Description M-Brain is a strategic market intelligence and advisory group. M-Brain (former Global Intelligence Alliance) was formed in 1995 when a team of market intelligence specialists, management consultants, industry analysts and technology experts came together to build a powerful suite of customized solutions ranging from outsourced market monitoring services and software, to strategic analysis and advisory. Today, we are the preferred partner for organizations seeking to understand, compete and grow in international markets. Our industry expertise and coverage of over 100 countries enableour customers to make better-informeddecisions worldwide. Our Advisory Services unit collects and analyses information, providing clients in multiple industries with key decision-making support. Job opportunity M-Brain’s Strategic Advisory Services provides Advisory services to assist clients with their growth in new markets (market entry projects), market opportunity analysis, competitive benchmarking, procurement intelligence and commercial due diligence. As a Research Analyst, your primary role will be to support the team on project execution spanning the Asia Pacific region. You’re learning curve will be steep. You will be exposed to many growth industries, especially in the ASEAN region. If you are a team-player, enjoy working in an environment that is unpredictable, have strong analytical and communication skills (English and another ASEAN working language), we’re very keen to hear from you. If you have experience cold-calling and conducting interviews, this will be a major plus. Responsibilities · Conduct research on Asia Pacific markets covering various industries according to client needs · Analyse data from disparate sources and deriving critical insights for target decisions by our clients · Prepare written reports and recommendations for clients based on market findings and analysis carried out · Manage and oversee data collection by freelance consultants in global markets, with focus on the ASEAN region · Research and analysis support on the production of marketing material – whitepapers, articles etc. · Support the team on new business development and proposal building, particularly by helping research markets for which clients require market intelligence. · Other support as and when required. Qualifications · 1-2 years’ experience in B2B research, and/ or business analysis · Interest in a widerange of business sectors and willingness to learn · Experience working in or with multi-national corporations · Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint. · Highly analytical, organised, and meticulous · Statistical analysis (e.g., regression) a plus, but not a requirement · Fluency in professional English; working knowledge in any of the following Asian languages (Bahasa Malaysia, Bahasa Indonesia, Thai, Vietnamese, Korean, and Japanese) an advantage · Singapore based candidates only

Our technology integrates ridehailing, airport transfers, micromobility, public transport and food delivery into our partners’ platforms, so they can unlock the world for their customers. Splyt has offices in London, Singapore, Tokyo, and Kuala Lumpur, but we feel at home anywhere. Our amazing partners are the largest in the business, with over 2 billion users in total, and we are constantly expanding our footprint beyond the 150 countries we already cover. Working with us We are a remote-first company, with a fun, diverse and enthusiastic bunch from all corners of the world (with 25 nationalities and 20 languages spoken amongst our employees). We live and breathe our values of Ingenuity, Independence, Collaboration, and Laughter. Our exceptional culture is underpinned by an empowering, collaborative learning environment where our people are constantly stretched and growing to be high-performing and, most importantly, happy. Splyt’s Core team is a talented engineering team that works on our overall infrastructure and substantial microservice ecosystem. We are now on the hunt for an experienced back end developer to help the team to build and support the core product of Splyt. TITLE: DUTY AIDE OFFICER JOB DESCRIPTION To supervise and support our learners in their break and lunch times across the Primary and Secondary schools. Working in the cafeteria, sports areas, playgrounds and other social areas you will form strong relationships with our learners, teachers and admin staff. You will be the supervising adult for our learners and first point of contact for them should a need arise. ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES Interact with learners and staff (teachers, nurses, learner services, members of Victus and JLL) to form strong relationships with the school community Make sure learners are safe, happy and looked after at all times Help to resolve conflicts between learners that may arise during lunch or break times Be aware of, maintain and enforce any essential agreements that have been put in place by the school such as where learners are allowed to go, who they can play with and use of technology in any given space. To have regular contact and feedback with your SLT links To pass on any safeguarding concerns that may arise as part of your role Involvement in whole school events and activities as required. To perform any other duties as assigned by the management, stakeholders and reporting manager/link A TYPICAL DAY I arrive at 09:00am ready for my 1st duty that begins at 09:25am. I have duties with both Primary (5 - 12 years old) and Secondary (11 - 18 years old) learners. I am often in the cafeteria with the learners monitoring the queue for hot food. I remind learners to put their phones away if they are texting in the queue and help another learner who needs a plaster by accessing the 1st Aid kit in the cafetiera. I talk to the learners at the end of break and remind them to clear their table. I also have outside duties. I help to resolve disagreements, ensure the learners are always safe, reinforce the need to wear a hat in the sun and ensure learners are keeping to their physical distancing groups. I anticipate the end duty and help to move the learners to their learning spaces for the start of lessons. QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS The ability to think quickly and problem solve Able to make relationships and develop rapport with adults and children Calm and approachable Keen to be involved in the whole life of the school and excited to be joining our school community Willingness to learn and upskill (training in Educare will be provided) A genuinely liking for children Well organised and self motivated Proactive and able to work autonomously Reliable and punctual with a proven track record for commitment to work HOW TO APPPLY We encourage candidates to be wary of sharing details with unauthorised recruitment sites and thus encourage you to apply directly through our secure website. Please email your resume to ***@nexus.edu.sg. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We want the best to join our team so please ensure that your covering letter is original and tell us how you are a good fit for Nexus. Nexus International School (Singapore) is committed to the safety and wellbeing of our children and families. Nexus endorses the Convention on the Rights of the Child, which Singapore ratified on 11 December 2008, and establishes a clear policy and guidelines to protect our learners from maltreatment by any person or persons who come in contact with them in any environment. Nexus International School (Singapore) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our school. Whilst every effort has been made to explain the main duties and responsibilities the role may be revised from time to time.

Job_Title: Raffles Hotel Singapore - Chef de Partie (Banquet, Butcher’s Block; La Dame de Pic; Osteria BBR; Pastry; Tiffin Room – Asian; yi by Jereme Leung)
Job_Descriptions: Raffles Hotel Singapore welcomed guests in August 2019 after a careful and sensitive restoration breathing new life into its beautiful building. One of the few remaining great 19th century hotels in the world, the hotel is perfectly preserved both inside and out, giving it an intoxicating blend of luxury, history and classic colonial design. Its distinctive architecture, legendary heritage and iconic service continue to enthrall visitors where restored suites, new social spaces, restaurants and bars have been enhanced for discerning travellers. No visit to Singapore is complete without a stay here, where the grand historic hotel exudes old-world grandeur infused with the unique charm of the city state. Guests can experience the modern comfort and amenities presented within 115 luxuriously spacious suites complemented by our legendary 24-hour Raffles Butler Service and a heritage tour of the property by our Resident Historian. 10 restaurants and bars present both local favourites, fine dining and collaborations with internationally renowned chefs and curated classics such as the iconic Singapore Sling experience and classic Raffles Afternoon Tea amidst the colonial charm of the historic Grand Lobby. A rooftop swimming pool and state-of-the-art fitness centre provide a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city while the new Raffles Spa is a holistic sanctuary offering pampering spa experiences and renewed well-being. Your schedule — Pick your time-zone, choose your preferred hours, and work from the place where you feel most at home. Flexibility and freedom are in our DNA! The Analytics & Insights team has been a key contributor to driving Domino’s industry-leading sales growth by pairing strategic thought leadership with the latest analytic techniques in the fields of data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and primary research. This Specialist role reports to the Manager of Asia Analytics & Insights.  This individual will primarily be tasked with helping to drive sales in our largest Asia Pacific markets by consulting with our Master Franchisees’ analytics and insights teams.  This role will also collaborate with International marketing, business consulting, digital, technology, supply chain, and training teams to identify opportunities and set priorities for Domino’s markets worldwide. Success in this role requires a combination of analytics expertise, consulting, and training skillsets to support Master Franchisees at different stages of analytical complexity. GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES Consult Domino’s Asia Pacific markets on key topics such as pricing and offers analytics, digital analytics, product development, media effectiveness, and design of experiment. Develop a strong understanding of the business, the challenges, and demonstrate the ability to identify additional growth opportunities that can be acted upon Establish strong understanding of the broader Analytics & Insights department initiatives and methodologies Develop relationships and provide guidance to our Master Franchisees and internal business partners Present best practices and recent findings to both internal and international leadership teams Take lead role in further development/innovation of analytic tools to support the international field organization Build a strong working knowledge of the many internal and external data sources to leverage Mine and synthesize across data sources to help address opportunities leveraging SQL and other analytic techniques

The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Operations and Support team is seeking accomplished and passionate individuals to lead and evolve our customers’ cloud journey. As an Escalations Manager, you will bring business critical product issues to resolution and channel customers back to normal Support stream. You will strive to provide the highest level of customer support and satisfaction through collaborating with service teams from multiple Oracle lines of business in resolving product related issues that have a significant business impact on cloud customers. We are looking for Escalation Managers to lead and manage complex customer issues and situations. The ideal candidate will have proven ability to communicate effectively in high-pressure situations, work on and lead cross-functional teams such as Support and Operations, Consulting, Engineering and Product Management. S/he is a forward-thinking problem solver with a solutions-oriented mindset and with a potential to deeply understand the impact of technical challenges. In addition, s/he has strong communication skills to clearly articulate high-level technical solutions and drive technical decisions to solve challenging technical and business problems. Are you keen in learning how an end-to-end cloud infrastructure works? Are you passionate about making customers successful? Are you a customer advocate who enjoys building and establishing strong relationships and credibility? Are you excited about diving in and resolving customer issues, and willing to engage directly with Executives in high-profile situations? Responsibilities Principally responsible to own communication to customers and other teams within Oracle during critical incidents Provide a single voice to the customer (internal or external) throughout the full lifecycle of an incident, from inception to resolution and corrective action Operate efficiently in a demanding environment, maintain composure, demonstrate leadership, and communicate in an exemplary manner Work as one member of a global team. Be able & willing to assist in work originating in other regions and be open to handing off your work to your team members for follow-the-sun issues Engage and lead cross-functional and geographically diverse teams to develop and execute action plans while addressing critical situations Manage timelines and resource engagement to drive resolution to critical/challenging customer issues in a cross-functional environment Track and communicate status and resolution to all customer and oracle stakeholders in a factual, professional, timely and consistent manner Technical aptitude sufficient to obtain OCI certification(s) as requested/required Ability to communicate complex ideas and topics to multiple audiences at the appropriate depth for each Requirements BA/BS in Computer Science with minimum 5-10 years' experience in customer engagement, customer-facing service delivery and/or incident management roles. Fresh graduates are welcomed to apply and will be considered for a junior position Strong verbal and written communications skills with prior experience in a customer facing role. Our people are foundational to our strategy– they are not ‘resources’ that we leverage! Our People team (formerly Human Resources) partners with leaders to engage and attract high performing, diverse, entrepreneurial talent. We continuously challenge ourselves to be BOLD in our thinking, design and delivery of people solutions that enable our people to be the best that they can be and drive exceptional ResMed success. Location: 3 Tuas Avenue 2, right opposite Tuas Crescent MRT (4 stops from Boon Lay MRT) *Flexi-work arrangements and transport allowance provided* Let’s talk about Responsibilities As People Business Partner at ResMed, you are the strategic advisor and coach to our Operations and Manufacturing team. You are the key focal point of contact for the entire employee lifecycle, people matters and proficiency in people operations; with the support from People Centre of Excellence (COE). You will have deep understanding of the business strategy to provide expert insight and leadership into organizational effectiveness and talent planning and development. Represent People team, provide the advice to leaders in making the right people and business decisions. Develop and drive People local, regional and/or global programs and initiatives. Partner with leaders and business managers to define and drive people, engagement and culture strategies in support of the overall business strategy. Work closely with People COE teams, management and employees to build a high performing culture and positive employee experiences. Facilitate the workforce planning and change management frameworks. Leveraging on digital tools and technologies for data insights to support organization development and effectiveness, talent management and development solutions. Be People solutionist. Develop and implement programs that provide value-added business solutions for supporting high levels of employee engagement and productivity. Design and facilitate programs to enable business growth, strengthening leadership and people capabilities. Resolve complex employee relation issues and address grievances Let’s talk about Qualifications and Experience Bachelor’s degree with minimum of 8 years of People advisory and partnering experience. Prior experience working in Manufacturing /Operations or related sector Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills Strong influencing and negotiation skills High standard of discretion and integrity Proactive, excellent team player and learning agility Demonstrate experience and knowledge in both strategic and tactical People core functions. Excellent working knowledge of local employment laws and/or foreign labour requirements, where applicable. Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!

About the job The Red Hat Telco, Media and Entertainment (TME) Vertical Ecosystem team is looking for a telco network equipment provider (NEP) focused Regional Partner Sales Lead to join us in an Asia Pacific (APAC) and Japan wide role in Singapore. In this role, you are expected to deliver on Red Hat’s strategy and value proposition for the NEP partners segment, leading cross-functional teams with virtual members from APAC and the global TME vertical. You’ll take care of the success of your partners’ business and guide it with our end customer accounts and ecosystem, developing relationships that monetize our added value today and also build for further future success together. Your success is measured against your ability to build partner’s capability, innovating joint solutions, creating incremental business in collaboration with the key partners and Red Hat account teams in quarterly and yearly sales bookings per your targets and your ability to build future pipelines. As the NEP Partner Regional Partner Sales Lead, you will help establish Red Hat as a strategic and trusted partner when new business initiatives, use cases, and projects are being thought through. What you will do Establish trusted partner relationships with the NEP partners in APAC so that companies are closely aligned with the goals of the partnership in the TME vertical Serve as the primary point of contact for partners sales through the entire sales lifecycle and cooperate with the Red Hat and partners’ stakeholders to achieve sales goals Understand Red Hat and partners shared business objectives and strategy by developing business cases that capture the joint added value to customers Direct the overall engagement and alignment of our organization's assigned resources and services, including business planning, partner enablement, technical account management, Level 3 support, and support training and enablement Understand partners solutions and technologies as they relate to TME business and how they can contribute to mutual success Identify and understand partner and end customer issues and goals, organizational setups, decision-making frameworks, etc. Be highly visible through direct customer engagements in the field, promote new business initiatives, and participate in closing deals in support of your selected partners What you will bring Bachelor's degree in business administration, marketing, or a technical discipline; MBA is a plus Solid understanding of and experience selling telecommunication carrier software solutions, preferably with prior experience in the emerging network functions virtualization (NFV) space 10+ years of solid leadership experience in a technology sales organization; software selling experience is a big plus Demonstrated ability to think creatively and design novel approaches that balance local customer needs with corporate guidelines and philosophies Ability to present to C-level executives Demonstrated ability to manage and develop strategic partner business on a regional level Proven experience developing sales organizations that consistently deliver double-digit year-over-year increases in revenue Excellent understanding of communications solutions and their ecosystem, as well as the telco trends like 5G, cloud, or edge computing Ability to articulate and advocate for the vision and positioning of Red Hat and open source technology, and secure long-term partner and customer commitments Solid interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills; ability to work with teams across the globe with varying skill sets Willingness to travel up to 50% or as required in line with Red Hat’s COVID-19 guidelines Fluent English language skills Excellent planning, financial, and analytical skills; proven ability to apply these skills to complex situations with competing priorities Understanding of the open source software engineering and related business models is a plus #LI-EG1 About Red Hat Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future. Red Hat’s culture is built on the open source principles of transparency, collaboration, and inclusion, where the best ideas can come from anywhere and anyone. When this is realized, it empowers people from diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to come together to share ideas, challenge the status quo, and drive innovation. Job Category Executive Assistants Group Job Details Salesforce Executive Assistants are made up of a team of experienced professionals that support our top executives across the globe. These critical team members are viewed as strategic partners who keep the executives and their teams focused on company goals while embracing the Salesforce values. Role Description: We are looking for an Executive Assistant to support executives in our APAC Professional Services business and contribute to the continued growth of the business. This is an opportunity to work alongside individuals who are united by a strong sense of teamwork, customer success, and innovation. This person will utilize a broad set of skills to amplify the success of their executives. Salesforce has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture and we are looking forward to welcoming another talented person, aligned to our company values of “Trust, Customers Success, Innovation, Equality & Sustainability” to our growing Executive Assistant team. Your impact: Our Executive Assistants understand that the success of the executive is a reflection of her/his work and vice versa, which creates a true atmosphere of teamwork and job satisfaction. Core Responsibilities: Manage day to day schedules in such a way that the executives are able to complete their obligations in an organized, efficient way. Coordinate internal and external meetings including but not limited to team meetings, full staff meetings (town halls and all-hands), off-site meetings, one-on-one meetings, etc. Proactively manage calendar priorities based on customer meetings, internal and external stakeholder meetings, fiscal calendars, current projects, team needs and monthly, quarterly, yearly business reviews & kick-offs. Book appropriate domestic and international travel within the Salesforce travel policy, taking into account travel Visas, Covid requirements, costs and proper documentation. Management and processing of executives business expenses. Effectively interface with stakeholders from other groups within Salesforce and Senior Executives inside and outside the company. Assist with organising catering, luncheon/dinner planning, and planning of other business-related meetings as requested. Assist with Google Slide presentations, Gmail group management, Google applications and Slack communications when needed. Other administrative and project duties as requested. Minimum Requirements: Minimum of 5+ years of applicable administrative experience, ideally from a global organization (technology industry advantageous). Previous experience partnering with senior management in a fast-paced, innovative environment. Skilful execution of administrative activities, with high attention to detail, organization and process. Agility and flexibility in response to changing priorities and needs, within an ambiguous and fast-paced environment. Ability to handle confidential material with the utmost discretion. Experience with the setting up and management of virtual meetings with a large number of participants, using tools such as Zoom, Google Meets etc. Strong teamwork skills; and a confident ability to offer suggestions and improvements to process and work very collaboratively with others. Strong relationship management skills, ability to build a personal network throughout the company. Strong experience with creating presentation, mail and calendaring skills (Google Slides, Gmail and Google Calendar experience a plus). Strong oral and written communication. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with senior leaders and external partners. Experience working with/in large administrative teams. Additional Desired Skills/Traits Customer-centric orientation. Proven ability to manage projects, work under pressure and consistently make deadlines. Demonstrate ability and willingness to continuously acquire new competencies and accept new challenges. Possess a natural ability and curiosity and to comprehend the global DNA of the company and its organizations. Ensure communications are clear, thorough, and specific, with attention to follow-through. Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org. Salesforce welcomes all.

Responsibilities As an Enterprise Architect you will be responsible for: Defining and design system architecture for multiple enterprise applications and ensures that they are integrated to aligned to project, program, and business strategies. Setting the direction and establishes the approaches for integrating and exchanging information across various enterprise applications. Engaging with C-level DXC and Client Executives to understand and propose solutions to business challenges. Cataloguing, developing, coordinating, communicating, maintaining, and enforcing the overall Enterprise Architecture Models, Representations, Initiatives, Capabilities, and Standard Components used by the organization to perform all business and technology related activities. Guiding project development teams in areas of application software design, development, testing and implementation. You are also required to work closely with solution architects, software developers, project managers and other team members to ensure successful implementation of enterprise applications. Prerequisites To be successful in this role, the candidate should have the following qualifications, skills and experience: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related discipline with at least 10+ years of experience in delivering enterprise applications and with at least 5+ years as Enterprise/Solution Architect. O Delivering applications using Monolith Platform Technology such as UNIX, Windows, Virtualisation, Networking, Firewall, Load Balancer, Application Servers such as IBM Websphere o Leading teams across broad technical disciplines o Conducting training and mentoring teams in the areas of system architecture and software engineering o Guiding teams in addressing application security concerns o Producing documents relating to application architecture, system design, integration processes and testing procedures Possess excellent analytical, creative, problem-solving and critical thinking skills: o Able to offer viable solutions for various systems and architectures to different types of businesses o Ensure seamless integration of new and existing systems to eliminate potential problems and maintain data structure and integrity o Able to lead team in application troubleshooting and performance tuning Excellent verbal and written communication as well as interpersonal skills Good-to-have: Industry certification such as TOGAF Experience in integrating Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) products to enterprise applications Public Sector projects/program experience Rvin James Murillo Andalan EA License No.: 02C3423 Personnel Registration No.: R1331697 Please note that your response to this advertisement and communications with us pursuant to this advertisement will constitute informed consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of personal data by ManpowerGroup Singapore for the purpose of carrying out its business, in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012. Job_Title: International Private Bank – Relationship Manager, SEA, Director
Job_Descriptions: International Private Bank – Relationship Manager, SEA, Director Position Overview Details of the Division and Team: Deutsche Bank’s Wealth Management business is one of the largest wealth managers worldwide. We offer our clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Wealth Management. As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations, we create lasting value for clients. We specialize in developing bespoke solutions for our clients around the world, for instance wealth planning across successive generations and international borders, asset management with individual risk management, loans and deposits. All this is possible thanks to our global network, our many years of experience and our close collaboration with the Corporate Bank, Investment Bank and DWS. We aim to become a highly competitive global wealth manager by combining financial strength and stability with trustworthy partnership and forward-thinking in order to build sustainable and beneficial client relationships. As a growth business for Deutsche Bank, we contribute towards building a more balanced, less capital intense and stable business model for the bank. The Relationship Manager is a primary point of contact for clients to access the entire suite of wealth management capabilities and solutions offered by Deutsche Bank Wealth Management. This is achieved by working in close partnership with the Investment Manager in the day-to-day planning and servicing for the client. The individual is responsible for acquiring new clients - which are in line with the business proposition of the bank - and assets as well as grow existing business relationships, assuring a holistic and high-standard client experience. What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. You can expect: Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services Comprehensive leave benefits Gender Neutral Parental Leave Flexible working arrangements 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement Your key responsibilities: Develop, manage and maintain overall relationship with the client, providing an holistic client experience Be the first point of contact and the overall responsible person with regard to dealing with client complaints Develop new business with new and existing clients, spending a great proportion of time focused on bringing in new clients and new assets (prospecting), building and sustaining long-term relationships Work as a team with the Investment Manager (and the Institutional Wealth Partner where appropriate) to build deeper client relationships / involve in origination Keep day-to-day responsibility for advising clients within the required regulatory framework and keeping abreast of all client-impacting initiatives from the respective market Proactively identifying client lending / financing needs, involving lending specialists to further develop the opportunity Perform continuous market analysis to identify potential client leads and opportunities Act as the Accountable Client Owner with responsibility for all AML aspects of the client relationship; this includes KYC in good quality and in a timely manner (no overdues) as well as account behavior, i.e. transactions with focus on 3rd party transactions constituting transfers in and out to be in line with purpose and anticipated behavior of the account(s). Where clients are not assigned an Investment Manager, own the overall suitability and appropriateness for client investments; taking client execution orders where required and ensuring that all corresponding checks are performed Participate in relevant client social events as well as in PR and other marketing activities Uphold the team’s operating rhythm (e.g. regular prospect review, pipeline review, account planning, etc.), leading by example and demonstrating role-model behavior Work in close co-operation with other coverage, product and support functions to deliver DB’s value proposition, leveraging also other DB divisions where possible Actively support the business / growth strategy, plans and values, contributing to the achievement of a high performing team Act within professional, legal and ethical boundaries and guidelines, observing all internal and external compliance regulations and code of ethics and conduct; flagging and managing reputational risks and conflicts issues Your skills and experience: Minimum 8 years of relevant experience for Director and above Solid network of clients in the target coverage market is required, specifically in the Wealth Management or Private Banking sector for South East Asia Fluency (written and oral) in English and other languages used in the target coverage market required Detail orientation on both strategy and execution Excellent communication skills Excellent collaboration skills Superior investment acumen Have a good understanding of the governing regulatory framework (e.g. RDR, MiFID II, etc.), including but not limited to applicable confidentiality / secrecy / data protection regulations and cross border rules where relevant Professional integrity For experienced hire, solid network of clients in the target coverage market is required Self-starter Willing and able to develop other staff, e.g., analysts CFA, MBA degree or other advanced degree a plus How we’ll support you: Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs Training and development to help you excel in your career About us and our teams: Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. click here to see what we do. Deutsche Bank & Diversity Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer. We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation. Click here to find out more about diversity and inclusion at Deutsche Bank.

Job_Title: Head of AML Investigations, Private Banking, APAC - VP
Job_Descriptions: Head of AML Investigations, Private Banking, APAC - VP Position Overview Details of the Division and Team: The Asia-Pacific Anti-Financial Crime Department (AFC) supports Deutsche Bank businesses in the region manage AFC risk, is responsible for ensuring that related processes are in place and that all policies, procedures and guidelines conform to internal DB policies as well as all applicable laws and regulations.  The Financial Crime Operations and AML Investigations functions are part of AFC and ensure that Transaction Monitoring investigations are conducted to regulatory and internal standards. The primary responsibility of the Head of AML Investigations, Private Banking is execution of transaction monitoring AML investigations for the wealth business of the Bank in the Asia-Pacific as well as participation in the rapid Change affecting the function. The candidate is expected to bring thought leadership and expertise in investigative processes with substantial experience in effective AML alert and case- handling procedures as well as being an effective people and team manager. Product knowledge is a must have. What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and well being at its center. You can expect: Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services Comprehensive leave benefits Gender Neutral Parental Leave Flexible working arrangements 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement Your key responsibilities: The Head of AML Investigations, Private Banking will report to the APAC Head of AML Investigations and Financial Crime Operations or delegated manager. Execution of transaction monitoring AML investigations for the assigned business and jurisdictions. Perform, support or manage autonomous AML reviews and investigations. Ensure and enhance the quality of transaction monitoring processes in the assigned business and jurisdiction. Coordinate and/or prepare the required management information reporting data for local, regional or global submission as applicable. Coordinate and work with local, regional and global AFC and Business personnel to ensure consistency in standards and policy implementation. Involvement in related change, technical and project work and user-acceptance tests where required. Provide input on key initiatives and other ad hoc projects as needed. Your skills and experience: 10-12 years relevant experience in an AML, Transaction Monitoring or Investigations role in a regulatory, audit or financial institution with sound technical skills and subject matter expertise with demonstrated hands-on experience. Familiarity with diverse banking products across business lines and experience in working on AML Monitoring and Case Management systems Strong communication, interpersonal and relationship management skills and an experienced people manager and developer. Norges Bank Investment Management is responsible for the management of the Government Pension Fund Global. Our client is seeking a dedicated and results-orientated Analyst to join the Performance Measurement team. Performance Measurement is part of the Investment Risk area and responsible for ensuring the fund can measure performance in a highly structured and consistent manner across manifold dimensions in a dynamic landscape. The team are responsible for the maintenance and further development of our capabilities in measurement and analysis of the fund's performance. This entails both regular reporting activities as well as developing specialist insight into the fund's investment areas and their activities. Our client works closely with the investment side to ensure a structured and precise measurement setup, produce analytical insight into developments, support governance functions around the investment setup. What you will do In your role, you will become specialist for the analysis and structure of an investment area and develop independent expertise and insight into relevant performance drivers. Additionally you will contribute to our regular reporting activities and governance workflows, and further enhance our insight into historical and current performance. You will further contribute to our cycle of continuous learning and enhancement of our capabilities, by researching and utilizing new analytical approaches, improving our toolset chain, and contributing towards projects and initiatives related to performance and connected systems. In your role you will also be exposed to many different aspects of investments risks. The position is located in Singapore and will report to the Head of Performance Measurement. Some travel may be required. Main responsibilities In close collaboration with the investment side, conducting performance measurement and analysis of specific investment teams/departments Generating new analytical insight into the drivers of performance and impact of investment decisions Improving existing and contributing to new technological solutions to enhance our automatization and analytical efficiency Proactive evaluate and streamline existing procedures by embracing technology, with a goal continuously improving productivity and analytical capabilities Contributing to recurring monitoring and reporting responsibilities In an agile and evolving environment, keeping on top of investment decisions and their implications Engaging with both Investment and Operational side of the fund to enhance our solutions and measurements What you need Master's degree in a financial, technological, or any quantitative discipline related skills with good academic records Able to collaborate and communicate with all parts of the organization and exhibit a high level of proficiency Possession of, or a solid interest to acquire, a thorough understanding of theoretical finance and the practical investment process Proven capability to handle and interpret quantitative data. Experience with data analytics and/or dashboarding using modern visualisation tools would be an ideal Prior experience in an investment risk or performance analysis role would be an ideal Ability to leverage analytical insight and our technological capabilities to expand our technology stack Programming skills (in particular R or Python) and/or database experience(SQL) would be an ideal Who you are Possess a structured and reflected approach towards problem solving Enjoy team achievements and like to help your colleagues succeed Actively seek out learning and growth opportunities, both individually and for the team Not afraid to speak up when noticing issues or flaws Feel motivated by continuous improvements of existing solutions High level curiosity and detail-oriented mindset with an eagerness to learn What our client offers Staying healthy - They care about your health! That's why they offer excellent health, mental and dental benefits, including a comprehensive insurance for you and your family. You'll also be offered health assessments, counselling services and reimbursement of gym membership fees. Spending time with family - Becoming a parent? Don't stress! You'll get 16 weeks, gender-neutral, full base pay, parental leave to spend with your child. Mothers get an additional 10 weeks of pregnancy related leave. Recharge when you need to - All employees get 25 vacation days, and one extra for the last week of the year Work-life balance - Our client believes that a healthy balance is crucial for your well-being. When you work here, you'll be able to combine an exciting career in the world's largest sovereign wealth fund with a fulfilling life outside the office. Of course, there are several social clubs and events within the fund too if you'd like to combine the two! Planning for the long term - They contribute 17% or 20% of base salary to your CPF or SRS. You can focus on the present and don't worry about the future. Work with Purpose - Our client work to safeguard and build financial wealth for future generations. Through responsible investment and active ownership, we help shape the future of our world. Job_Title: Talent Sourcing Specialist - luxury/consumer goods! You'll know these brands!!!
Job_Descriptions: Company Description Allegis Global Solutions is founded on a culture that is passionate about transforming the way the world acquires talent by delivering client-focused solutions that make a difference for businesses worldwide. From refining how you manage your contingent workforce to strengthening your employer brand to recruit top talent, our integrated talent solutions drive the business results you need. As an industry leader, we draw upon decades of experience to design innovative tools, products and processes. We develop competitive practices that position organizations for growth and we deliver the insight needed to succeed in today’s global marketplace. Job Description Due to AGS' partnership with Coty, we have a fabulous role for a recruiting/sourcing ninja to make their mark! You will execute sourcing strategies and plans focused on passive candidates, with the aim of achieving high quality, cost-effective and timely filling of roles. You will work closely with the onsite Recruitment Relationship Manager to provide input into sourcing strategy and real-time feedback on sourcing strategy effectiveness. Reporting to the Recruitment Operations Manager, you will assist in driving best practice sourcing strategies and strive to be an ambassador for the Allegis Global Solutions brand at every interaction. Responsibilities Implement agreed sourcing strategy, sourcing qualified candidates for open positions in a designated functional area of the client’s organization. Utilise a variety of sources in line with the client’s branding and social media policies with a focus on direct sourced (passive) candidates. Responsibility for being the first point of contact for candidates, delivering exceptional candidate care and ensuring that candidates are effectively pre-screened before inclusion into the recruitment process. Qualifying candidates for skill, cultural, and motivational fit, utilizing behavioral based approach and screening criteria defined by the client. Maintaining timely and accurate information on all candidate interactions in the database. Proactively pipelining talent and creating pre-qualified candidate talent pools in line with the client’s workforce plans. Maintaining contact with existing talent pool candidates to obtain and capture up to date market intelligence and briefing them on potential current and future opportunities. Assisting with development and implementation of candidate initiatives such as candidate newsletters, marketing campaigns, sourcing strategies, etc. Qualifications Prior experience sourcing and qualifying candidates for a variety of roles. Ability to source creatively from sources such as linkedin, job boards, associations, employee referral programs, social media, and internet searches. Demonstrated knowledge of technology (Boolean search logic, Outlook, Web, Excel, PowerPoint and Word). Recruiting experience in or knowledge within consumer good, retail, luxury, beauty, or equivalent sectors is advantageous. Tertiary qualification in business or a related discipline is highly desirable. Additional Information As a workplace, we focus on relationships – with each other, our clients and our candidates - in fact serving others is one of our core values. We support open communication and recognize that giving constructive criticism can be even harder than receiving it. We appreciate the fearless and the passionate, who force us to be better. Everything we do sits on a pillar of diversity - diverse perspectives, backgrounds and ideas drive innovation and make us successful. See what it’s like to work at AGS by searching #LifeAtAGS on any social network.

Job_Title: IT Support Analyst - Cross Products and Operations
Job_Descriptions: TD Bank Group Headquartered in Toronto, Canada, with more than 90,000 employees in offices around the world, The Toronto-Dominion Bank and its subsidiaries are collectively known as TD Bank Group (TD). TD offers a full range of financial products and services to more than 26.5 million customers worldwide through three key business lines: Canadian Retail including TD Canada Trust, Business Banking, TD Auto Finance, TD Wealth, TD Direct Investing, and TD Insurance U.S. Retail including TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank, TD Auto Finance, TD Wealth, and TD's investment in Schwab Wholesale Banking through TD Securities TD had C$1.7 trillion in assets as at July 31, 2021. TD also ranks among the world's leading online financial services firms, with approximately 15 million active online and mobile customers. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges under the symbol TD. In Singapore, TD operates as The Toronto-Dominion Bank, Singapore Branch and Toronto Dominion (South East Asia) Limited, which are collectively known as TD Singapore since 1979. The key business in Singapore is TD Securities which is part of Wholesale Banking. Position Summary: This role is primarily responsible for providing RTB (Run the bank) support for Cross Products and Operations applications in a 24x7 follow the sun global support environment. Duties and Accountabilities: The duties and accountabilities include but not limited to: Provide high quality application and user support to ensure IT systems availability, reliability, and performance that support business processes globally Perform proactive application health checks to prevent potential failures Manage the Incident through to completion. Engage various IT teams in resolving incidents efficiently and effectively. Perform effective problem management on recurring incidents. Lead and manage problems throughout the lifecycle. Ensure problem resolutions are released in production on-time and with high quality. Ensure all changes to the Production Environment follow the TD Securities Change management process. Ensure change activities are performed on time, minimizing risk to the service/business environment Proactively review IT environment to ensure that steps are taken to support new IT related regulations and address gaps in the procedure Perform scheduled activities such as DR testing, user attestations, remediation of control audit, etc. Update knowledge-based articles on timely manner and conduct trainings across regions. Develop and maintain relationships with Client(s), Relationship Managers and Project Managers. Work effectively as a team, supporting other team members in achieving project/ business objectives and providing client services. Support a positive work environment that promotes customer service, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest. Provide after- hours support if required Reporting: Responsible for ensuring Local Manager is kept current and apprised of all relevant risk management and controls issues. Responsible for ensuring a high level of communication and transparency with Local Manager. Responsible for escalating any operational issues to the Local Manager. Requirement: Degree in Engineering or Comp Science preferred or relevant industry experience Overall, at least 8 years of prior experience as Senior Analyst or having a development background in Investment banking industry. L1/L2 application support experience in regulatory technology, collateral management system, post-trade systems, settlements & payments applications domains. Experience in supporting critical, time sensitive and complex applications. Able to demonstrate effective engagement with the different technology partners in resolving issues. Support experience in messaging (Tibco, Solace, MQ), middleware, Java application server technologies. Experience in scripting, automation and process improvement. Experience in Unix, Linux, and Windows platforms. Experience in writing SQL (data retrieval/update/inserts) on any relational database system such as DB2 / Oracle / MS SQL Server. Handled batch applications & familiar with batch tools such as Autosys, CA7, and others. Nice to have : Development or support experience in Scala, Java, Angular Javascript, Cassandra, HDFS. Strong understanding of ITIL Incident Management, Problem Management and Change Management Very good written, oral and interpersonal communication skills Knowledge of financial securities. Inclusiveness: At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.

Job_Title: Head of Information Risk Management, Security and Governance
Job_Descriptions: Cyber Security and Information Risk Management Sets the vision, mission and strategy for Information Security across the enterprise. Responsible for overall planning, strategic development, implementation, and oversight of the IB's global information security program. Facilitate cyber security governance through the implementation of, and Chairing of, an Information Security Steering Committee or Advisory Board. Monitor the external threat environment for emerging threats and provide leadership and direction to the relevant stakeholders and the Senior Leadership Team. Provide strategic risk guidance to projects including the evaluation and recommendation of security controls, and in addition, manage the IT Departments risk exposure through formal risk management processes. Continuously improve and enhance the cyber security framework based on leading standards including COBIT5, ISO27001, CESG and NIST frameworks. Liaise with external agencies such as national and international law enforcement agencies, advisory bodies and intelligence sources, acting as the primary point of contact, and ensuring the needs of the IB are best served. Liaises with other IT Heads and IT Teams and General Affairs to assess risk exposure and vulnerability and take appropriate countermeasures IT Audit and Assurance Establishes the IT Annual Audit Plan, influencing and communicating with other IT Heads and business leaders the drivers for IT related audits and assessment. Work closely and with internal audit. Responsible for scoping all IT Audits and assurance exercises, working with staff and audit teams to coordinate all fieldwork, reviewing and finalizing all audit findings, and tracking and reporting on subsequent findings going forward. Builds strong relationships with internal and external auditors and maintains open and responsive channel between IT, General Affairs and the respective internal audit teams. Identifying and tracking performance of the departments capability to address relevant audit findings within reasonable timeframes. Reviews and updates the IT Audit universe that includes all types of compliance obligations, contractual requirements and existing and potential risks. Manages, conducts and oversees the review and assessment of third-party organizations in particular IT suppliers, to obtain assurance and due diligence on their ability to deliver the requisite quality to the IB. Reviewing third party attestation and IT audit reports to direct the organizations procurement of services. IT Disaster Recovery Leads all IT Disaster Recovery planning and design on behalf of the organization. Maintains and annual testing program of the IB's main Data Centre disaster recovery plan. Leads the global IT Disaster Recovery Team in the event of a disaster, coordinating with all stakeholders. Represents IT on the IB Crisis Management Team. IT Strategic Planning Plans all resources (physical, virtual, financial and human) to ensure the relevant strategic objectives within the area of cyber security, audit, disaster recovery, risk management are all delivered to the acceptable quality. Manage Information Security and Risk's annual budget and provide yearly planning. Defines the global strategy, objectives and delivery mechanisms for all Information Security, Audit & Assurance, IT Risk and IT Business Continuity. Requirements An Honours degree in Business or IT. A current, recognized, professional security management certification (e.g., Certified Information Security Manager CISM, or Certified Information Systems Auditor - CISA) is desired. A minimum of 15 years of IT experience, with at least 5 years working in a senior IT governance related role. Experience of setting and leading the delivery of an IT Security Strategy, Vision and Mission within a global enterprise. Experience of both forming and leading a Cyber Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT). Experience of undertaking audit and/or formal assessor related activities for organizations within the field of cyber security. Experience in performing audits, assurance work and self-assessments on behalf of an organization. Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential. Ability to rapidly comprehend the functions and capabilities of new trends and technologies. Proven ability to manage a budget. Ability to lead and motivate cross functional, interdisciplinary teams to achieve both tactical and strategic goals. Must possess poise and the ability to act calmly and competently in high-pressure, high-stress situations. Skilled in the management of cyber forensics, particularly the importance of maintaining forensic integrity during an investigation using suitable formal guidelines (e.g., Association of Chief Police Officers ACPO Guidelines for IT Forensic Investigations). Excellent communication skills (both written and oral). Excellent interpersonal skills, with all levels of management. Experience in enterprise security design preferably with Solaris, Linux, Windows, Azure, AWS, Salesforce, O365 and Oracle platforms. Very strong business relationship management, coupled with the ability to persuade, steer and convince senior business leaders on the approach to critical security matters. High level of personal integrity, as well as the ability to professionally handle confidential matters, and show an appropriate level of judgement and maturity. Good line management, influencing and ability to motivate a team. Ability to build and manage a good Security team.

Mandai Wildlife Group is dedicated to caring for the planet and protecting animals and nature. Conservation education is intrinsic in all interactions with the Group, to inspire action for a healthier world. Mandai Wildlife Group is the steward of Mandai Wildlife Reserve, a unique wildlife and nature destination in Singapore that is home to world-renown wildlife parks which connect visitors to the fascinating world of wildlife. The Group is driving an exciting rejuvenation plan at Mandai Wildlife Reserve, adjacent to Singapore's Central Catchment Nature Reserve, that will integrate five wildlife parks with distinctive nature-based experiences, green public spaces and an eco-friendly resort. Mandai Wildlife Group advocates for biodiversity, contributes leading wildlife research, develops innovative solutions to promote living sustainably, and collaborates with conservation partners in Singapore and Southeast Asia. The Group provides funding and in-kind support to Mandai Nature for conservation work across Southeast Asia. Mandai Global, an entity that is part of the Group, will establish and operate new lines of business anchored in creating positive outcomes for nature and wildlife. In our efforts to ensure a safe workplace, Mandai Wildlife Group implements the Vaccinate or Regular Test (VoRT) regime for team members who are not yet fully vaccinated. About Us VFlowTech (VFT) is reinventing energy storage with Vanadium redox flow technology, with a vision to develop the cheapest and most scalable Vanadium redox flow batteries in the world. VFT founders have deep experience in the renewable space, and Vanadium redox flow technology. VFT is a spin-off of the CleanTech lab of Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore, and benefits from unique IP arising from many years of intensive research at NTU. The Cloud Software Engineer must be able to work effectively in a collaborative, fast paced environment providing experience on energy storage systems. Design, Development, Testing and Maintenance of IoT Cloud Software stack in Energy Management Systems (EMS) and Battery Management System (BMS). You should be familiar with the operation of ESS (Energy Storage Systems) and implement various energy and battery management graphs and data display and will need to have passion for battery and energy management solutions. You should follow software development lifecycle practices including design and reviews, testing and regression, revision control, and user documentation. Requirements: Minimum Bachelor's Degree in computer/electronics engineering or relevant discipline with minimum 2 years of relevant professional development experience. Must have software development experience in C/C++, Python, JavaScript, NodeJS, JSON and SQL or other relevant programming languages. Experience with IOT cloud technology, instrumental monitoring, remote monitoring and IoT Device knowledge (Gateway, Sensor). You should have knowledge of communication interfaces and protocols, such as RS232, RS485, CAN, Modbus-TCP, Modbus-RTU, etc. Familiar in DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines You will be required to travel for business. Knowledge on battery technology would be ideal

Job_Title: AVP, Squad Lead, Digital Banking Technology, Group Technology
Job_Descriptions: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Be accountable end-to-end for the technology direction and leadership of the Squad, overseeing the adherence to technology, software development life cycle standards and policies, promoting a continuous improvement culture in the Squad Develop the teams and encourage knowledge sharing. Be responsibilities in terms of productivity, quality and delivery planning for the Squads Plan and orchestrate execution of the work Build a cohesive team. Provide inspiration, coaching, and feedback to team members, report back on progress to Tribe Leaders, and give input on people development and performance to relevant Tribe or Chapter Leaders Clear blockers and impediments, and eliminate waste for the Squad. Create a working environment where raising impediments can occur, and members are not afraid to raise risks and impediments. As a servant leader, the Squad Lead guides the team towards self-organization and cross-functionality. Encourages, supports, and enables the team to reach their full potential and abilities. Champion scrum principles at the Squad level, encouraging squad members to participate in scrum ceremonies, such as sprint planning, daily stand ups, sprint reviews and retrospectives, and feature planning. Facilitates the agile "way of working" in day-to-day activities, and helps the scrum ceremonies be purposeful and effective. Facilitates the continuous improvement process whereby members can drive various initiatives to improve the way they work. Support Product Owners in managing the backlog by organising and facilitating timely grooming sessions with the Squad. At least 10-12 years of working experience with 2-3 years in Delivery Management Good knowledge on Digital and Retail Banking domain Good communication skills and Agile understanding Knowledge and skills on Jira / Confluence Engagement with stakeholders Experience in Java/Jee/web technology Excellent knowledge of TeamSite/ LiveSite and content management. Overview At Esri, our business development managers collaborate with distributors to co-sell and promote the adoption of the ArcGIS platform. When you are not traveling throughout Asia Pacific you will be based in Esri’s Singapore office. Responsibilities Drive opportunities. Collaborate with staff, distributors, and the Asia Pacific sales team to create an opportunity development plan that provides clear direction for all software and services to customers or prospects in the AEC industry. Form a collaborative virtual team of staff, distributors, strategic partners, and integrators to support the development and execution of sales strategies. Think strategically. Develop a business development and sales strategy that employs direct and channel approaches to significantly expand the use of our solutions in Asia Pacific. Be an expert. Clearly articulate the strength and value of Esri technology as it relates to the AEC industry. Consistently conduct research and pursue professional development to ensure competitive knowledge. Use your innovative whiteboarding and presentation skills to support visual storytelling. Partner with distributors. Work with Esri’s distributors to demonstrate the value of our technology and solutions to customers and prospects through business case development, references, and ROI. Support distributors to increase the execution of sales activities to achieve internal business objectives. Co-develop proposals to respond to RFPs, RFIs, and tenders. Deliver results. Manage Esri’s agreements and deployed licenses. Ensure continued success of all Esri’s software deployments. Be familiar with Esri offerings in this market. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them. Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today’s volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more. About Us At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company. We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us! We are looking for a Senior Network Engineer to join our team. Cloudflare is building one of the largest, most resilient networks that spans over 250 cities spread across all regions and we plan to continue our expansion at a rapid pace. This position will be responsible for the technical operation and engineering of the Cloudflare network, including the planning, installation and management of the hardware and software as well as the day to day operations of the network. This is an opportunity to be part of the team that is building a high­-performance network that is accessible to any web property online. What Makes Cloudflare Special? We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet. Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost. Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one. 1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers. Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? About us At Hyphen Group we care about good engineering practices and great code as well as personal development, mentorship and an innovative mindset. We value skills, enthusiasm and a can do attitude more than past experiences, seniority or diplomas. We strive to expand the financial ecosystem in Asia by converting complex online financial systems into simple solutions, helping financial institutions accelerate their growth while improving millions of consumers financial health. In less than a year, we have processed more than 4 million transactions, and worked with over 150 financial institutions. What you will be doing We are developing an affiliate connect SaaS application called eKos, that will connect banks, trading platforms and financial institutions with thousands of influences and content creators. In your day to day work with us you will be a hands on QA lead for our eKos team: Analyze and document business, product and system requirements. Create QA strategy and test plans Implement system mocks Implement automated test cases Communicate need for quality assurance to stakeholders and developers Work proactively with the team to make sure we build a testable system Continuously suggest improvements to our ways of working, tech stack and products Automate everything that can be automated Take ownership of all project QA aspects and end results. Share your knowledge with the team and mentor people around you Work in a proactive and innovative way to meet milestones and deadlines Engage with the wider engineering organization, making sure your tech roadmap aligns with the other teams Work with product owners, developers, managers and business stakeholders to define the product and tech roadmaps Who we think you are Passionate about quality assurance On a journey of life long learning and upskilling. Solution and delivery oriented Excited about building things that make life easier for our affiliates and financial partners Loves to keep up to date with new technologies Enjoys having full ownership of what we build, designing, test and operate Allergic to repetitive tasks and strive to automate everything including deployment and testing Obsessed about security, observability and resilience Someone who puts people first and genuinely care about others around you Your skills Required: Ability and willingness to learn new things fast Strong fundamentals in Quality Assurance Strong ability to translate business requirements into test requirements Excellent skills in setting up and running test automation frameworks Master of writing automated test cases (Using Selenium or similar frameworks) Strong ability to create observability on the QA effort and test coverage Ability to generate useful test reports Expert in TDD Ability to see what can go wrong before it happens Ability to analyze the need for testing and communicate that to the team Ability to create a test strategy, test plan and test matrices. Strong understanding of software development work Ability to write scripts Understanding of agile team work Understanding of software development Strong understanding of product life cycle Preferred: Knowledge in performance testing Programming skills on any level Knowledge in cloud native systems and AWS Experience in working with event driven platforms What we offer The opportunity for your work to impact over 10 million people across the world every month Ownership & autonomy - You set your own limitations Career growth - Access to learning programs, 1:1 coaching, career planning, mentorship, onboarding program and working closely with exceptional developers Team offsites and events (Once we can travel again) Flexible / Asynchronous work environment to help you maintain a healthy work/life balance
