Job_Descriptions: MAIN PURPOSE Shiseido Travel Retail is a fast-growing organization, focusing on distribution within Duty Free Zones (Airports, Downtown Stores). This role plays a vital part to work closely with key stakeholders including Brand Holders, internal and regional teams as well as external vendors. Reporting to the Retail Design Manager, the Retail Design Senior Executive will be exposed to brands, under the SHISEIDO Group, and the opportunity for global experience and growth within the company. As a team member of Retail Design Centre, you will partner with Retail Design Manager in leading the design and development of the creative retail output for store design & visual merchandising. Collaborating with internal stakeholders, you will be responsible for brand's creative voice and strategy. Bringing to table the aligned concepts, adhered to brand guidelines to deliver clear and executional ideas from end to end. With the working style and ability to exercise a high degree of craft as you guide our brand look and feel to be fresh, yet consistent across all creative platforms. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Key focus is to ensure brand design equity is applied consistently across Regional Travel Retail locations With a clear understanding of the Brand Design Guidelines, work with regions on layouts and technical drawings (including 3D visualization if required) for further development of technical packages while overcoming site and material challenges with timely delivery of the projects. Assist Retail Design Manager in aligning store design and visual merchandising strategy Partner with Retail Design Manager and team members to develop and elevate the creative vision and direction of the brands Lead design, development and ensure latest brand guideline is consistently implemented across all channels and markets Provide guidance and support to ensure that project plans are realistic and enables timely opening/launch without compromising quality as per the team's expectation Generate quality technical build drawings for key projects with high level of accuracy for effective delivery of design and communication with internal stakeholders and brand holders. Maintain communication and exchanges with key internal stakeholders i.e brand holders, global marketing teams as well as regional project management teams to ensure alignment of proposed concepts adhere to brand guidelines and regional (travelers) shopper profiles and requirements. With a keen interest in digital to incorporate into both store design and visual merchandising concept deliveries for a physical store, while keeping in mind development and maintenance cost, consumer journey and interaction to result in consumer purchase. Work closely with internal stakeholders to develop bespoke outpost concept / which encapsulates the consumers O2O journey for an elevated onsite interaction and experience. Where applicable, to take risk and think out-of-box for a new way to attract and engage consumers. Be instrumental to develop store design and visual merchandising guidelines for regional adaptation. Vendor liaison briefing, costing and project management with external vendors on prototyping, digital and physical events managements. Ensure that designs can be achieved within the region's budget to deliver a heathy P&L. Take lead to manage regular update meetings, key stakeholders, on key projects, review issues and challenges with solution proposals. Maintain and update library for brand's fixtures designs, materials, and counter photos. Teamwork and clear project communication are expected, across a wide team of stakeholders which includes regional project managers and visual merchandisers, procurement and operations team, material suppliers and contractors. Cross-brand support within immediate team when required. KEY REQUIREMENTS Degree in Architecture, Interior Design or Industrial Design. At least 3 years of related working experience, in prestige beauty, or 5 years interior/retail design, preferably with luxury brands. Prior experience in Travel Retail environment will be an advantage. Proficient in design software such as Sketch up, AutoCAD, 3D Studio Max, Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and Microsoft Office. Able to work independently and multi-task to manage workload with tight timelines. Have an acute eye for detail and ensure high level of precision in managing design details. Clear and efficient communication and presentation skills with proficiency in spoken and written English and Mandarin (in order to liaise with Mandarin speaking counterparts) Excellent organization skills with ability to prioritize and plan to ensure timely delivery. Ability to collaborate effectively with multiple stakeholders. Be open to feedback and ability to turnaround deliverables by stipulated timelines. Solution-orientated.

Job_Descriptions: Job Description The Singapore Academy of Law (“SAL”) is a promotion and development agency for Singapore’s legal industry. Our vision is to make Singapore the legal hub of Asia. The Singapore Mediation Centre (“SMC”) is a subsidiary of the Academy. Established in 1997, SMC pioneered the use of mediation as the mainstream mechanism for dispute resolution, as well as training in negotiation and conflict management. Today, SMC offers a suite of alternative dispute resolution services which brings clarity and objectivity to complex situations. These services include mediation, adjudication, neutral evaluation and domain name dispute resolution. Through our panel of professional mediators with legal and industry expertise, SMC is well-placed to manage difficult negotiations and unlock standstills for businesses by providing cost-effective and timely solutions. At SMC, our vision is to help all businesses fully appreciate the value of mediation as a strategic risk-management tool that they can count on in commercial dealings. Responsibilities: You will support the administration of cases by managing the financial aspects of case files that are administered by SMC’s Registry team. This includes, but not limited to, SMC’s core services for Mediation and Adjudication. You will require familiarity with using SMC’s inhouse enterprise resource planning software – Business Central – to create customer cards, input data and generate invoicing (including e-invoicing) for case files. You will be required to liaise closely with the Finance department on invoicing, receipts, and other financial aspects between SMC’s Registry team and the Finance department. You may also be required to undertake other ad hoc duties in relation to the financial aspects of case files as and when required (e.g. collection and dispatch of cheques/documents). Requirements: Have familiarity with Business Central and MS Office. Be meticulous and organized, possess initiative, and are able to multitask to meet deadlines. Preferably have work experience related to Finance and/or Accounting. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Headquartered in Singapore with offices in Germany, Ukraine, and India, Affinidi empowers Data Owners like you and me to control and selectively share our verifiable credentials through decentralized technologies. Affinidi, along with Trustana and GoodWorker, are separate entities under the LemmaTree Group, founded and funded by Temasek, a global investment firm. Affinidi partners with governments and stakeholders within the travel and aviation, healthcare, and technology space to build a trusted ecosystem that enables safe travels across the globe through Affinidi Travel. We also deploy decentralized technology and verifiable credentials to global businesses within financial services, to redefine the way they serve organizations and individuals, through Affinidi Finnovate. As an employer, we’re more than just a workplace. We believe in the strength of our diversity of thoughts and experiences. We love the journey as much as the destination, and we love belonging to a team that prides itself on mutual respect. If you're passionate about decentralised technologies, we’d love to speak with you. We’re on a search for a Senior Design Researcher with the following attributes: Critical Thinking - You are able to skillfully conceptualise, apply, analyse and evaluate information gathered from observation, experience or communication and use it as a guide to action. Data Driven attitude - You often propose solutions or make a point in a logical and objective manner, substantiated with accurate data and evidence. Design thinking - You are able to derive innovative and practical solutions to solve problems faced by users, sometimes even before they realise there are problem. Customer Focus - You are dedicated to meeting customers’ expectations, and can establish and maintain effective customer relationships. Creativity/Innovation - You can be trusted to come up with new, unique and wild ideas and are often seen as original and value-adding in brainstorming settings. If you’ve also got other attributes that you’re really proud of, share them with us! What’s in it for you: You will get an opportunity to own and design a robust research process, while championing user needs and intuition for customer-centricity, working closely with designers and product managers. You will: Work closely with Product Managers, Product Designers and leaders to identify and prioritise research opportunities Propose and run research projects end-to-end through qualitative and quantitative methods to generate data and insights Design research frameworks that spells customer-centric thinking and improve on research templates, guides, processes to evaluate studies Balance research rigour with needs from product roadmap and storytell research findings through presentations, artefacts, frameworks to stakeholders, and suggest design recommendations You’ll be a great match if you: Are able to run summative and formative research studies within agile environment, identifying research opportunities and managing strategy while fulfilling product goals Speak truth to power fulfilment of user needs and building better products Are able to compile well-documented research findings to deliver meaningful and actionable insights to both internal and external stakeholders Are a natural problem solver, cutting through complexity and ambiguity to deliver simplified solutions Loves working towards self-development and winning as a team in a high-growth environment Bonus points if you: Have a strong interest in Web 3.0 and decentralized technologies as well as being passionate about great products and customers. Have been involved and built design research frameworks Have developer-facing research experience Equal Opportunity Statement Our company embraces diversity in all of its forms and fosters an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us. We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

Location: Jtc Launchpad @ One-North, Queenstown, Singapore, Central Region
Job_Descriptions: Job Description We are looking to host solution-minded student to embark their internship journey with us. Here’s your chance to create a journey with us. Come join our medical start-up. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is a medical start-up developing an advanced machine vision tracking system for the management of Overactive Bladder (OAB). Our goal is to design and develop a proprietary diagnostic tool to analyze real-time images of the bladder. The diagnostic tool will help pinpoint unusual muscle group activity to help in the treatment of OAB. We need passionate and flexible engineers to grow with us. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is incubated by Trendlines Medical Singapore Pte Ltd. Project Name: Deep-Learning architecture development involving 2D and 1D vascular datasets such as specklegram / photoplethysmogram biosignals for polymorphic determination in cardiometabolic diseases Background: Worldwide, a third of adults suffer from some form of Cardiovascular disease (CVD) which annually contribute to the deaths of 17.7 million people globally, accounting for 31% of total deaths. In comparison, the combined annual deaths resulting from HIV/Aids, malaria, and tuberculosis combined only amount to 3.86 million. Hypertension affects at least 25% of the global adult population and is the most common cause of CVD-related deaths due to associated secondary pathologies. There is also a significant association of hypertension with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) with hypertension being twice as frequent in diabetic sufferers compared to non-diabetics. By 2050, Singapore projects that there will be 1 million sufferers of diabetes, accounting for 10% of the disease burden in Singapore. Disease prediction solely from genotyping has resulted in poor associations due to unexpected multi-nomic interactions. Scope: This project proposal seeks to apply advanced Machine Learning (ML) or Deep Learning (DL) algorithms on 1D/2D datasets to identify potential pleiotropic relationships in cardiometabolic diseases. We will also evaluate the predictive performance and accuracy of various AI-ML algorithms. The objective is to develop an advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) architecture extracting critical features from the pulsatile morphology of 1-Dimensional PPG signals or 2D vascular videos to form an adaptive numerical model of an individual. Due difficulty in acquiring real-world biosignal datasets, novel techniques will need to be implemented to address the limited data available for training such as autonomous semi-supervised neural network designs. The project will involve 1D/2D signal processing and deep learning and will require strong knowledge in Python programming. Application Deadline: 1 May 2022 Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

COMPANY INTRODUCTION We are an independent leading global provider of trust, fiduciary, corporate and fund services to mostly corporate but also high-net-worth clients (www.amicorp.com). We are a Hong Kong based Group with an international network of 40+ offices in over 30 countries. We aim to provide a safe and stable working environment for our employees, we promote environmental consciousness, and contribute positively to the communities in which we are active; we are also soundly profitable. We are proud to have our global team of 700+ specialists who contribute their individual talents to Amicorp's broad range of expertise and experience. They implement creative, innovative, strategic and compliant corporate solutions to meet the challenges of today's complex international business environment. We are international, independent, entrepreneurial and growing fast . We offer a fast paced, dynamic, international work environment , we value people with initiative, creativity, and drive , and we offer market competitive compensation. PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES ? Manage a portfolio of Trusts and Corporate entities. Produce all necessary legal documents required for managing day to day matters of Trusts and Corporate entities (e.g. letters, trustee resolutions, deeds of amendments, etc.). Be responsible for managing the relationship, legal, administrative and banking matters of a portfolio of trusts and companies in accordance with applicable legislation and internal procedures. ? Conduct regular reviews of each entity in the portfolio through liaising effectively with clients, trustees, intermediaries and legal counsel, and processing request and servicing the client in a responsible professional and efficient manner ? Ultimately responsible for the quality of the client files. Responsible for all legal, regulatory and trust matters for portfolio under management. (i.e. Review trust related documents and ensure that subsequent to the establishment of a trust, all required documents and agreements are prepared and proper physical and electronic files are completed). ? Legal research and analysis for structuring different variations of the Trusts and Commercial entities currently offered by the office. Provide pragmatic solutions and legal analysis for implementing trust and commercial structures (problem solver in transfer-in, problems with beneficiaries, weak deeds, special requests, international tax matters, keeping in mind the Group business goals. Obtain all necessary reviews and opinions in order to obtain feasibility and legality. ? Manage client relationships, operational risk, service level agreements and coordination of client deliverable, always ensuring that the client operates within the relevant legal/regulatory framework. Develop, maintain and expand voice and face contact with clients and the intermediaries working for target clients, especially high net worth individuals/ families; and ensure that all stakeholders are serviced well. ? Ensure adherence to and ongoing analysis of Amicorp's 4-Pillar approach in particular compliance, legal and corporate services, transaction monitoring and tax and transparency. ? Achieve financial chargeability targets, ensure effective monitoring of transactions, handle pricing, invoicing and solve payment issues and collection of invoice and outstanding fees for the portfolio of clients. ? Anticipate and manage the impact of any emerging regulatory, taxation or legal changes and ensure compliance related risk addressed on behalf of the client. ? Support the Local Management Team, Client Acceptance Committee (CAC) and Compliance to find commercial solutions to onboarding and on-going client administration/service as appointed member of the CAC. ? Ensure that Know Your Customer rules are adhered to and that client operates within the framework. Comply with all internal procedures regarding the correct use of automated programs for recording all required client and company data. Maintain up-to-date local office policies and procedures in alignment with local regulations and requirements. ? Act as a trusted advisor to the client and adhere to the regular client contact/ communication guidelines set by the Company, aimed at building personal and long-term relationship with the clients. OTHER DUTIES ? Undertake the role of director, trustee, nominee, manager, partner, secretary, authorized signatory or any related position in internal entities or client entities of Amicorp Group, where necessary and required by the Management. ? Undertake such other duties, related to the position, as may from time to time be agreed with Management. CANDIDATE PROFILE ? Relevant Bachelor Degree and other relevant professional Trust related qualifications. STEP qualification in trust and tax would be highly advantageous. ? At least 4 years of experience working with trust/ estate law, ideally with a business in a similar industry. ? Good understanding of key financial services and industry related legislation. Familiar with international requirements - e.g. CRS, FATCA, BEPS, GAAR, ESR, that affects the Trustee and the use of trusts by clients in target markets. ? Strong commercial mindset, takes initiative, positive and proactive, dedicated, focused and revenue and target driven. ? Excellent organizational, interpersonal and communication skills. ? Excellent client facing skills. Well-developed spoken and written communication skills and the ability to tailor style to relevant audiences, and successfully liaise with people at different levels. ? Excellent English language fluency; additional languages preferred. ? Strong analytical and problem solving skills, solution driven, highly organized and detailorientated with good decision making and time management skills. Independent, hands-on and takes accountability to deliver solutions and results. ? Ability to adapt and work in a smaller, dynamic local team environment; along with being part of a bigger matrix organization. Proven team player skills, with ambition to excel in the role. ? Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission. The Device Partner Sales (DPS) team plays a critical role in achieving this mission. We build, market and sell intelligent edge and intelligent cloud devices and solutions with partners, including OEMs, device distribution channels, original design manufacturers, and Silicon providers. We work closely with our device ecosystem and internal business groups to build devices that consume our cloud, innovate with device partners, and transform how we sell devices and services with partners. Opportunities in DPS are expansive because we span the entire product lifecycle -- from incubation, prototyping, and portfolio planning to the design-in, sell-in, and sell-through motions that help our partners engage consumers, students, and businesses worldwide. As a member of our team, you'll be part of growing a multi-billion-dollar business, charting new areas of innovation, and contributing to our partnership engagements that build, market and launch devices and solutions worldwide. You will also be part of a people-first culture leading with inclusion and values that supports a growth mindset, diversity, and inclusion. If that appeals to you, it's an exciting time to be here in DPS. #MSFTDPS, #MSFTGPS The Opportunity You will be working with one of Microsoft's largest and most strategic global partners. The Regional Marketing Manager for Asia Pacific, Japan and China (APJC) leads our co-marketing strategy with this partner across a key region with a focus on strategies and programs that: 1) support the growth of core business metrics, 2) accelerate our business transformation focused on growing device and subscription metrics related to the Microsoft Cloud and 3) set examples in Asia that can be exported globally in order to help our partner and customers realize their full potential around the world! Strategic Planning Represent Microsoft as the strategic marketing lead across all levels of the Partner organizations. Articulate and land Microsoft's short- and long-term marketing strategies and programs, negotiating maximum value for Microsoft while striving for high Customer/Partner satisfaction. Land Marketing investments effectively with Partner in alignment with Microsoft strategy and solution areas Oversee the design and implementation of Partner marketing plans at the regional and subsidiary level to ensure maximum business impact in a fully compliant manner. (MNA and Marketing lead create the plans at local level.) Develop and land a regional marketing strategy aligned with region partner BDMs priorities, and ROI monitoring, in support of the sales strategy. Identify and drive regional partner-specific marketing opportunities, understanding WW and regional competitive landscape. Partner closely with regional channel executive to align marketing strategy and priorities with sales priorities. Lead programmatic definition of highly targeted investments and campaigns, working closely with partner to help execute, sharing best practices and successful strategies. Business Operational Excellence Deliver excellence in budget planning and management, owning the rhythm of business checkpoints both internally and externally to ensure shared metrics accountability and proactive course correction as needed. Help land and execute key experiential and transactional marketing campaigns with our Partners to drive sales across our product portfolio in parallel, empower the field execution team with the right amount of strategic guidance and coaching. Drive business management excellence and compliance in managing all marketing investments. Cross Group Collaboration Partner closely with local contacts (marketing managers, channel executives) to manage investments and campaigns. Become the customer advocate for our Partners within the DPS division and the Windows Business Group, evangelizing their products, marketing plans, initiatives, and results to cross-organizational stakeholders, as appropriate. Insights and Analysis Identify trends in partner and competitor activity to anticipate long-term needs and potential risks in order to propose appropriate high impact creative marketing solutions tackle complex marketing challenges and problem solve using solid business rationale. Uses advanced data research to find customer and competitive insights that are not self-evident and that inform scenarios and/or marketing strategy. Tests insights to validate authenticity, extensibility, and predictability. Diversity & Inclusion: To realize our mission to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more, each and every one of us must help create a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full and authentic self, where all voices are heard, and where we do our best work as a result. With this priority, personally commit to be an active and intentional participant in creating a diverse and inclusive Microsoft. people and organizational capabilities across sales, marketing, and category, attracting and developing talent. Compliance: Personally commit to generating and protecting Microsoft resources and trust by modeling integrity every day and contributing to ethical sales and sustainable growth. required experience: substantial, demonstrable senior marketing experience with an outstanding track record of results channel/partner ecosystem experience spanning commercial, consumer and cloud categories strong track record of working closely with partners strategic thinking: ability to define a vision, set goals, objectives, and work across virtual teams and microsoft organizations to achieve well defined outcomes technical marketing skills, cloud marketing required digital marketing experience, including data driven analysis drive for results: able to focus on achieving concrete business results through marketing execution during the fiscal year customer focused, responsive, and action oriented, while maintaining a positive, professional image of microsoft. passion for technology and cloud services this position requires domestic and international travel asian language fluency a definite plus this position requires domestic and international travel

Job_Title: Mindshare | Senior Media Planning Manager Singapore, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Description Position at Mindshare Overview of job Mindshare is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for an integrated Senior Account Manager to join us. As an integrated Senior Account Manager, you'll have responsibility for running a portfolio of high-profile multinational brands, with services scope focused on communications, planning and media campaign implementation management. There is frequent client contact. In this role, you will manage & oversee all aspects of client’s advertising to meet client objectives and be the primary point of contact for clients and other internal specialised units for your assigned accounts. Reporting of the role This role reports to the Business Director 3 best things about the job: Joining a dynamic and multicultural team Opportunity to work on one of the world’s most respected brands An experienced high-flying team who know how to get the job done and have fun Measures of success – In three months: On boarded onto the key accounts with full induction/training into all of the other facets of the business such as trading, specialised services (internal and within GroupM). Built good relationships with your team and helped them deliver even better work Gained the trust and respect of the clients In six months: Established yourself as a trusted advisor with designated clients, as reflected in formal client feedback/review Managed and delivered effective campaigns and showed strategic leadership Be able to identify opportunities to drive innovation and efficiencies for the client In 12 months: Become an integral part of the core team and a valued member of the agency The proof of your success will be clients’ satisfaction and increasing business profit / commercial results Responsibilities of the role: Taking client briefs and managing them through planning through to buying, delivery and execution, to post campaign reports and billing Oversee and quality control of media monitoring, proof of performance, campaign optimization, and post-analysis to ensure client objectives are met Anticipate, review and present point-of-views on media trends, issues, developments, and opportunities Develop and maintain a strong relationship with clients and have a good understanding of our client's business Develop and maintain a good relationship with key media vendors and internal teams Managing senior executive or executive to ensure their continued development What you will need: Minimum 3-4 years relevant experience in a media or advertising agency Experienced in a client-facing role Comfortable on high profile accounts that require resilience and high EQ – e.g luxury, technology and finance Strong digital and performance background Analytical and calm under pressure Organized, operationally efficient, and passionate about advertising Looking for a new challenge and a step up in your career A positive attitude can take guidance and be proactive More about Mindshare We were born in Asia in 1997, a start up with a desire to change the media world. Now we are a global agency with more than 7,000 employees in 116 offices across 86 countries, operating as one team - #teammindshare. We believe that in today’s world, everything begins and ends in media. We aim to be our clients’ lead business partner, to grow their business, and drive profitability through adaptive and inventive marketing. We do this through speed, teamwork and provocation and by operating as a network of networks rather than a rigid hierarchy. We create new things and have fun doing it. Whenever and wherever you join us, you open a door to opportunities in any and of all aspects of media, technology and innovation. We will support you, recognize you and reward you, making Mindshare the place where you do the best work of your career. Mindshare APAC has won 500 awards in the last year alone, including “Agency Network of the Year 2017” by both the MMA SMARTIES™ and Campaign Asia for the fifth and third consecutive year, respectively. Mindshare is part of GroupM, the media investment management arm of WPP, the world’s leading communications services group. To learn more about Mindshare and our philosophy of Original Thinking, visit us at www.mindshareworld.com and follow us on Twitter @mindshare and facebook.com/mindshareapac and linkedin.com/company/mindshare. More about GroupM Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment. GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.

Description Position at Mindshare Overview of job Mindshare is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for an integrated Account Director to join us. As an integrated Account Director, you'll have responsibility for running a portfolio of high-profile multinational brands, with services scope focused on communications, planning and media campaign implementation management. team on best practices, innovation and work processes Champion the growth and development of Agency services beyond media planning and buying Work with internal specialist resources and group resources Managing and developing your direct reports What you will need: Minimum 7 years of client servicing experience in a reputed media agency environment Experienced in integrated planning, well versed in digital planning, strategy and trouble shooting Comfortable on high profile accounts that require resilience and high EQ – e.g luxury, technology and finance Experience working with multiple stakeholders, e.g. suppliers, advertising/marketing agencies, media owners and internal specialist resources Able to effectively communicate the benefit of marketing opportunities and sell concepts / solutions to clients and key stakeholders Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with your team Exhibit drive and initiative Produce work of high quality Adaptable to the changing environment Demonstrate sharp, strategic & critical thinking and effective problem solving skills Experience driving revenue growth with emerging opportunities and established partnerships More about Mindshare We were born in Asia in 1997, a start up with a desire to change the media world. Now we are a global agency with more than 7,000 employees in 116 offices across 86 countries, operating as one team - #teammindshare. We believe that in today’s world, everything begins and ends in media. We aim to be our clients’ lead business partner, to grow their business, and drive profitability through adaptive and inventive marketing. We do this through speed, teamwork and provocation and by operating as a network of networks rather than a rigid hierarchy. We create new things and have fun doing it. Whenever and wherever you join us, you open a door to opportunities in any and of all aspects of media, technology and innovation. We will support you, recognize you and reward you, making Mindshare the place where you do the best work of your career. Mindshare APAC has won 500 awards in the last year alone, including “Agency Network of the Year 2017” by both the MMA SMARTIES™ and Campaign Asia for the fifth and third consecutive year, respectively. Mindshare is part of GroupM, the media investment management arm of WPP, the world’s leading communications services group. To learn more about Mindshare and our philosophy of Original Thinking, visit us at www.mindshareworld.com and follow us on Twitter @mindshare and facebook.com/mindshareapac and linkedin.com/company/mindshare. More about GroupM Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment. GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.

Job_Title: MediaCom | Director, Systems Intelligence Singapore, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Description Position at MediaCom MediaCom is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company, and is a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for a Director, System Intelligence to join us on our newly coveted partnership with The Coca Cola company. Reporting of the role This role reports to the Head of Systems Intelligence, Asia-Pacific (data science/analytics) 3 best things about the job: Opportunity to work directly with the world’s biggest brands on high profile advanced analytics consulting and implementation projects regionally and globally A fun, flexible work environment that combines the best of entrepreneurialism whilst at the same time being part of the largest marketing services group in the world Working within a proven, high performing team with an excellent network of support and development opportunities within MediaCom-GroupM and WPP Responsibilities of the role: Manage project quality and timely delivery on diverse econometric and quantitative marketing/media consultancy projects Collaborate with multi-functional project teams of data engineers, statisticians, media strategists, and media planners to successfully deliver projects Fulfills our commitment to advanced analytical measurement including the application of AI and ML to improve media decision making, alongside our Systems Intelligence team. Ability to tell data-driven decision support stories by collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data Combine statistical results with strategic thinking and business requirements to create cohesive stories and actionable results for clients Build effective working relationships with the Systems Intelligence team and wider MediaCom What you will need: 8+ years of experience in marketing analytics, digital media, business intelligence, reporting, or related field(s) Expertise in some or all the following is highly desirable Programming languages: R, Python Database/Cloud platforms: SQL, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, AWS Visualisation tools: Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio, Tableau, Datorama Web analytics: Google Analytics 360, Adobe Analytics Experience of managing analytics teams consisting of at least 2-3 team members In-depth practical and theoretical knowledge of machine learning for predictive modeling and analytical techniques would be a strong advantage Experience with advanced analytic techniques, such as factor analysis, predictive modeling, logistic regression, and cluster analysis, segmentation, attitudinal/motivational analysis, concept/copy testing, sales forecasting, advertising effectiveness, consumer profiling, attribution modeling, and market mix, and ROI measurement Knowledge on harmonizing CRM, 1st party and 3rd party data from multiple sources to harness valuable insights using ad tech and data harmonization tools Strong attention to detail, highly entrepreneurial, open-minded, persistent and highly collaborative Superior written, presentation, analytical, quantitative, and verbal skills You should be culturally flexible and enjoy working with teams from across different countries and be comfortable traveling if required Strong PowerPoint skills, advanced Microsoft Excel to manipulate and analyze data make a difference. More about MediaCom Hello. We are MediaCom. We believe in People First, Better Results. MediaCom unleashes brands’ growth by helping them See the Bigger Picture. This means that we apply our unique ‘Systems Thinking’ philosophy and technology to all marketing levers: media, message and data. As a result, we design communication strategies that deliver short term results and help brands build for the future. As part of WPP, the world's largest marketing communications services group, and GroupM, WPP’s consolidated media investment management arm, we have access to the richest data, most robust benchmarks and most advanced capabilities in the market. This helps us provide comprehensive solutions to all marketing challenges. Our success is underpinned by our long-standing ‘People First, Better Results’ belief. We know that by investing in our people’s whole-person wellbeing, careers and capabilities, we will help grow our clients’ businesses. In 2020 this approach led MediaCom to be crowned Global Media Network of the Year by Eurobest and Festival of Media Global, in addition to being the most awarded agency at the WARC Media Awards. MediaCom is one of the world’s leading media communications specialists, with billings of US$17.6 billion (Source: COMvergence, 2020), employing 8,000 people in 125 offices across 100 countries. Its global client roster includes adidas, Coca-Cola (TCCC), Dell, Groupe PSA, Hasbro, Mars, NBC Universal, P&G, Richemont, Shell, Sony, Uber and Walgreens Boots Alliance. To find out more about MediaCom visit us here: www.mediacom.com About GroupM Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment. GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.

Description Position at GroupM Services Overview of the Job The GroupM Services team adopt a collaborative and customer-centric approach in delivering high value and innovative solutions for our Agencies and Agencies’ clients, including the activation and execution of dynamic media campaigns. We are currently looking for a Manager, Performance to join us. You will be responsible to oversee the entire end to end of campaign management process to support GroupM agencies and clients. GroupM Services teams. The Campaign Delivery team ensures that comprehensive briefs are received from the Agency teams and ensures that GroupM Services specialists meet clients’ expectations by achieving campaign KPI’s timely and through embedding operational excellence. They are also supporting the delivery of tasks such as reporting output, offer insights and recommendations across strategic planning and agency pitches. In this role, you will be responsible to manage the biddable operations for the brand for the Japan market and be the single point of contact for internal stakeholders. You will be responsible for achieving campaign deliveries, troubleshooting campaign issues, providing key insights, recommending biddable strategy. Reporting of the role This role reports to the Head of Social, GMS 3 best things about the job: Opportunity to work for some of the biggest global brands, pioneering Performance marketing Working with an extremely diverse, international group of individuals both at the agency and at the client Opportunity to expand the learning on Digital technology & platforms, High visibility and at the client where your work is sure to be seen & appreciated. Measures of success – In three months: Become knowledgeable of the client’s business, ways of working, key client teams and internal teams, and the brand objectives for 20-21 Seamlessly running operations on biddable platforms like Facebook, Twitter and understand & implement the tracking and tagging process on Google Campaign Manager, MOAT, DAR, etc. Understand client’s processes & liaise with market planners to shape media plans on a monthly basis as per aligned strategies/direction Clear understanding of reporting requirements and ensure timely reporting to the global team for taking effective decisions Regularly attend weekly/monthly calls with internal teams & clients providing status and updates on live local market plans, highlight issues or best practices, next steps/recommendations, if any. Engage regularly with Search team to get learnings and build cross platform strategies In six months: Establish ways of working with planning team and become the go to person for all biddable requirements both internal and external (global client) stakeholders; Be on top of campaigns that are currently live in markets and share industry best practices or suggestions to improve the performance further Connect with the platform teams regularly from Facebook, Twitter, etc. to discuss campaign performance & issues, learn about new alphas/betas, align test and learn plans to achieve best-in-class results for the brand Continually building test and learn frameworks across all platforms, ensuring tests reach significance where learnings / next steps can be communicated to clients. Regularly liase with the internal planning and performance team to share positive results or recommend new properties as part of the learning and scale up plan for other markets Gain trust and confidence of all relevant stakeholders – global and local client teams and in markets teams In 12 months: Guiding planning teams on the campaign output, prepare and present media recommendations for ongoing client communication plans to senior global clients for approval/ feedback Exceeding client KPIs across all campaigns and help to grow business by suggesting new ideas and services to the biddable/market leads Responsibilities of the role: Day to day business management - Work across all aspects of the biddable business for client, campaign operations, regular analysis of live campaigns, raise any alarms in case of any issues, recommending new products Biddable Excellence – Ensuring gold class delivery on campaign while following the excellence frameworks and best practices followed by the brand Network Management - Learning how to work with multiple markets and cultures and developing a good relationship with agency and client teams across the region and globe. Planning Input - Understand the client’s objectives and recommend appropriate biddable plan basis the brief Lead biddable operations of Japan business and effectively manage & optimize campaigns wrt budgets, targeting, bid strategies, etc. to achieve the KPI Analyze Competitor’s activity & keep a lookout for industry/category trends to recommend the right course of action Contribution to the campaign strategies from a biddable perspective Weekly/Monthly calls with internal client team on campaign performance and align on any recommendations Reporting – Timely reporting for all biddable platforms like Facebook, Twitter, Campaign Manager, Analytics, etc. to the market teams and the client to take the right decisions. Team Development: Share regular updates on new products or positive campaign results with larger team so that other markets can also adopt the learnings What you will need: 3 - 5 years of operational experience across Biddable platforms Facebook Blueprint Certifications, LinkedIn Certification is good to have Well versed in using at least the Facebook and LinkedIn native ad platforms – any 3rd party platforms like Sprinklr is a bonus Experience in implementing high-volume campaigns across Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn & managing campaign tracking across Google Campaign Manager, MOAT, DAR, Nielsen, etc. Up-to-date knowledge of best-in-class practices in digital marketing Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail around data, insights and actions Excellent communication skills and teamwork, to liaise with different market teams across APAC Proficient in excel and PowerPoint About GroupM GroupM leads and shapes media markets by delivering performance enhancing media products and services, powered by data and technology. Our global network agencies and businesses enable our people to work collaboratively across borders with the best in class, providing them the opportunity to accelerate their progress and development. We are not limited by teams or geographies; our scale and diverse range of clients lets us be more adventurous with our business and talent. We give our talent the space, support and tools to innovate and grow. Discover more about GroupM at www.groupm.com Follow @GroupMAPAC on Twitter Follow GroupM on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/groupm About Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Job_Title: GroupM | Senior Analyst Risk and Controls, APAC Singapore, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Description Overview of job GroupM is the world’s largest media investment company and is a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for a Senior Analyst Risk and Controls to join the regional team. In this role, you will be working under the guidance of Regional Risk and Control to ensure that WPP policies and procedures are adhered to, and advise on actions required to meet objectives, supporting the implementation of agreed solutions and the monitoring progress made. At GroupM APAC, our people are our strength, which is why fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion is important to us. Reporting of the role This role reports to APAC Manager, Risk and Control 3 best things about the job: You will have regional market exposure and the opportunity to travel This will be an exciting experience for you to grow in your career and be independent in your role – your voice will be heard There is great flexibility in this role In this role, your goals will be: In 3 months: Familiar with the WPP’s Control framework (Internal Control over Financial Reporting, ICFR), key WPP and GroupM policies Familiar with the Compliance system used by the region Be the first layer of regional review on the Compliance reporting submission from markets to ensure timeliness and accuracy Review the appropriateness of the markets remediation on the ICFR audit findings, work with the market to have proper closure in the system Work closely with markets to ensure compliance with WPP and GroupM processes and procedures In 6 months: Monitor and provide guidance in implementing an effective ICFR with the country Perform independent review of ICFR documentation on markets assigned to ensure effectiveness on the ICFR controls Provide guidance to markets on risk & controls matters Manage and participate in the opening and/or closing meeting with outsourced ICFR auditor Perform periodic training to assigned markets to ensure process adherence to ICFR standards. Effectively coordinate with the process owners to implement process controls and documentation requirements and implement corrective actions to plug control gaps. Coordinate management responses and action plans for internal audit issues In 12 months: Work with the country on the annual Business risk exercise and Declaration of Interests Be the first point of contact on assigned market queries on risk & controls matters Establish strong working relationships with key stakeholders across APAC countries Closely work with IT in system enhancement projects, Coordinate and prepare user requirement specification and facilitate transformation process - Manual to Automation What you’ll bring: Being proactive and taking ownership of your tasks. Independent with less supervision and ability to work under pressure. Good communication and stakeholder management skills. Able to think big picture on risk area and provide out-of-the-box solutions. Problem solving, proactive in escalating issues, and recommending and implementing corrective actions Being practical, analytical, and able to voice your opinion to challenge the norm for enhancement or best practice Strong support to the direct reporting line Minimum qualifications: Degree holder in Accounting/ Finance At least 3 - 4 years of relevant experience in SOX/ ICFR, internal/external audit, prior experience in the Big 4 companies and Commercial will be an added advantage. Excellent command of written and verbal English communication skills Ability to read and communicate in Mandarin as you will be working with China, Taiwan Ability to travel within APAC regions More about GroupM GroupM leads and shapes media markets by delivering performance-enhancing media products and services, powered by data and technology. Our global network agencies and businesses enable our people to work collaboratively across borders with the best in class, providing them the opportunity to accelerate their progress and development. We are not limited by teams or geographies; our scale and diverse range of clients lets us be more adventurous with our business and talent. We give our talent the space, support and tools to innovate and grow. Discover more about GroupM at www.groupm.com Follow @GroupMAPAC on Twitter Follow GroupM on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/groupm About Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry that is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients and media owners. As the largest media investment management company in Singapore with over 41% market share (Recma) and over 650 employees, GroupM Singapore is the premier organization to join and develop a career in.

Job Description Lazada Group is pioneering e-Commerce across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2012, Lazada Group has grown to become the leading online shopping and selling destination in Southeast Asia. The company has 5,500 + employees in the region, with operations in Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam, and a team in Hong Kong that drives cross-border marketplace activities. Lazada’s strong performance led to the acquisition of a majority stake by Alibaba Group in April, 2016. Given our tremendous growth, we are searching for dynamic, entrepreneurial, broad-minded individuals to be part of our rapidly expanding team! Join our diverse and motivated team to hone in on your creativity as well as implement new initiatives within a nurturing, equal opportunity environment! The Role As the Creative Designer, you will be reporting into the Creative lead and will assist in driving the success for creative and visual execution of all collateral (offline and online) in Singapore. You will be part of the creative team responsible for shaping visual storytelling for Lazada Singapore with umbrella of brands including RedMart and LazMall. You will also work closely with the rest of the marketing functions (CRM, partnership, social, online marketing, loyalty) and commercial teams to deliver authentic and creative experiences. Responsibilities • Work on creative visuals for key and always-on campaigns to ensure they are aligned to brand guidelines and business objectives • Take charge of creative adaptations for (not limited to) ad media buys • Creative custodian alongside Creative Lead for Lazada Singapore’s brand and visual communication across all touchpoints (including organic and paid media channels) • Work hand-in-hand Creative Lead to develop design resources, guidelines and templates that can aid in design adaptations/executions by other teams; and ensure these are cascaded to the teams promptly • Integrate robust design skills, including layout, typography and design patterns into all campaigns • Work closely with the brand team to solve challenges in creative briefs and work on optimisation of campaigns to achieve optimal campaign metrics Job Requirements • Diploma or degree in design, visual communication or other relevant fields with at least 2 years of creative work experience (advantage if on a FMCG or e-commerce vertical). • Proactive, able to work independently and also a good team player. • Love a fast-paced environment and work well under tight timelines. • Strong skills with design software such as Adobe Suites and Final Cut Pro.

Job Description : Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world's most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunity to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sounds interesting Then come in and join our ASEAN team as Ultrasound Business Partner Manager to be based in our Singapore Hub Office to the next possible start. The Ultrasound Business Partner Manager is responsible to manage countries & business partners with the full authorities to implement and execute the Go-To-Market for Ultrasound in all ASEAN countries. The objective is to maximize market penetration, coverage, market share gain in a specific geography. Your tasks and responsibilities: You will manage the Siemens Healthineers Ultrasound market presence in the defined countries including business planning, competitor- and market share analysis to be the enabler for Healthcare providers. Yu will manage customer relationship and ensuring personal relations with customers, business partners and stakeholders (Unrestricted as well as external). You will manage and develop the business partners/ distributors/ agents for sales and services activities to enable maximum market penetration and coverage. From selection to full management of business partners including contractual negotiation, day-to-day operations, forecasting, project strategy, Education, and collection. The Business Partner Manager will lead the geography for Ultrasound and will be fully accountable about all business aspect in the countries scope of responsibility. Market Presence and Customers Pro-active contribution into the market transparency of the countries: to understand a Healthcare system, customer structure, trends, and competitive environment. Active contribute to the Go-To-Market analysis and strategy implementation for the countries in his/ her responsibility (to understand the strategy and to suggest ideas and concrete steps). You will conduct business planning, forecast updates and reviewing plan achievements Management Business Partner You will create an understanding of the Siemens Healthineers Ultrasound strategy at the business partner to facilitate and ensure an aligned Go-To-Market approach in accordance with Siemens Healthineers Ultrasound strategy. You will be working together with the Business Partner(s) on the country strategy, establishing a suitable market presence and working on accounts and sales funnel. You will be responsible for contracts with business partners regarding Agency and Distributor Agreements and the related Supplemental Agreements and Annexes. You will discuss with the Business Partner training and education needs, ensuring an up-to-date Business Partner sales & Service organization. To find out more about the specific business, have a look at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-sg/ultrasound Your qualifications and experiences: You hold a successfully completed Bachelor Degree in Engineering or Business Administration or Clinical background with relevant business experience. You have at least 5 years professional experience in MedTech environment. Ultrasound experience within the industry is preferred. Experience with Medical Equipment, diagnostics instruments, and Healthcare Customers. Business Know-How regarding contract management, financing topics and internal processes. Your personality and skills: Communication skills and cross culture awareness. Being assertive, networking- and teamwork skills. Strategic thinking. You can travel up to 50% in the region (when travel becomes widely possible again). Our global team: We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what's possible in healthcare to help improve people's lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways. Our culture: We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what's possible, to improve people's lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. We ask instead that you create a profile in our talent community where you can upload your CV. Setting up a profile lets us know you are interested in career opportunities with us and makes it easy for us to send you an alert when relevant positions become open. Click here (https://talent.siemens.com/stayconnected) to get started. To all recruitment agencies: Siemens Healthineers does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, employees or any other company location. Siemens Healthineers is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Organization: Siemens Healthineers Company: Siemens Healthcare Pte Ltd Experience Level: Experienced Professional Job Type: Full-time

Job_Descriptions: Job Description We are looking for an individual who is a quick learner, energetic and passionate about cooking. Able to work under pressure on a daily basis. Come join us and work in an environment that appreciates your contributions and is keen on your growth and development. - Ensuring that all food is of excellent quality and served in a timely manner. - Planning the menu, keeping in mind budget, and availability of seasonal ingredients. - Coordinating kitchen staff, and assisting them as required. - Taking stock of ingredients and equipment, and placing orders to replenish stock. - Enforcing safety and sanitation standards in the kitchen. - Keeping up to date with industry trends. - Receiving feedback and making improvements where necessary. Overview Element has an opportunity for a Field Service  Technician for testing, sample preparation and delivery/collection of samples and preparation of test reports. This position will be based in Sungei Kadut Loop, Singapore. Responsibilities Perform soil, concrete and aggregate testing Conduct density test Sampling of concrete for compression and flexural test Conduct slump testing Have an idea / conduct asphalt testing (preferable) Prepare and compile reports Skills / Qualifications Posses diploma / degree in Civil Engineering with at least 2 year experience in similar role. Good communication skills and ability to work in teams and to work under pressure Possess good working attitude & able to adapt quickly #LI-PN1 Company Overview Element is one of the fastest growing testing, inspection and certification businesses in the world. Globally we have more than 6,500 brilliant minds operating from 200 sites across 30 countries. Together we share an ambitious purpose to ‘Make tomorrow safer than today’. When failure in use is not an option, we help customers make certain that their products, materials, processes and services are safe, compliant and fit for purpose. From early R&D, through complex regulatory approvals and into production, our global laboratory network of scientists, engineers, and technologists support customers to achieve assurance over product quality, sustainable outcomes, and market access. While we are proud of our global reach, working at Element feels like being part of a smaller company. We empower you to take charge of your career, and reward excellence and integrity with growth and development. Industries across the world depend on our care, attention to detail and the absolute accuracy of our work. The role we have to play in creating a safer world is much bigger than our organization. Diversity Statement At Element, we always take pride in putting our people first. We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes diversity and inclusion as fundamental to our Vision of becoming “the world’s most trusted testing partner”. All suitably qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective work related criteria and without regard for the following: race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, and/or protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the applicable governing laws. TIC Council Statement Element is proud to be a full member of the Testing, Inspection & Certification Council (the “TIC Council”), an international association representing independent testing, inspection and certification companies. Members of the TIC Council must implement and abide by the TIC Council Compliance Code. Element has therefore issued an overarching Code of Conduct which is supported by our Compliance Programme. A copy of the Code of Conduct and more information about our Compliance Programme can be found in the Governance and Integrity section of www.element.com.

Job Requirements Valid Singapore driving license (Class 3 / 4 / 5) Minimum PSLE with pass in English Willing to work on rotating shifts including weekends Experience not required as training will be provided (ITE Certification) Flexible roster planning 12-hours shift (Day / Night) Minimum 22 shifts per month Salary Package Can earn up to S$3,500.00 per month or more! Various incentives for performance, night shift and weekend work! Box commission available! Joining bonus up to S$2,500.00 after 12 months! More incentives if perform more shifts beyond contractual requirements Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends
