Job description Job Highlights 5 days work week A competitive salary for the right candidate Performance Allowances Job Description Provide general administrative supports to the projects Assist in Finance office works, process invoices and keep accurate records of the relevant transactions Process the monthly expenses claims for the manager Assist in both physical & e-filing of documents Tactful handling of phone calls and call-in enquiries Perform the other ad-hoc administrative duties as & when necessary Job Requirements Able to start work on short notice Experience in the construction industry will be an advantage On the job training will be provided GCE O/N Level, ITE or Diploma or a related discipline Good Knowledge in Microsoft Office ( Excel, Word, Power Point & Outlook) Highly organized and detail oriented. Ability to work independently, take initiative and set priorities.

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com Job Description BUSINESS UNIT DESCRIPTION Treasury’s mandate is to actively manage CIBC’s Balance Sheet capital and funding resources, as well as structural B/S interest rate, liquidity, and FX risks in support of our bank’s strategy.  Treasury is an independent advisor to our operating businesses in the analytical pricing of products and strategies and has the accountability for establishing a value-added integrated fixed income investment management programs optimized to support CIBC’s Treasury management objectives.  In addition the team is responsible for creating an active Pension Investment Management program for CIBC’s defined benefit pension plan. Treasury’s active responsibilities include: (i) liquidity risk management, cash management and related settlement system risks; (ii) collateral management at the Bank of Canada, Federal Reserve and clearing corporations; (iii) sourcing and execution of cost efficient funding of the Bank’s balance sheet within the constraints of liquidity, balance sheet, market and concentration limits; (iv) optimization of the capital structure within the constraints of regulatory requirements, flexibility and cost effectiveness to support strategic business plans; (v) the creation and maintenance of a transparent and effective funds transfer pricing model; (vi) development and implementation of a bank-wide balance sheet strategy aligned with the corporate strategy, including initiatives to drive balance sheet optimization (vii) measurement and management of balance sheet structural interest rate and FX risk; (viii) management of regulatory, central bank, government, industry and investor relations related to capital instruments, financing vehicles and treasury related financial system risks. JOB PURPOSE This role carries the responsibilities for managing all Treasury activities within Singapore, ensuring compliance with applicable licensing and regulatory requirements at all times. The primary responsibilities of the role include optimizing the performance of the FLM business in Asia with a view to enhancing the bank’s market share, and share of client wallet and overall profitability around our selected Client suite with this Product set. In addition, liquidity management, funding management, cash management, and regulatory interaction. The role also includes accountabilities to coordinate between Treasury and the branch businesses on matters pertaining to funds transfer pricing, asset liability management, and recovery and resolution planning. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES Optimize the bank’s liquidity metrics and balance sheet, respecting policy, limits and profitability. Compliance with local statutory regulations and head office policies. Actively seeking new potential investors on a continuous basis, to diversify funding sources and raise cost effective funding to enhance the liquidity position for the Bank. Continue to build on our CD program. Meet and talk with clients to enhance our source of funding. Work closely with the Asia Sales team and Corporate banking unit to achieve the global funding strategies. Manage the bank’s risk exposure from the trading and liquidity perspective. Adopt trading strategy after studying the market trends and discussion with Head of FLM Plan, scope and coordinate process and respond to audit or regulator requests, findings and reports regarding Singapore Treasury, funding and related activities. Maintain a comprehensive Treasury risk management framework, including periodic reviews of various policies Responsible for the impact analysis and implementation of new regulatory requirements related to Treasury. Keep senior management abreast of market movements, trends, stresses or other significant market changes (including relevant regulatory developments) Treasury support for other SBUs in Asia Skills/Knowledge/Experience Required Excellent understanding of Capital Markets and Treasury – with knowledge of all relevant money market instruments related to the Asian market (including HQLA management) and balance sheet management techniques. Advanced abilities in achieving results with a specific set of Products. Ability to contribute to the strategic direction of FLM business in Asia. Advanced interpersonal and communication skills. Advanced team, consensus and relationship building skills. At least 10 years’ experience with finance qualifications and the appropriate regulatory registration.  Trading experience in Foreign Exchange (G-10, Asian NDF), Forwards and Money Markets, preferably in Asia. Demonstrated local knowledge of MAS Rules and Regulations as well as relevant KYC/AML requirements related to Treasury. WORKING CONDITIONS This role operates within a normal office environment with little exposure to adverse working conditions; This role may need to work remotely (from home) from time to time; Work pressures caused by concentration on analytical work, conflicting priorities and project timelines can be significant in this type of role. What you need to know CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact ***************@cibc.com You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit Job Location One Raffles Place Twr 2 #12-61 Employment Type Regular Weekly Hours 40 Skills

Job_Title: Onboarding Sales Manager, Google Customer Solutions, SEA
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 9 years of experience in sales and delivering on business goals. Experience building relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Experience in people management. Preferred qualifications: Experience in the digital advertising industry. Experience in pipeline management and sales funnel management. Experience leading teams with a focus on coaching and mentoring. Experience with success in developing business teams and working towards goals. Fundamental understanding in media or ads agency ecosystem. Demonstrated diverse cultural understanding and comfortable working with diverse regional and global teams. About the job Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. In the this role, you will focus on driving customer long-term sustainability for our large customers. We believe that an effective onboarding to increase the customer’s sustainability can be achieved through attentive support and regular communications. You will flex your strengths in product knowledge, consultative promoting, and account management. As an Onboarding Sales Manager, you will lead and coach high-performing account strategists teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the New Business Sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. You'll help your teams to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive solutions. When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses. Resposibilities Oversee business development, develop and execute on business plan for select South East Asia (SEA) market. Set quarterly goals and performance expectations with teams through regular feedback and weekly one-on-one meetings. Work closely across different sales teams: Inbound (Scaled New Business/Scaled New Business Sales) and Direct Scaled Acquisition (DSA) to align and drive long-term customer sustainability. Manage and coach Onboarding sales teams to deliver excellent performance. Develop their digital marketing expertise and build productive client partnerships. Own Agency and cross-functional sales relationship for your markets. Ensure smooth delivery and a Googley customer experience. Provide career coaching/performance feedback and development opportunities on a regular basis. Partner closely with marketing to onboard/promote self and marketing sign up customers as well as GCS sales team to ensure strong graduation pipeline.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 7 years of experience in the digital advertising industry or marketing functions. Preferred qualifications: Experience working with Google Ads suite (e.g., Search Ads 360 (SA360)). Experience working in or with Asia-Pacific markets. Ability to define a vision and strategy and build relationships with key stakeholders to achieve it. Excellent analytical skills, with a high degree of comfort with data-driven problem-solving. Excellent project management skills to deliver initiatives on time and to specification with high autonomy. Effective written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to pitch messaging to stakeholders of varying levels. About the job Go-To-Market Performance encompasses some of Google’s fastest growing, most prominent and advanced advertising, and measurement products, including Search, Shopping, Apps, Privacy-Centric Measurement. As the Asia Pacific (APAC) Go-To-Market Lead, you will be part of the Search and Commerce GTM team, and lead the product strategy and activation for Google’s suite of Search, Shopping, and Retail associated products that assist businesses and partners to obtain highly qualified traffic. The team partners closely with APAC sales leadership and teams, Search and Shopping specialists, GTM, and global counterparts to drive the respective sales strategy and initiatives for the region. They own the development of supporting operations, product strategy, and in-market activation to drive business impact and growth outcomes. In this role, you will be responsible for creating and executing effective go-to-market plans for our suite of Search automated bidding products, with a particular focus on Value Optimization, where you will help advertisers to unlock growth by successfully aligning conversion value to their most important business key performance indicators (KPIs). Partnering closely with country activation specialists and sales teams across the region, you will drive the adoption and optimal use of these products, while simultaneously collecting insights and feedback to improve them through partnership with Global Product teams. You will leverage your customer-centric mindset, deep curiosity for how Search product features work together, and collaboration with Search GTM peers to build holistic strategies and initiatives that establish Search’s power as a driver for customer growth. The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done. Resposibilities Create, execute, and refine the ads product go-to-market strategy for Search in APAC, with focus on Value optimization. Drive adoption of key Search products by influencing and equipping sales specialists and sales communities across the region. Identify gaps in products and build business cases based on customers needs; partner with Global Product Leads on your product area roadmap. Identify business opportunities with market and competitive insights. Partner with cross-functional teams to develop and execute regional programs, initiatives. Execute projects to drive step change improvements in product adoption and sales capability.

Minimum qualifications: 8 years of experience in network installation, network infrastructure, and optical networking 5 years of experience in people management 5 years of experience in colocation and with data center operations 5 years of experience in program management within a technical field Preferred qualifications: Experience in logistics and supply chain management Experience in operations management Experience with operations and third-part colocation environments About the job Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services. As the Deployment Lead of the Network Delivery Implementation team, you will be on the forefront of our efforts to execute deployment, maintenance, and operations of private data networks worldwide. You will work with Design/Infrastructure Engineers, Field Engineers, Strategic Negotiators, and Technical Project Managers within Google, as well as construction and telecommunications Vendors and Contractors, all to position your team and Organization for success. Your leadership and management skills will be leveraged to facilitate faster, better, and more efficient, positive outcomes for the business and our customers. Your team's objective will be to build the world’s most reliable, cost-effective, and scalable network to support all of our current and future customers and users globally. Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible. Resposibilities Oversee a team of network engineers responsible for the delivery of network capacity and infrastructure  across a defined geographical region in Asia Pacific (APAC). Set team level direction and strategy. Build, develop, and grow team capabilities to deliver key business outcomes. Provide technical leadership and guidance during deployment activities delivering business outcomes and escalating issues where appropriate. Work with partner network teams to assess risks and potentials in alignment with forecasts and high-level build to plan. Identify and drive new initiatives/programs/processes to create efficiency/process improvements/optimize resources and address gaps/risk cross-functionally.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience in operations management. 4 years of experience in a program/operations role with a marketing and/or creative agency. Preferred qualifications: Experience with success in executing on complex, ambiguous cross-functional, and global initiatives. Experience establishing effective relationships, influencing and driving consensus, and collaborating internally and externally at all organizational levels. Experience working on both the agency and client-side with global experience (e.g., program manager, project manager, operations manager). Experience of successfully rolling out complex, global initiatives. Ability to effectively operate in a fast-paced, constantly evolving, team environment. Ability to work with ambiguity, solve complex problems, and scale effectively across a large organization and highly distributed and often, remote team. About the job Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the representation of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. Google’s Marketing Operations team is here to inspire and enable our best work. Our programs are focused on Agency Management, Production Operations, Marketing Technology, and Contract Operations. As an Operations Manager within Marketing Operations, you will deliver full pieces of a program to determine how to scale, launch, standardize, and optimize operational processes of Marketing Operations’ programs and initiatives. You’ll use project management skills and expertise to bring our extensive strategic plan to life. You will build bridges and connection points with cross-functional teams across marketing, finance, legal, engineering, product development, and more. Your experience will help us unlock new ways of working and enable us to expand our reach to Marketers. Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. Resposibilities Partner with teams to drive execution of key initiatives by collaborating with cross-functional teams to influence, implement, extend, manage, and evolve our operational processes and models for our marketers and agencies. Partner across Marketing Operations and the broader Marketing organization to implement, maintain, and continuously optimize operating models meant to focus on ways of working between teams. Provide clear communication to cross-functional team leads and management regarding status of projects (e.g., proposals, roadmaps, resource requirements, issues, and priorities). Drive continuous improvement across the team by implementing systems and processes as needed, partnering with the broader Marketing Operations Program Management team. Implement, track, and prioritize project roadmaps and schedules for specific initiatives that align with the broader strategy for the Marketing Operations team; remove roadblocks, identify risks, and propose mitigation plans.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's of Law or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of relevant advisory and regulatory experience within the intellectual property, media, extended workforce, and technology related areas in Singapore and Southeast Asia emerging markets. Payments regulatory and commercial experience across South East Asia. Preferred qualifications: Experience in-house with a multinational corporation and in a law firm. Ability to work independently, but with a team-oriented mentality. Ability to manage numerous projects simultaneously. Excellent commercial and ethical judgment, and leadership, analytical, discussion, and agreement drafting skills. Well-organized, detail-oriented, and resourceful. About the job As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well. In this role, you will support a wide range of in-region commercial, advisory, regulatory, and contentious work across Google's products and services. 20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for working with some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you address unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world. Resposibilities Conduct legal reviews and provide advisory and commercial support across Google’s product, marketing, and business initiatives; respond promptly to a wide range of legal requests from Marketing, Sales, Product, Finance, Tax, and other cross-functional groups across Singapore and Southeast Asia emerging markets. Review draft legislation and work with Google’s Government Affairs team. Build relationships with regulators and authorities in Singapore and Southeast Asia emerging markets; manage regulatory inquiries, and autonomously solve contentious issues relating to Google’s products and operations. Advise management and cross-functional project teams in APAC and the United States with regard to potential legal risks in Singapore and Southeast Asia emerging markets; coordinate and ensure agreement and buy-in from all stakeholders. Work with external legal counsel on specific matters ranging from regulatory issues to expert advice requests.

Job_Title: Senior Assistant Director/Assistant Director - Analytics (PO&D, MSO)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Municipal Services Office (MSO) was set up in Oct 2014 to improve the coordination, delivery and quality of municipal services by Government and Town Councils. These services include the upkeep and improvement of common areas in public and private estates, and the upgrading or provision of facilities and infrastructure. The next bound of municipal service delivery involves: i) ramping up of forward intelligence capabilities to enable foresight planning and support the development of pre-emptive operations; ii) integrate and optimise decision-making and ground operations across the sector via the use of operations-technology [e.g. Command, Control and Communications (C3) system, sensors, robots] to facilitate pre-emptive actions, flexible deployment of resources and to automate routine work; iii) humanising the digitalisation of government services (e.g. OneService Chatbot) for an optimised, resident-centric experience. What you will be working on You will be part of the Analytics Team within the Planning, Operations & Digital Division in MSO, and your duties include: Manipulate the data with advanced quantitative methods/techniques to discover insights and identify potential areas to deep-dive into. Mine large, massive volumes of unstructured data to discover interesting and relevant insights, patterns or relationships. Develop predictive tools and models to improve operations, support decision-making and operations planning. Design and develop appealing visualisations and/or dashboards which presents information that is intuitive and easy to comprehend. Craft coherent and compelling data stories leveraging on the discoveries and insights from data analysis work. Understand and apply Agile project management principles/concepts(e.g. user story development, KPI formulation) in managing operations-technology & automation projects. Oversee and maintain a repository of municipal feedback data (more than 1.3 million new data per year!) with the appointed vendor. What we are looking for Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Economics, or Engineering (Master’s Degree is a plus) At least 2 years of experience in data analysis and machine learning (e.g. use of decision trees, logistic regressions, neural networks) Technical experience using Python, R and/or SQL Familiarity with data warehousing All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Descriptions: Job Description Develop digital marketing strategies for brands and set up digital marketing plans in line with global strategy Plan, monitor & manage ongoing internal & our clients’ presence on social media including enquires & comments handling, content updates and A/B testing of campaigns Launch optimized online adverts through Facebook, Instagram Ensure content of online channels remain accurate and brand compliant Research and provide knowledge on digital innovation and identify new ideas for collaboration to increase engagement, influence, and brand visibility Requirements: Required Skills: account servicing, building rapport, search engine marketing, search engine optimization, Facebook advertising, Instagram advertising, landing pages, presentation skills. Able to manage Wordpress and competent in canva design (while Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator skills is advantageous) Pro-active & self-motivated team player, able to commit to meet deadlines under time constraints Excellent organisational skills with an eye for detail Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience in tech policy, intelligence or regulations/government relations. 7 years of experience working in the APAC region and managing the Indian market. Experience leading and managing people, projects, and groups of cross-functional stakeholders. Ability to speak and write in English and Hindi fluently to identify abuse trends. Preferred qualifications: Experience in people management or team leadership. Experience with the history, local politics, media landscape, and context of the Indian market. Experience working with Product Management and Engineers to drive progress on key programs. Strategic and analysis skills, including the ability to lead a team to frame problems, structure analyses, and drive to impact. Exceptional communication skills to drive consensus across cross-functional partners. Excellent organizational and project management skills with great attention to detail. About the job Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world. As a Market Responsibility Team Lead managing a local market and leading the wider team, you will be responsible for ensuring that we are constantly growing our understanding of regional and local trends and risks on YouTube. You will proactively monitor trends and intelligence sources, help to launch new product features with market and language knowledge, and ensure our enforcement guidelines are informed by your market knowledge. You'll help implement and enforce our policies across content videos, as well as define and implement operational plans globally, liaising and working with stakeholders in areas such as Product Management, Engineering, Vendor Operations, Analytics, Public Policy, PR, Partnerships, and Legal. In this role, you may review graphic, controversial, and sometimes offensive video content during team escalations in line with YouTube’s Community Guidelines. At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. Resposibilities Act as a team Lead in the Market Responsibility Specialist team, in addition to India market focus. Monitor intel sources, work with cross-functional teams, and leverage market expertise to identify key abuse trends in the Indian market, monitor emerging sensitive events, and highlight risks to the YouTube ecosystem and Trust and Safety. Speak Hindi and another local language fluently in order to effectively identify and propose policy improvements based on market nuances, and support language detection, automation, language quality improvements, and local product launches. Triage threats, prepare risk assessments and action plans based on market knowledge and act as the main point of contact. Drive and support the launch of news-related product features, as well as other responsibility projects in the region, and communicate effectively.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in a program or project management role. Experience working in an enterprise environment. Preferred qualifications: Experience managing large-scale projects in a matrixed environment. Experience in, and/or knowledge of cloud networking, DWDM, fiber, interconnect, peering, IP network planning, or implementation role at an ISP, telecoms operator, carrier, or CDN, encompassing technical, commercial, and legal areas of the above. Familiarity with agreement structures for circuit types (IRU, PTP, etc) from a Finance and Legal standpoint. Excellent problem-solving and data-driven analytical skills. Effective communication skills. About the job A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines. Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company. In this role, you'll be responsible for the planning and coordination of transport networks, fiber, and co-location capacity for Google’s corporate enterprise network. You will also lead strategic discussions, technical conguration, planning of infrastructure, and manage senior technical and operational relationships with carriers, ISPs, and colocation providers. Resposibilities Create multi-year metro or region level network strategies to provide resilient connectivity meeting physical and logical diversity requirements while balancing performance and cost. Create and present business cases for long-term investments. Regularly communicate and engage with internal teams, Deploy, Network Engineering, Service Delivery, Production, and Operations. Develop relationships and drive delivery with external vendors to engage on strategic initiatives and create an understanding of market conditions for each region. Demonstrate experience in project and change management for complex projects while making organizational change happen effectively, ensuring lasting benefits of change are achieved.

Job_Title: Analytical Consultant, E-Commerce, Large Customer Sales
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 8 years of relevant experience in technology/start-ups, E-Commerce industry, or consulting. Experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data, or with other programming or scripting languages (e.g., R, Python). Preferred qualifications: Experience using Google's measurement suite products, website analytics platforms (e.g., Analytics), and brand analysis techniques. Experience designing/building scalable and robust data pipelines. Analytical experience with marketing analytics, return on investment/financial modeling, and statistical analysis. Ability to pull strategic insights out of large sets of data and manage client relationships. About the job Being an Analyst at Google is about much more than simply crunching numbers – it’s about finding compelling insights within data and using your exceptional business and communication skills to translate those insights into action. As one of the masterminds behind our strategic planning, forecasting and analysis, you’ll spend your time digging into big, complex data sets. The data will not remain inert in your hands, however, since you’ll use your critical thinking, problem-solving and communication skills to influence and drive thoughtful and well-informed decision-making with our business leaders within the organization, and potentially some of our biggest clients. As an Analytical Consultant within the Large Customer Sales (LCS) team, you will be a core member of Google’s growing business, at the intersection between Strategy, Sales, and Products. You will accelerate business growth for customers and Google by developing strategies and actionable insights that change businesses and transform industries. Additionally, you will work with regional and multinational customers with businesses spanning across Asia Pacific (APAC) markets. By maintaining a deep understanding of the key challenges and opportunities faced by our customers, you will be able to advise them on business, marketing, and media challenges, driving measurable impact. Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. Resposibilities Engage and influence internal and external relationships within the client and industry. Build, customize, and deliver solutions through the right forums (e.g., workshops, presentations, etc.) to achieve outcomes. Develop insights (e.g., qualitative/quantitative) using a variety of internal and external sources. Serve as an industry expert by developing and creating industry point of views. Advise clients on methodologies for marketing, media analytics, and measurement. Help customers navigate industry standards and alternatives. Identify opportunities for clients rooted in effective data rationale.

Job_Title: Senior Engineer / Engineer, Land Systems (Combat Systems, Platforms, and Vehicle
Job_Descriptions: What the role is We seek driven individuals to join the Land Systems Programme Centre where you will play a crucial role in actively innovating, developing and operationalising game changing technologies and capabilities for both defence and whole of Government applications. What you will be working on Combat Systems, Platforms, and Vehicle Technologies Highly specialised and advanced combat systems that are designed to seek, identify and prosecute with precision, speed and accuracy. Cutting edge powertrains such as hybrid or electric platforms for game-changing capabilities. Integration of robotics and automation to enhance performance, efficiency and safety. Innovative platform designs to overcome challenging terrain. Through personalised training and mentorship programmes, you will be exposed to a broad spectrum of expertise, ranging from technical competencies such as systems engineering, integration, modelling & simulation and rapid prototyping, to business competencies in project management and design thinking. You will use this know-how and technology instinct to deliver end-to-end capabilities. You will also have opportunities to collaborate and co-develop technologies with leading organisations, companies and research institutions from both Singapore and across the world. What we are looking for Tertiary qualification in Engineering-related fields (e.g. Electrical, Mechanical, Mechatronics, etc.), or Robotics or Systems Automation Engineering. Dynamic personality with good interpersonal skills, self-driven with a can-do spirit, willingness to learn new skills and expand into exciting new tech domains. Experience and proficiency in the following are desired but not mandatory: > CAD and modelling and simulation tools such as Unity and SolidWorks; or > Robotics, automation, systems integration

Experience and proficiency in the following are desired but not mandatory: > Robotics, automation, systems integration; or > Programming (e.g. Android Programming, Python, C/C++, Java); or > Modelling and simulation tools such as Unity and SolidWorks; or > Information Systems and Internet of Things; or > Computers and Electronics

Job_Title: Engineer/Senior Engineer, Systems Engineering and C3 Centre
Job_Descriptions: What the role is We seek driven and motivated individuals to join our Systems Engineering and C3 Centre where you will have the exciting opportunity to design, develop and integrate command and control systems for the SAF and the Public Service. What you will be working on Conceptualise systems using design innovation/thinking techniques and incorporate technologies such as sensors/IOT, unmanned systems and information technology. Conduct evaluations, design reviews, verification and validation during system implementation; and finally transiting it into operational use to bring impactful outcomes for SAF and the Public Service. Experiment and incorporating smart technologies such as artificial intelligence and data analytics into products to enable the SAF and Public Service to carry out real-time operations, ranging from daily operations to crisis management. Conduct feasibility studies and analysis to identify how emerging technologies can be leveraged to enhance systems and products with future-ready capabilities such as optimised resource planning, automated decision making, and tasking to response forces to respond to unfolding situations. Establish strong partnerships with other organisations to leverage digitalisation initiatives for product trials and development. You will be exposed to a wide spectrum of expertise with the appropriate guidance, ranging from data analytics, cloud computing and cybersecurity to develop products and deliver systems that harness these technologies for effective digitalisation and data visualisation. You will also have the invaluable opportunity to work with renowned organisations locally and worldwide to develop and deliver state-of-the-art capabilities to SAF and the Public Service. What we are looking for Tertiary qualification in Electrical & Electronic Engineering , Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, Data Engineering, Communications or a related discipline Good written, verbal and interpersonal skills Strong analytical skills, resourceful, meticulous and a team player Able to multi-task and work independently

What the role is What you will be working on Responsibilities: a) Co-lead a small team in facilitating flight supply for repatriating workers. b) Engage government agencies, embassies, airlines and partners on repatriation operations. c) Establish and implement the process in ensuring smooth repatriation operations. d) Monitor and track the expenditures for outsourced services. e) Coordinate and support in the handling of escalated cases. The officers in the team will be tasked to ensure that workers who require repatriation are able to go home on either MOM-chartered relief flights, embassy-relief flights, or commercial flights. The work will entail liaising with government agencies, Embassy and airlines representatives, and other vendors such as Travel Agents, SATS, and Clinics. The officers will also need to closely project-manage each flight and track statuses of passengers. Officer will develop strong project management skills. He/She will have the opportunity to plan, design and develop, implement, monitor and evaluate the various projects that he/ she will be tasked to be in charge of. Officer will understand first hand, the complex processes of a repatriation flight, including mounting of a flight, coordinating the flight manifest and working across multiple agencies/ stakeholders. What we are looking for Requirements: More than 5 years of relevant experience in business strategy, ops policy, project management, stakeholder management, and in overseeing a team of officers. Good communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work across organisational lines, liaise, negotiate and provide constructive challenges and feedback to both internal and external stakeholders. Possess critical thinking skills to analyse complex and multi-factorial issues into clear and concise content, identify root causes of problems and propose solutions; as well as to communicate complex information/issues and present information effectively and comprehensively both verbally and in written reports. Excellent English language skills. Comfortable in making presentations to different stakeholders at short notice. Officer must be self-motivated, confident, meticulous, able to think quickly and make decisions on the ground, and able to work under pressure. Proficient in EXCEL and other Microsoft Office softwares. Interest in and versatile in tackling policy and operational challenges.

Job_Title: Senior Manager / Manager / Assistant Manager (Residential Care)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be part of a team that is responsible for the formulation, co-ordination and implementation of operations plans and policies related to the residential care facilities and eldercare services in light of the COVID-19 situation. You will also support the review, development and implementation of long-term residential care policies to meet the growing needs of an ageing population. You will be working in a fast-paced and highly volatile environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time. What you will be working on Working closely with the various MOH divisions, task groups and external agencies such as the Agency for Integrated Care to review and implement operations plans and policies to safeguard the eldercare sector, as well as the seniors in the community against COVID-19; Organise and provide secretariat support for engagement sessions/meetings with key stakeholders, such as to share with the community care sector key COVID-19 measures; Ensuring accessibility to nursing home services to meet demands of the ageing population; Piloting new models of care and housing for seniors; Improving the standards and quality of care within residential care facilities (e.g. nursing homes); and Facilitating care integration between residential care facilities and other care services. What we are looking for Preferably 2-3 year’s relevant experience in the aged care / healthcare sector, public policy formulation / implementation and /or experience in social services. Background in strategic and service planning is an advantage. Preferably with knowledge of planning parameters for the aged care /healthcare sector and a good understanding of the industry to enable the development of strategies to raise sector performance and drive outcomes aligned to national healthcare priorities. Objective and analytical with robust communications skills (written and verbal). Good negotiator with strong people skills; comfortable with engaging and networking with internal and external stakeholders, as well as people from diverse backgrounds. Able to rally stakeholders towards a common cause. Hands-on team member who is adaptable and able to think quickly on his/her feet. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, candidates may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

What the role is About Sport Singapore At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences. Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport. Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do. Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family. About Industry Development Division In developing the sport industry, we partner key stakeholders in achieving sporting and economic outcomes through market and capability development. This division involves networking and staying relevant with the latest trends in innovation and technology within the sport ecosystem. Being able to strategise and facilitate synergies amongst stakeholders is important to keep the local and regional sport industry inviting and vibrant. Our work also includes supporting enterprises and individuals in the sport industry to remain resilient despite the COVID-19 pandemic and to enable their businesses to thrive. What you will be working on You will be part of the Industry Development division to support businesses and individuals in our sport industry in improving their offerings through leveraging technology and innovation, developing skills and capabilities and enhancing productivity and standards, as well as drive enterprise development and investment into the sporting ecosystem. In this role, you will; Develop and manage the overall industry development strategy and plan including landscape studies, industry surveys and database build. Establish strategic relationships with international sport entities and key local/international business partners to drive investment into Singapore and its sporting ecosystem. Enable sport business development through cross-sector and international collaborations on sport innovation. Leverage on internal/external platforms and enable opportunities to showcase innovative local talent/enterprises. Establish quality working relationships with partners to increase cross-sector and cross-border collaborations in support of innovative solutioning. For example, actively source, facilitate and manage strategic partnerships; establish a sport industry alliance/network as a key driver for developing the sporting eco system. Support the development of a robust capability development strategy for the sport industry. Curate conversations and work with relevant bodies such as education institutions and capability development agencies. Identify opportunities to leverage on SportSG’s assets and platforms for industry development. Support Whole-of-Government initiatives including enforcement, assessment and engagement with specific target groups within the industry. Support or partner sport businesses and individuals in pivoting to new business models and investing in capability development. Provide both financial (e.g. grants) and non-financial (e.g. creation of partnerships and networks) support to the sport industry. What we are looking for We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service to stakeholders and the community. This individual should be a sport advocate through living an active lifestyle and staying active. This individual should also be inquisitive and confident in making new connections and creating new opportunities. In addition, an ideal candidate should possess the following; At least 5-8 years of relevant experience in industry development, sports business/management, strategy development or related role. Experience in digitalisation and technology application for sport, strategic/business planning or financial analysis will be an advantage. Strategic thinker with analytical and planning skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Strong networking aptitude and stakeholder management skills. Resource and project management skills. Willingness to keep abreast of forefront innovation and trends within and across industries. Responsible and self-driven. Enjoys and believes in the power of sport to transform lives. Only shortlisted applicants will be notified. The level of offer will commensurate with applicants’ experience and track records. Successful candidates will be offered a 2 or 3 year fixed-term contract in the first instance.

Job_Title: Senior Executive / Executive (Case Management Task Group)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Ministry of Health is at the epicentre of the nation’s response to COVID-19. In support of Singapore’s COVID-19 operations, we are looking for individuals to assist with the various operations roles within the Case Management Task Group (CMTG). You will be working in a fast-paced and highly volatile environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time. What you will be working on Individuals who are able to commit for at least 6 months on full-time basis and work on assigned shifts in 12-hour blocks (including weekends and public holidays, with alternate days off) are welcome to apply. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, candidates may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. What we are looking for Senior Executive / Executive (Case Data) You will coordinate the data needs and requirements for COVID-19 operations to support the case management and conveyance of COVID-positive cases to isolation facilities. This will include: Work closely with key agencies to ensure the accuracy of data needs required for case management. Generate data reports/deliverables in a timely manner or be assigned for other ad-hoc operational tasks as required. Senior Executive / Executive (Transport) You will assist to track and monitor conveyance of suspect and confirmed COVID-19 patients, which include: Assist in the planning and projection of transportation needs for suspect and confirmed COVID-19 patients Conduct investigations where conveyances cannot be fulfilled Consolidate data and statistics for resource management and reporting purpose Engage with multiple stakeholders to ensure that conveyance operations are carried out smoothly Senior Executive / Executive (Current Ops) You will coordinate and harmonise the daily requirements for COVID-19 operations to support the COVID-positive cases, which will include: Consolidate and compile daily updates from operations centre for reporting Liaise with Secretariat on daily operations requirement and submission Raise operations issues to the attention of the Plans & Policy Implementation team Senior Executive / Executive (CMTG Call Centre) You will support in the operations of the CMTG Call Centre which will include: Answer and attend to incoming calls Update case information promptly and accurately into CMTG case management system Collate and disseminate case information for the triaging of patients Liaise with GPs/Polyclinics, clinic staff, operations staff from hospitals and community care facilities on the conveyance of patients Liaise with external stakeholders and sector leads on cases for conveyance Engage patients and to relay vital information for triaging Generate reports/deliverables for daily operation Senior Executive / Executive (Facilities) You will assist to coordinate with various operational cells and hospital/ facilities to ensure smooth admission, care and discharge/decant of patients. This will include: Plan and execute isolation operations Liaise with external stakeholders (e.g. hospitals, community care facilities, isolation facilities) to ensure smooth execution of operations Monitor hospital/facility capacity and facilitate timely decant/discharges. Prepare reports for submission Note: Successful applicants may also be placed under the recruitment agencies’ administration

Job_Title: MANAGER / DEPUTY MANAGER, HUMAN RESOURCE (BUSINESS PARTNER)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is MANAGER / DEPUTY MANAGER, HUMAN RESOURCE (BUSINESS PARTNER) What you will be working on You will be part of the team of HR business partners supporting specific business groups to develop and implement human resource programmes and services that are critical towards achieving the organisation's vision, mission and strategic thrusts. This position requires you to understand business needs and partner with the different group management staff to lead the overall HR strategy and provide strategic advisory services and solutions to support the business. Working together with the senior line management staff, you will implement HR initiatives and best practices that align with the business strategy; engaging them in the areas of recruitment, performance management, compensation, rewards and talent management and development. In addition, you may be assigned to other Centre of Excellence portfolio such as review of code of conduct matters including handling disciplinary cases as well as partnership with Union on management of industrial-relations matters. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in any discipline, preferably with at least 4 years of HR business partnering experience Demonstrated skills in writing, communication and interpersonal relationships Demonstrated skills in analysis and critical thinking Demonstrated initiative, resourcefulness and drive to excel Independent, able to work in a team and highly self-motivated

Hiring_Company: Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Policy research on strategies to reduce food waste What you will be working on Food waste is one of the key priority waste streams in Singapore, with high generation rates. There is more that we can do to reduce food waste generation, beyond current policies to mandate segregation, and ongoing outreach efforts. Reducing food waste not only contributes towards extending the lifespan of Semakau Landfill beyond 2035, but also strengthens our food security and resilience, reduces contamination of recyclables, and reduces odour nuisance and disamenities. The intern will conduct a review of food waste policies in overseas jurisdictions, focusing on upstream interventions that prevent food wastage, and evaluate the policies' effectiveness. (Examples include France’s law requiring all supermarkets to donate unsold food; and China's anti-food waste law that allows catering service provides to charge a disposal fee from customers who leave excessive amounts of food waste and fines restaurants found guilty of inducing or misleading behaviours that lead to diners wasting food.) The intern will also assess the suitability of adopting similar policies in Singapore, and provide recommendations on the policy parameters. What we are looking for Interest in sustainability and public policy Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to synthesise and structure large amounts of information into actionable recommendations Internship Period: May - Aug 2022

As part of the D&E team, you will have the opportunity to engage solution partners and help support the enhancement of Singapore companies’ ecommerce-related capabilities through programmes such as the Productivity Solutions Grant (PSG). You will be required to assess project submissions and interact with solution providers and companies on solution details and make informed recommendations to stakeholders. In addition, you may be required to consolidate and analyze data on a regular basis for reporting purposes, as well as other ad-hoc admin work. Responsibilities 1. Evaluate grant projects for eligibility and completeness, and liaise with companies and/or vendors for required information 2. Ongoing analysis of SME data/stats 3. Support the conducting of programme reviews 4. Consolidation of data on a regular basis for reporting to stakeholders 5. Other ad-hoc admin work What we are looking for Candidates should minimally have a diploma in any discipline, and preferably working experience in preferred areas of ecommerce, digital marketing, business operations or administration. They should demonstrate strong communication (verbal and written) and analytical skills, be able to work independently and possess basic understanding and/or interest in grant administration, policy and governance. Candidates who possess basic understanding and/or interest for digitalisation and ecommerce would have an advantage.

Hiring_Company: Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Reducing Vehicle Emissions to Achieve Better Air Quality What you will be working on The intern will study the policies that overseas jurisdictions have implemented to promote the adoption of cleaner vehicles to reduce emissions. These include but are not limited to regulation, incentives, and market development and innovation. The intern will examine why these jurisdictions have chosen these policies, how effective they are, and the trade-offs involved. The intern may be asked to deep dive into policies that promote cleaner motorcycles and heavy goods vehicles in particular, and recommend possible interventions for Singapore. Job_Title: Assistant Manager-Senior Manager, Business Innovation & Data Partnerships
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Technology & Transformation is no longer “nice to have”, but imperative to survive and thrive in the new operating environment. In April 2021, STB launched the Tourism Technology Transformation Cube (Tcube) – a hybrid innovation space that brings STB’s digital initiatives, resources and thought-leadership content onto a single platform to support our tourism sector’s digital transformation. Tcube website: https://www.stb.gov.sg/content/stb/en/trade-events-and-resources/Tcube.html We are looking for a digital transformation manager to: Drive digital transformation and technology adoption in the tourism sector for operational efficiency and experience enhancement Forge partnerships with key stakeholders to strengthen digital capabilities and drive digital innovations both in STB and across the industry Build up STB's innovation and technology network in Singapore and globally What you will be working on Key responsibilities include: Community engagement a) Build relationships and create communities (e.g. Community of Practice) amongst the key tourism stakeholders and the wider innovation ecosystem (e.g. tech solution providers, designers, business process consultants etc.). b) Drive and develop Tcube initiatives such as identifying opportunities for industry collaboration and overseeing the operator engaged to manage the Tcube space in STB. Project Management a) Develop regular Tcube content and events for the tourism sector, by working closely with stakeholders, suitable external consultants and vendors to support tourism sector stakeholders’ digital transformation. b) Develop, manage and assess Tcube programmes and resources (e.g. website, mailbox, mailing list etc.) to deliver quality outcomes. Industry development a) Build relationships with, and account manage key tourism stakeholders to support their transformation, drive tech change management and encourage adoption of Tcube initiatives. b) Keep up to date on the latest technologies and their applicability to the tourism industry. c) Administer grants to financially support industry to adopt technologies. What we are looking for Competency requirements: Critical core competencies required for this job: Achieving Results with others Business acumen Change management Project management Stakeholder management & relationship building Design thinking & innovation Critical functional competencies required for this job: Project management - Plans, organises and manages resources for successful project completion within timeline Stakeholder management & relationship building - Creates and maintains positive and effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders, influencing to advance STB’s interest Change management - Leads and facilitates change in driving digital transformation mindset amongst tourism stakeholders Achieving Results with others - Demonstrates determination, resourcefulness and purpose in delivering the best results for the organisation through collaboration with others Business acumen - Possesses in-depth understanding of technology and/or tourism trends and how these factors affect business decisions for enterprises. Design thinking & innovation Job Requirements: Experience in events management and content curation Experience in driving community engagements (e.g. Community of Practices (CoP), membership) Strong project management skills, with the ability to deliver projects Good interpersonal and communication skills, with ability to maintain relationships with potential partners and comfortable to interact with people from senior management levels Strong command of written and spoken English Experience with working with businesses on digital transformation to develop strategies, identify gaps and opportunities, develop new products etc. Proven track record in engaging relevant stakeholders (e.g. Tourism and/or Technology sectors) will be an advantage. Business acumen with the ability to think strategically Strong interest or basic knowledge of digital transformation concepts and technologies e.g. Agile, Design Thinking, APIs, Robotics, AR/VR, AI etc We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Senior Manager/Manager (Industry Digital Plans, Partnerships & Impact, SMEs Go D
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be responsible to develop industry specific IDPs through engagement with sector lead agencies, trade associations and the industry to drive transformation of SMEs through the use of digital technologies that lead to SME growth and productivity. You will need to establish strong partnerships with agencies, industry players e.g. Banks, Telcos, and trade associations to grow the SMEs’ adoption of digital solutions supported under the SMEs Go Digital Programme e.g. Start Digital, Grow Digital initiative. Key responsibilities would include internal/external stakeholder management, project management and analysis of the adoption and utilization of sector specific digital solutions. What you will be working on Lead and facilitate the development of industry specific IDPs; Understand the industry, challenges and trends from the industry specific Industry Transformation Maps (ITMs), discussions with industry stakeholders and literature research; Engage with sector lead, trade associations, union and other stakeholders to develop the IDP; and seek stakeholder consultation and validation from meetings and workshops; Develop collaterals including e-book, summary animation and case study interview videos for IDP launch Coordinate across agencies and internal teams to ensure media strategy and alignment; availability of pre-approved digital solutions; and potential sector pilot projects at IDP launch Seek internal and external stakeholders at senior levels for endorsement of the IDP launch Develop partnerships, including formulating business strategies with agencies, industry players and trade associations to drive the adoption and utilization of digital solutions What we are looking for Background in Computer Science, Business or equivalent Strong Stakeholder Management and working with broad spectrum of stakeholders from different vertical industries At least 5 years of working experience, preferably with government agency experience Up to date knowledge of IT industry practices and solutions Domain knowledge of one or more key industries is a plus: manufacturing, land/air/sea transport, construction, environment services, security, early childhood, healthcare, financial services, legal, retail, food services/manufacturing, logistics, media etc. Strong communicator to be able to bring across clarity in technical solutions in small group setting or addressing a large audience Strong aptitude for IT and Digital Solutions Proactive self-starter, is analytical, self-motivated, high energy and driven yet able to work well within a team and motivate the team Ability to multi-task, quick to adapt and able to work in fast pace work environment Good writing and presentation skills Position will commensurate with experience. Only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Hiring_Company: Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Supporting climate adaptation and climate science initiatives and capability development What you will be working on The recent Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) findings provide a stark reminder of the world’s vulnerabilities to the impacts of climate change. The intern will be involved in working on climate adaptation issues such as coastal protection and urban heat island (UHI) mitigation, and climate science that contributes to the strategic objectives of building up Singapore’s climate resilience. The intern will assist in developing a cost- benefit framework to benchmark adaptation strategies for mitigating the *Urban Heat Island (UHI) effect, and in particular to study methods for Non-Market evaluation of intangible benefits, and as well as in the execution/scoping of current and planned trials. The intern will also assist with conducting scans of policy levers relating to climate resilience, and in the planning and execution of activities which may include events, and programmes relating to climate science, as well as public messaging of adaptation strategies. These may include publicity and stakeholder engagement efforts. *Urban Heat Island (UHI) is the phenomenon where urban areas are warmer than surrounding rural areas. In highly urbanised Singapore, global warming will compound the UHI effect. What we are looking for Keen interest in public policy work Good communication and stakeholder management skills with a capacity for inter-agency work Good writing and presentation skills Good analytical skills and research capacity Internship Period: May Aug 2022

CPF members can use their CPF savings to buy a house, take care of their healthcare needs and save up for their retirement income for their golden years via the various schemes offered. If you are meticulous, a systematic thinker and derive satisfaction from helping others, you will fit right into this job. Verify and approve the adjustments made to the employers’ and members’ CPF accounts. Prepare monthly statistics for management reporting. Handle ad-hoc projects such as process review, system enhancement and perform User Acceptance Testing. What we are looking for Minimum 2 years of supervisory experience. Possess initiative and strong communication skills. Detailed-oriented and comfortable working with numbers Able to work both independently and as a team-player.

What the role is The Building and Construction Authority (BCA) champions the development of a future ready built environment for Singapore. Besides regulating building safety, we lead and transform the built environment sector in delivering a safe, high quality, sustainable and friendly built environment. We are looking for resourceful, energetic and self-motivated individuals who are inspired to play an active role to make a difference to Singapore’s built environment. What you will be working on The Built Environment Technology Alliance (BETA) is a group under the Communications and Engagement cluster of the Building and Construction Authority (BCA). BETA also manages a Company Limited by Guarantee (CLG) that is a wholly-owned subsidiary of BCA. This is a role to facilitate the research, innovation and technology adoption efforts of leading firms within Singapore’s Built Environment (BE) sector. You will be managing and supporting a portfolio of accounts that includes but is not limited to developers, builders, consultants, and facilities management (FM) companies. Through the role, you will gain strong familiarity with the BE Innovation and Technology (I&T) ecosystem, including a diverse range of solution providers across various domains of sustainability, productivity and digitalisation. Responsibilities Relationship Management and Project Development Serve as the main contact point to key accounts on Research and Innovation (R&I) matters and oversee end-to-end process of project development and execution as well as related activities Cultivate strategic relationships and build trust with key executives of the BE I&T ecosystem Work with growing enterprises in understanding their business needs, formulate R&I strategies (e.g. technology scanning and roadmapping) and assist to put in place an I&T framework so that appropriate execution approaches can be developed that will hone an agile and sustained competitive advantage for BE firms in Singapore and overseas Engage with industry and technology partners, senior management in private and public sectors as well as academia to undertake industry development and R&I activities as well as facilitate project implementation Work in close partnership with various stakeholders to define project plans and budgets, develop timelines, establish and monitor project risks and facilitate the project teams in achieving deliverables and objectives Research and develop deep understanding of Singapore and the global R&I ecosystem in BE as well as emerging technology and business trends, so as to be able to appreciate potential opportunities and implications to the relevance and transformation of the BE sector Policy and Programme Implementation Work with key agencies in the I&T eco-system (e.g. the National Research Foundation, Ministry of National Development, Enterprise Singapore, JTC Corporation and Infocomm Media Development Authority) to refine policy and implement initiatives that facilitate industry development and R&I activities in the BE sector, whilst ensuring proper governance Evaluate and refine proposals, facilitate networking and strengthen partnerships within the BE I&T ecosystem, including via the Built Environment Accelerate-to-Market Programme (BEAMP) What we are looking for Requirements Preferably possess at least five years of working experience in the built environment sector and/or business development/consulting fields Should be a results-oriented thinker, with proven conceptual and analytical skills Able to work independently and with excellent communication skills to engage a range of stakeholders in various settings Able to play cross-functional roles and/or work autonomously in a lean setup and dynamic environment Good interpersonal, oral and written communication skills Good organisational and time management skills Successful candidates will be offered contract employment. Remuneration shall commensurate with qualification and experience. Interested applicants, please apply online.
