What the role is Are you a meticulous worker with an eye for details? If so, we want you to be part of our team at the Singapore Police Force (SPF). SPF plays a critical role in keeping Singapore safe and secure with our mission to prevent, deter and detect crime and the Police Licensing & Regulatory Department (PLRD) supports the SPF mission by regulating sectors via its licensing regimes. There is a strong nexus between an effective licensing regime and crime, as well as public order. The Assistant Officer-in-Charge (AOC) Licensing in the General Licensing Division (GLD) oversees three regulatory regimes under the Secondhand Goods Dealers Act, the House to House and Street Collections Act and the Massage Establishments Act. You will be placed under the Management Executive Scheme What you will be working on As an AOC Licensing, you are responsible for ensuring that the processes involved in the regulation and licensing of the three regimes are executed in line with the law and SPF’s service standards. You must possess strong knowledge of the law and the standard operating procedures. As an AOC, you are expected to train and mentor your colleagues. You will exercise statutory powers gazetted under the law. You will assess and decide whether applications should be approved or rejected. This includes carefully reviewing the applicants’ eligibility and fulfilment of the licensing criteria. You will also play an important role in supporting the policy and legislative functions for the three regimes. You will assist to collate the information and statistics for the purpose of reviewing legislation, licensing criteria, conditions and guidelines. This entails working closely with stakeholders such as staff from other ministries and statutory boards and personnel in-charge of the licensing IT systems. You may also be rostered about 3 times a month to perform frontline duties at the PLRD counter to handle service requests from walk-in customers. What we are looking for REQUIREMENTS Possess good written skills and able to converse fluently in English & a Mother Tongue Language; Possess good computer literacy skills such as the use of basic Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) and is familiar with the use of the Internet; Possess effective communication and good interpersonal skills; Possess pleasant disposition and willing to perform a role associated with meeting members of public and provide good customer service; Able to work independently, is responsible and disciplined; and Able to handle and manage work-related pressure. Note: Our officers may be deployed to frontline positions or have frequent interactions with members of the public. Candidates who are not fully vaccinated and do not intend to get vaccinated have higher risk of COVID complications and will not be considered for the position. To be part of our team, please submit an online application via www.careers.gov.sg. Short-listed candidates will be notified within two weeks after the closing date of applications.

Job_Title: DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, VRL SERVICE TRANSFORMATION (1 YEAR TEMPORARY CONTRAC
Job_Descriptions: What the role is DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, VRL SERVICE TRANSFORMATION (1 YEAR TEMPORARY CONTRACT) What you will be working on You will be part of LTA’s team that will work closely with internal and external stakeholders to (1) envision the future of Vehicle Registration and Licensing (VRL) services, (2) design, transform and implement a VRL system that is more technologically agile and future-ready to support its functions, and (3) enable the organisation to achieve that vision through various Smart Nation initiatives. You will be working closely with our business partners (consultant and vendor) and various Divisions in LTA, to understand the needs of our stakeholders, drive business process transformation, and ensure that the VRL system has the capabilities to support the various business functions. You will also be involved in the VRL system development and implementation to ensure that our stakeholders’ needs and organisational goals are met. Your role includes, but not limited to, gathering requirement specifications, engaging stakeholders, providing timely updates to management, and providing other support services such as conducting user testing. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in any discipline At least 2 years of relevant experience or possess other qualifications may also apply Experience in conceptualisation, design and implementation of complex business systems will be an added advantage A self-directed learner with the right mindset to transform business processes Team player with good interpersonal, communication and writing skills Resourceful, analytical, self-confident and thrive in a demanding work environment Organised, self-motivated and have positive attitude

What the role is The People Development Directorate’s mission is to provide the State Courts with an optimal and a future ready workforce so as to achieve its organisational goals. You will be part of a dynamic team providing human resource (HR) services to the various clusters and directorates in the State Courts. What you will be working on Your responsibilities will include: Supporting the Assistant Director (People Development) in leading the recruitment team to hire the most suited candidates while taking into consideration the candidates’ career aspirations and the State Courts’ requirement, as well as ensuring optimal job and organization fit Handling the full recruitment lifecycle from sourcing, facilitating interviews, offer management and administrative follow-up Developing and implementing strategies to attract talent and develop their career in the State Courts through internal and external postings Supporting the building of an employee-centric workplace through employee engagement to elevate employees’ morale, create awareness of growth opportunities, and promote diversity and inclusion Evaluating manpower planning structures to ensure that they align with the State Courts’ organisational needs Reviewing and assessing HR processes and initiate relevant changes and process improvements Providing HR policy advice to staff Apart from your core portfolio, you will be given opportunities to be involved in organisation-wide and/or other HR-related projects and initiatives, and be exposed to other aspects of HR. What we are looking for Work Experience and Competencies: 5 to 8 years of relevant HR experience with at least 3 years of experience in recruitment Familiarity with HR policies and practices in the Public Service is an advantage. Ability to make sound judgements, and thinks ahead to anticipate issues and identify opportunities Ability to engage and work effectively with stakeholders Ability to engage and support staff with care and empathy Strong desire to continuously learn and grow professionally, with a drive to seek constant improvements Personal Traits: Meticulous, analytical and keen eye to details Able to multi-task and work within tight timelines Strong interpersonal, communication and writing skills Able to work well independently with minimal supervision and in a team environment Please be informed that an applicant’s vaccination status would be taken into consideration for all positions in the State Courts.

What the role is About Digital Industry Singapore (DISG) The Digital Industry Singapore (DISG) office is a joint office comprising officers from EDB, ESG and IMDA. DISG will drive job creation, capability building, enterprise development and internationalization across key local and international digital enterprises. The role of DISG will be to oversee Singapore’s efforts in industrializing digital, which is the building up of technology companies in the digital industry vertical. The work of digitalizing industries will be driven by the respective sector leads to ensure that digitalisation is made possible across Singapore’s economy. What the role is The Centre for Wildlife Forensics (CWF) is Singapore’s first national facility for wildlife forensics. It leverages on science and technology to investigate cases of illegal wildlife trade. It also enables NParks to build in-house capabilities for wildlife forensic investigations. This will support Singapore’s implementation and enforcement of our CITES commitments. The Centre draws on expertise from various NParks resources and personnel, as well as partnerships with regional and international experts on wildlife forensics analysis and enable us to contribute to the global fight against illegal wildlife trade. What you will be working on You will be part of the Centre for Animal and Veterinary Service (CAVS) team under the Professional and Scientific Services (PSS) Division and the Centre for Wildlife Forensic’s (CWF) Molecular diagnostics team. As a member of the multi-disciplinary team at the CAVS and CWF, you will be responsible for providing professional and competent diagnostic and test development support. Training will be provided in molecular techniques such as whole-genome sequencing and Single Nucleotide Polymorphism) discovery. Duties include: Developing, establishing, and validating various molecular techniques for the identification of wildlife samples. Developing, establishing, and validating genotyping techniques for the determination of the genetic geographic provenance and population assignment of wild animals. Participate in the maintenance of a laboratory quality system according to ISO17025:2017. What we are looking for Degree in Biology, Biotechnology, Biomedical Sciences, Life Sciences, or related fields. 1-year hands-on experience in a veterinary, medical, or research laboratory is preferred. Highly motivated individual with passion for laboratory work. Team player with initiative, drive and good interpersonal/communication skills and able to work independently. Good IT skills e.g. sound applied knowledge of Microsoft office. Office Location: The Animal & Plant Health Centre 6 Perahu Road Singapore Singapore 718827 Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Successful candidates will be offered a 9-month employment contract.

What the role is To be part of the Policy and Governance unit within Performance & Evaluation department in the Ministry of Finance to (i) plan and implement policies and initiatives to level up evaluation capabilities in the public sector; (ii) adopt and promote effective performance reporting to enhance accountability on public spending; (iii) drive efforts to monitor and address governance related issues across the Whole-of-Government. What you will be working on Key responsibilities include: 1. Plan and implement policies and initiatives to level up evaluation capabilities Drive key funding evaluation policy and process changes to effect and signal efforts to achieve VFM and spending accountability Realise initiatives to promote a public-sector wide culture of VFM and accountability, such as facilitating the sharing of learning points and case studies. Ensure that the unit is staffed with trained and motivated personnel whom are developed to meet their current accountabilities and the future manpower needs 2. Adopt and promote effective performance reporting to enhance accountability on public spending Implement systems and processes to monitor and provide assurance on the performance and results of Government’s spending programmes as well as the governance structures and capabilities put in place by agencies for programme evaluations. Such initiatives include improving the quality of public performance reporting by MOF and public agencies through publications such as the Singapore Public Outcomes Review. Work with other public agencies to enhance the outcomes KPIs and targets and improve the quality of performance reporting for the WOG Progress Assurance Report. 3. Drive efforts to monitor and address governance related issues across the Whole-of-Government Lead WOG efforts to respond to the audit findings/internal controls weaknesses identified: o Work with relevant agencies to provide the public response to annual Auditor General’s Report and respond to queries from Members of Parliament/Public Accounts Committee/Estimates Committee o Work with respective central policy owners to address areas for improvement in a manner that promotes efficient and effective use of resources without compromising innovation and agility Develop and expand governance tools to improve the state of governance in the public sector. o Organise annual platforms to facilitate sharing of audit issues, central initiatives and learning points o Plan and implement tools to help monitor address cross cutting issues and emerging risks o Establish new communication channels to facilitate open and timely sharing of information across key stakeholders Surveil and understand the WOG’s governance landscape o Perform landscape study or research on governance structures and initiatives relevant for the public sector; o Build and analyse data repositories of audit issues, governance related queries raised publicly o Sentiment analysis of governance related issues using web scraping tools Oversee the Audit Act and financial governance clauses in the Public Service (Governance) Act What we are looking for A degree with at least 3 years of working experience; Candidates with strong economics background, econometric, statistical analysis and data handling skills, proficiency in financial or accounting concepts, programme/project planning, performance reporting and/or evaluation experience would be advantageous; Ability to look at issues from a long-term and macro perspective and anticipate challenges, coupled with a good sense of the practical implementation issues; High sense of curiosity and ability to adapt to a constantly changing environment; Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage partners and stakeholders at various levels; Self-motivated individual with the ability to multi-task in a dynamic and fast-paced environment; and A good team player.

What the role is The Animal & Veterinary Service (AVS), a cluster of NParks, safeguards the health and welfare of animals through comprehensive and integrated programmes and works closely with partners in the veterinary and animal-related industries to strengthen capacities and enhance competencies in animal health and welfare. It is the main touch-point on animal and veterinary matters in Singapore and the first responder for all animal-related feedback. You will be part of the Centre for Animal and Veterinary Sciences (CAVS) team under the Professional and Scientific Services Division of AVS. What you will be working on Duties include: Conduct experiments that involve handling of environmental samples (sediment, water, etc), virus isolation, PCR and phylogenetic analyses for the detection and characterization of viruses that cause animal diseases Carry out assigned projects for method development and pathogen characterization with a focus on the optimization of animal pathogen environmental DNA (eDNA) detection methods Calibration and maintenance of equipment Record keeping and data entry What we are looking for Degree in Biology, Biotechnology, Biomedical Science, Life Science, or related fields. Highly motivated individual with passion for laboratory work Team player with initiative, drive and good interpersonal/communication skills and able to work independently Good IT skills e.g. sound applied knowledge of Microsoft office Office Location: The Animal & Plant Health Centre 6 Perahu Road Singapore 718827 Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Successful candidates will be offered a 9-month employment contract.

Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Resilience and Engagement Division (RED) aims to grow a strong civic culture and strengthen social cohesion by promoting shared values, citizen engagement, and national identity. Your responsibilities include: Support the work of the National Integration Council (NIC) including agenda setting, planning support and secretariat duties, and co-ordinating the NIC’s various project teams. Map and understand stakeholder landscape to develop effective engagement and partnership strategies to build a community of collaborative partners who can support stronger integration and greater sense of belonging to Singapore. Identify and scope potential interventions in collaboration with other agencies and key partners to improve cohesion at the workplaces and in the community. Formulate resources and programmes to support the development of partners’ capabilities to engage their own communities effectively and to deliver impactful ground-up initiatives. Manage the division’s grant schemes such as the Community Integration Fund (CIF) and Integration Programme Budget (IPB) effectively and efficiently, by promoting awareness and interest, overseeing funding assessment and partnership agreements, and monitoring of grant take-up and disbursements. Manage the periodic review of grants schemes and processes to ensure effective administration. What we are looking for Minimum 2 years relevant working experience in facilitating partnerships and engagement work and/or grant management, with interest in immigration and integration issues Comfortable with start-up style work, and collaborating with partner agencies and community groups Mature, articulate, adaptable, highly resourceful and self-motivated Good analytical skills coupled with ability to think creatively and strategically Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Good team player More information about the NIC and CIF are at www.nationalintegrationcouncil.org.sg *All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting

What the role is Responsibilities As Head of the Stakeholder Engagement section within the Safety Policy and Planning Division (SPP), you will develop and implement strategies and plans to engage external and internal stakeholders to achieve effective promotion of aviation safety. What you will be working on You will lead the development and implementation of the aviation safety promotion strategy for CAAS, to identify key messages and actions. You will work with colleagues within the Safety Regulatory Group to implement the strategy and coordinate and monitor Division-level outreach activities such as seminars. You will monitor and enhance safety promotion effectiveness through feedback mechanisms and propose ways to strengthen stakeholder engagement. You will also have the opportunity to lead the development of CAAS safety publications (e.g. The Leading Edge) and organisation of key large-scale safety forums (e.g CAAS Aviation Safety Forum) that involve senior management. You will lead industry stakeholder engagement initiatives, including deepening and widening stakeholder networks and collaboration with the aviation community to further the safety regulatory objectives of CAAS. You will also conduct safety promotion to analyse data and feedback to engage and communicate with the external stakeholders more effectively. As part of the stakeholder engagement work, you will also drive improvement in the user experience of computer systems for safety regulation. You will work in a multi-disciplinary setting with safety regulation and IT colleagues to develop and implement Group-level digital services to enhance system interfaces, to provide better user experience. What we are looking for Requirement Training in any discipline At least 8 years of experience in stakeholder engagement, communications and, safety promotion Interest in digital technology and its application. Experience in design thinking or customer service journey will be an advantage. Strong writing, presentation and interpersonal skills Able to work independently as well as a team effectively Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to influence and drive win-win goals across key stakeholders Successful candidates will be offered a 1-year contract in the first instance, and may be considered for placement on a permanent tenure in subsequent renewal.

Job_Title: Manager / Deputy Manager / Assistant Manager (Operations Support)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Responsibilities You will play an important role in providing personnel licensing operations for the CAAS Safety Regulation Group (SRG) to ensure that aviation safety is safeguarded and well-managed. You will be working in a dynamic environment to bring satisfaction to members of public who require CAAS services on personnel licensing or use CAAS systems to process regulatory documents. You will have the opportunity to work with internal and external stakeholders across various domains. What you will be working on Working as part of an interdivision team, you will be required to process licence application from pilot, aircraft engineer and/or air traffic controller accurately. You are responsible to advise applicant on licence application requirements including identify requirements that were not met. You will also assist with the smooth operation of the CAAS Examination Centre and My PEL Hub, CAAS’ one stop centre for personnel licensing matters. You will have to provide timely responses to external stakeholders’ request, such as enquiries, appeals etc. You will also need to ensure the smooth functioning of CAAS systems and identify areas for improvement, participate in the development and implementation of enhanced processes. What we are looking for Requirements At least 1 year of working experience in a customer facing role with involvement in process improvement, system management and operational support Good attention to details A team player and able to work independently when required Good interpersonal and communication skills, should be self-motivated and able to perform under pressure Successful candidates will be offered a 1-year contract in the first instance, and may be considered for placement on a permanent tenure in subsequent renewal.

What the role is You will be part of the Organisational Excellence & Culture team under the People Matters Division at National Library Board. You will support the implementation of key platforms and processes to facilitate timely organisational diagnosis and interventions to support transformation efforts, staff engagement and promote a positive culture. What you will be working on Work as part of a team to design and deliver OD interventions that are aligned with NLB’s strategic business and HR priorities to drive change, and nurture a desired culture. Develop and implement staff engagement strategies and plans as well as supporting Divisions in their staff engagement efforts. Design & execute interventions across physical and digital channels. Develop and facilitate change management plans and initiatives to support NLB’s transformation efforts. Facilitation of engagement sessions eg. townhalls, management walkabouts. Develop a message house with clear narratives and drive internal comms within organisation. What we are looking for Qualifications in organisational psychology or related fields such as behavioural science, psychology or sociology or certifications in OD. At least 5 years’ working experience in driving organisational transformation, cultural alignment and change management. Proven track record in the planning and implementation of OD programmes and interventions. Candidates with no OD experience but with related experience in systems thinking, strategic planning & internal comms are welcome to apply. Strong stakeholder management and interpersonal skills to build relationships, influence and communicate effectively across diverse groups of stakeholders. Independent and a strong team-player with a resilient and positive mind-set, receptive to feedback and change and able to work in ambiguity with tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Video editing and infographics experience will be advantageous.

What the role is What you will be working on What we are looking for Competencies have long been used as a framework to help focus employees' behaviour on things that matter most and help us drive success. We are looking for candidates with the following competencies:

What the role is The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) seeks to transform the delivery of Government Digital Services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with the public to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. Do you want to apply your skills, knowledge and energy to implement cutting-edge infocomm technology and digital solutions that will change the lives of Singaporeans and the public? In GovTech, you can! As a Digital Business Analyst, you will work in a Government Agency as a key member of the GovTech project team. You will support the Chief Information Officer at the Agency and collaborate with fellow project managers, solution architects and technical services consultants to deliver leading-edge digital solutions. You are a pro-active, self-motivated and resourceful team member with good tech/digital knowledge and possess strong influencing and people handling skills. You are also adept at balancing multiple projects concurrently while constantly looking for new ways to apply digital technologies to meet identified Agency and citizen/business needs. What you will be working on You will be involved in a range of tasks including the following: partner with the Agency's business teams to elicit citizen/business needs through human-centric, visual methods such as service journeys and develop the appropriate business case work with fellow GovTechies and the Agency's project teams to develop user stories, functional/technical specifications and acceptance criteria evaluate and recommend suitable technology while aligning with GovTech's technology directions (such as cloud-based, enterprise architecture and modernization of legacy systems, adoption of SG Tech Stack) identify and adopt the appropriate development methodology (e.g. Agile or Waterfall) in an Outsourced, Co-Sourced or In-house development environment ensure system or product readiness for smooth deployment, adoption and operations analyse impact of requested changes and propose improvements to continuously address changing business needs, and work with support team to understand and address technical problems (Operations & Maintenance phase) assist the CIO to identify new opportunities for the Agency’s digital transformation What we are looking for Diploma/Degree in Computer Science, Infocomm Technology, Computer or Electronics Engineering or related subject area with minimum 3 years of relevant experience. Candidates with more years of experience will be considered for more senior roles Prior working experience in IT business analysis, application solutioning design and testing Participated in at least one full software or product development cycle, preferably using Agile Methodology Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem-solving skills Good communication skills with the ability to pitch ideas and influence A driven and motivated personality with an inquisitive mind Ability to learn and apply Preferred Skills: Business Analysis certification, e.g. Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Past development or consulting experience Knowledge or experience in implementing projects in at least one of the following areas (Data Analytics, Agile Methodologies, Cloud, Internet and Mobile Technologies, Customer Relationship Management, Knowledge Management and Service Design) We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round. Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

What the role is IT Security Executive (Governance & Risk) What you will be working on You will be responsible for some of the following areas: Assist to develop and implement enterprise-wide ICT security programmes as follow: i. Establish the cybersecurity governance structure for HDB to ensure that the security posture is robust, resilient and pragmatic ii. Enhance and update the IT security policy, standards, procedures so that they are always current against the evolving cyber security landscape iii. Perform compliance checks on IT systems and IT security programmes to enforce implementation of IT security standards and procedures Assist to develop, maintain and operationalise a Threat Risk Assessment framework for HDB to identify and mitigate the threats and risks in its IT systems and programmes Work with key stakeholders to improve the cybersecurity posture and resiliency of IT projects. Related works include Threat Risk Assessment, project specific cybersecurity specification, cybersecurity proposals evaluation, cybersecurity design review, System Security Acceptance Test and review, Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Test. Work with key stakeholders to ensure high cybersecurity posture of application systems through activities such as the following: i. Secure Code practice and security scanning ii. Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing (VAPT) iii. Software Composition Analysis (SCA) iv. DevSecOps v. Procure & Maintain Security Tool such as Code scanner, Web Pen Test scanner Manage and promote IT security awareness and outreach programme You are also to: keep abreast of the latest industry ICT security practices and technologies as well as emerging threats and vulnerabilities and recommend appropriate controls for implementation to improve the enterprise security posture lead and/or participate in the adoption of new technological advances and best practices in infrastructure security systems to mitigate security risks What we are looking for You should possess a strong background in ICT Security, Information Security, Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering (Computing/Telecommunication), Cybersecurity and/or Digital Forensic or equivalent. At least 1 year of direct and relevant full-time ICT security work experience. Preferably possess one or more appropriate IT security certifications, such as CISSP, CRISC, CISM, CISA, CEH, etc. Preferably with some knowledge and experience in information and cybersecurity risks assessment, mitigating controls specification, vulnerability assessment/penetration testing, compliance and industry IT/cyber security best-practices. Added advantage for candidates with knowledge in any of the following: Domain knowledge of access control; telecommunications and network security; cloud security; Cybersecurity & information security governance and risk management; software development security; cryptography; security architecture and design; operations security; security incident response and management; business continuity and disaster recovery planning; legal regulations, investigations and compliance; physical (environmental) security Knowledge in IT security principles and IT controls as well as industry best practices and frameworks pertaining to IT Controls (IM8, COBIT, ISO27001/2 etc.) Good understanding of the current IT/Cyber Security landscape You also need to: to work beyond business hours including weekend when necessary possess good interpersonal and communication skills demonstrate a strong sense of urgency and have good troubleshooting and problem-solving skills with good attention to detail have good command of written and oral English All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

What the role is Overview The Health Promotion Board’s vision is to make Singapore a nation of healthier people. Come be a part of this journey if you’re passionate about creating boundary-pushing work that drives behavioural change. You will be part of HPB’s Healthy Food and Dining Division which aims to make healthier dining choices as integral part of Singaporeans’ lives. Through our programmes, such as the Healthier Choice Symbol (HCS) Programme, the Healthier Dining Programme (HDP), Eat, Drink, Shop Healthy (EDSH) or nutrition education and outreach efforts, we enable Singaporeans make healthier dining choices easily, regardless of whether they choose to dine in or out. What you will be working on You will need to engage various cross-functional stakeholders to obtain buy-in to ensure the robustness of the campaigns and projects during its development. You will also execute online, mobile-app and offline activities, promotions and initiatives. In addition, you will draw insights and learnings from campaigns, promotions, on-ground activations to propose improved mechanics and/or operations flow, as well as review and evaluate periodically on the activities with data support and on-ground audits. You will also be expected to propose creative and relevant solutions to secure, maintain and grow the supply of healthier meals within F&B setting, including hawker centres, Foodcourts and coffeeshops, etc. Lastly, you will assess and detect any risks or non-compliance with activities and ensure risks management are taken into consideration and ensure processes and compliance to be in place for all activities. You will work closely with IT team and vendor to troubleshoot day-to-day operations. What we are looking for Join us if you are a dynamic and self-motivated individual with at least 3 years of working experience, preferably in the area of campaign management and implementation through online and offline modes. You enjoy working in a highly matrixed, fluid and fast-paced environment. You should also possess: Experience in executing small and large scale campaigns, involving members of public, digital product development such as app and systems development for public facing engagements, promotions and tracking Adequate understanding of and interest in the eat-out landscape and food scene, e.g. hawker centres, Foodcourts and coffeeshops, etc. Experience in marketing, business development and collaborations across multiple stakeholders or cross-functional teams will be preferable Creative and possess good analytical skills and yet is attentive to details. Possess strong interpersonal & relationship building skills to maintain collaborative partnerships and communicate effectively at all levels. In addition, having qualifications in a relevant discipline (e.g. Business Administration, Business Marketing or any health promotions related discipline) will be an advantage.

Job_Title: Senior Manager - Integrative Logistics Solutions, Asia
Job_Descriptions: Company Description About Toll Group At Toll, we do more than just logistics - we move the businesses that move the world. Our 20,000 team members can help solve any logistics, transport, or supply chain challenge – big or small. We have been supporting our customers for more than 130 years. Today, we support more than 20,000 customers worldwide with 500 sites in 25 countries, and a forwarding network spanning 150 countries. We are proudly part of Japan Post —  www.tollgroup.com Job Description We are looking for a Senior Manager, Integrative Logistics Solutions to join our Supply Chain Solutions department within the Global Logistics division.  This highly analytical role will see you responsible for providing solutions to client opportunities  across our Logistics services in Asia. By building cross-functional relationships, you will liaise with key stakeholders in driving requirements analysis, solution development, pricing and costing, proposal documentation, solution presentations and negotiationsThe role As a Senior Manager, Integrative Logistics Solutions, you will be responsible for: Overseeing the entire tender process for specific opportunities with includes the development of response format / pricing matrix / responding to queries to timely submission of RFI, RFP and RFQ to customer / sponsors. You will also provide expertise in the cost modeling and analysis of business for pricing determination and business improvement analysis and coordinate and manage the information flow from the sales lead, and other sales team members and internal service / rate providers to create a complete and professional customer proposal within the required time parameters Supporting the development and maintenance of a knowledge pricing database of capital, labor and operating costs, productivity standards (where applicable) and company information to support tender request Collaborating with key stakeholders in the Toll Group to ensure a proposed solution solves the clients’ problem. Providing analysis and design support in the pursuit of new business, inclusive of requirement clarifications, tender evaluations, manpower calculations, infrastructure investments and design Undertaking presentations to customers on solutions and supporting Sales/ Business development in the new business acquisition process. Responsible for project deliverables and involvement in solution presentations to customers Applying robust analytical approach to flexible, sustainable and efficient Automation solution design. Maintaining working relationships and collaborating with vendors of integrated warehouse technologies and specialist firms. Identifying and developing with existing or new customers, improved supply chain strategies that are innovative and offer win/win solutions Maintaining insight into existing clients, their product profiles and our client services scope.  Supporting the development of clear and worthwhile client references and case studies.  Supporting the application of best practises through the process of reference case development and share gaps/process inefficiencies that lead to projects/initiatives which aim to improve performance. Qualifications About you To be successful in this role, you will need: Undergraduate qualifications in Business and/or Logistics/Engineering. Master’s in Project Management, Supply Chain Management and/or MBA Over 5 years working experience in related industry, with at least 3 years in a lead Intralogistics/Warehouse Solutions role. Overseas experience an advantage Knowledge of the following topics:  storage mediums, material handling equipment, space analysis, manpower analysis, inventory/SKU analysis, operational key performance indicators, continuous improvement initiatives, transportation methods, packaging, secondary operations, costing, material flow design and optimization and solutions engineering IE/Lean/Six Sigma or equivalent competencies an advantage; Financial and Mathematical Modelling Skills a must as well as AutoCAD/REVIT design tools. Working knowledge of operating systems incl WMS/TMS/ERP and interfacing thereof an advantage Excellent Presentation and Documentation Skills. Demonstrated ability in preparing professional proposals.  Advanced Powerpoint, Excel and VBA Skills. Other programming skills advantageous Ability to travel throughout SEA and abroad based on solution support requirements Additional Information Be Connected With a bold vision and innovative drive, join our 20,000 colleagues as we lead industry change and transform how customers best meet their global supply chain needs in a meaningful and sustainable way. There are countless opportunities to learn and make a real impact in shaping our industry’s future. Grow with diverse challenges amongst a friendly and inclusive global culture. Take pride in building relationships that matter, because being connected is at the centre of what makes Toll great – it’s what makes our possibilities endless. Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality, built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages, genders and abilities. If this sounds like the opportunity you are looking for, apply now or for more information contact  *********@tollgroup.com     To find out more about us visit www.tollgroup.com/careersYou must be entitled to work in Singapore and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical.

Company Description LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters. Job Description This role will be based in Singapore At LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams.  This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can both work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what’s best for you and when it is important for your team to be togetherSearching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.  We are looking for a Large Enterprise Account Director to join our team as a trusted adviser with a relentless focus on bringing value to our customers within the Enterprise sector in Singapore. You will be responsible for helping our clients be successful in their talent strategies through our solutions (Talent, Learning & Glint). What the role is Your work primarily focuses on driving MCI’s performance management and corporate planning cycle, ensuring that MCI’s strategies are aligned with the strategic outcomes. What you will be working on In support of that, you will be required to monitor, analyse and research on trends pertaining to MCI’s area of work, particularly, digitalisation and emergence of new technologies, and its impact on the economy and society. You must be able to synthesise salient issues/trends from a body of literature and assess them in MCI’s context and operating environment, in terms of opportunities and risks that can affect Singapore and the strategic positioning of MCI’s domains of work. You are also required to drive MCI’s corporate planning process. This entails organising our planning processes to review or chart out MCI’s strategic priorities, and providing guidance to MCI’s Management Team, Policy Divisions and Statutory Boards on strategy development and execution, ranging from progress tracking to governance and capability development. You are to identify inter-dependencies and linkages to ensure strategic coherence across the MCI Family and recommend solutions where gaps arise. You will also be expected to present MCI’s perspectives to influence other stakeholders and advance MCI’s objectives. At the same time, you are required to continually review MCI’s performance in growing the Digital Economy, building an inclusive Digital Society, protecting and securing our digital and information space, and effectiveness of public communications. This may require reviewing or developing Key Performance indicators and tracking indicators to define what success looks like in these domains and measure our performance accordingly. You might be interested in this job if you are: Excited to develop acumen and proficiency in corporate planning skillsets Keen to understand the impact of digitalisation and digital technologies on the economy and society and play a part in shaping strategies that will allow us to seize the opportunities present in the digital domain, while mitigating the risks. Inspired by an open, innovative and collaborative team culture, driven by agile processes. What we are looking for Job Requirements: 1. Demonstrated skills in developing and implementing metrics, processes, tools and intervention measures to drive achievement of MCI’s strategies and priorities. 2. Demonstrated skills in applying tools and methodologies to gather and analyse data in order to communicate MCI’s work, generate insights that inform decision making, etc. 3. Ability to establish and manage strategic internal and external relationships with partners and stakeholders to add value and achieve MCI’s goals 4. Strong systems thinking and understanding of government policy considerations, with the ability to apply these when assessing internal proposals, making recommendations and communicating MCI’s plans and proposals to stakeholders

Company Description CGG is a global geoscience technology leader. Employing around 3,700 people worldwide, CGG provides a comprehensive range of data, products, services and solutions that support our clients to more efficiently and responsibly solve complex natural resource, environmental and infrastructure challenges.  Our geoscience solutions mobilize the expertise and ingenuity of our exceptional geoscientists, data scientists, researchers and engineers, and leverage the latest data analytics, machine learning and AI technologies to deliver new insights and innovations that enable our clients to achieve their business and energy transition goals in new, more sustainable ways. We offer a comprehensive portfolio of multi-disciplinary, multi-client products including analytics-ready geoscience data and the industry’s most technologically advanced seismic data library in the world’s key locations. Sercel is the world leader in seismic acquisition equipment, designing and manufacturing high-tech solutions for subsurface exploration as well as structural health monitoring, defense and underwater acoustics applications. Effective oral and written communication and interpersonal skills Proficient in local labour legislations Resourceful, independent and meticulous team player who has the ability to multi-task and enjoy challenges. What the role is The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. As an ICT Procurement Partner in GovTech, you will collaborate with project managers, business analysts, and application infrastructure engineers who are passionate about developing the required ICT capabilities in government to realise Singapore’s vision of a Smart Nation. You are a decisive and driven individual who takes a proactive approach to ICT procurement requirements with project stakeholders during the procurement phase of the project lifecycle. This includes planning procurement schedules, carry out the procurement activities in accordance with government policies and procedures, and identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. The ability to effectively engage and manage project stakeholders and government agency’s partners is a must. Success in the role will be demonstrated by your ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. What you will be working on Manage and execute the procurement of ICT systems, goods and services in a timely manner Effectively engage and manage the project stakeholders to complete the procurement project on time Understand the government procurement policy, ICT management policy, quality management policy and security guidelines to ensure the procurement deliverables are designed to comply with these policies and guidelines Identify potential procurement risks and its implication to the project stakeholders, and propose mitigating measures to manage the risks Propose and implement aggregation of procurement for common ICT systems, goods and services Propose improvements to ICT procurement templates, standards and guidelines Implement appropriate ICT procurement governance and management framework to achieve the organisational and national objectives What we are looking for Basic degree in infocomm, business or equivalent Minimum 7 years of relevant experience, preferably in both procurement and IT Good knowledge of government infocomm environment Good knowledge of ICT procurement and contract management practices Able to deliver quality and thorough work, with eye for details Excellent written and verbal communication Good negotiation, influencing and stakeholder engagement skills We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round. Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. As a Business Analyst, you will be managing the FI/ HCM service delivery aspects of the project. You will collaborate with a team supporting a shared HR, finance and procurement system used by subscribing government agencies i.e. statutory boards. You will advise agencies on key trends and best practice for ERP solution locally and internationally to meet the business domain’s objectives and solve business problems, assess applicability for adoption, manage user requirements, and provide IT solutions to bridge business needs. You are knowledgeable in SAP FI / HCM modules or Workday. Success in this will be demonstrated by your ability to conduct business analysis, including business analysis planning and monitoring, business needs exploration and identification, requirement analysis, solution assessment and validation, and requirement management and communication. What you will be working on Review and analyse agencies’ ERP needs and recommend solutions within the shared System capabilities. Work with suppliers and agency representatives to evaluate requirements, discuss solutions and develop plan of approach; analyse existing processes and make recommendations to better streamline overall processes within the ERP solution to ensure smooth deployment and adoption of new solution. Manage service delivery of shared FI / HCM system and related sub-systems, including integration points with finance system and related technical areas. Work directly with and manage the supplier and agencies for new implementations. Manage post-implementation support and maintenance of the shared FI / HCM system, including software patches / upgrades, disaster recovery, service quality and compliance with service levels, applicable policies, standards and processes. Assist with integration of ERP solution with other business systems and applications used by agencies and other Singapore Government shared systems and services. Validate design and effort of change requests for quality, reliability, maintainability and reasonableness. Review and analyse existing policies and processes and recommend improvements. What we are looking for Degree with major in Information Technology, Information Systems, Systems Development or closely related areas. At least 5 years’ experience implementing and maintaining Workday or SAP FI / HCM, with hands-on SAP ECC 6.0 (Netweaver) FICO / HR ABAP/Webdynpro programming, workflow and configuration. Completed at least one full SAP project implementation and maintenance life cycle with hands-on experience. Knowledge of SAP Organisation Management, Personnel Administration, Time Management to Personnel Development including the suite of Talent Management (Appraisal, Recruitment, Talent Management & Development, Compensation and Learning Solution) functionalities and features. Knowledge of SAP GL, budgets, funds control & procurement functionalities and features, and Singapore accounting practices. Experience in any of the leading cloud ERP products in FI / HR domain will be preferred. Possess good communication, interpersonal, organizational and planning skills. Able to interact and communicate effectively with all levels of management, users and suppliers. Must be a self-starter and able to work independently with minimum supervision. Job_Title: Laboratory Officer, Analytical Toxicology Lab-Drug Abuse Testing
Job_Descriptions: What the role is This is a Laboratory Officer role which sits under the Analytical Toxicology Lab - Drug Abuse Testing. What you will be working on Job Description: Perform testing of drugs and metabolites in biological samples which includes sampling, extraction and instrumental analysis In accordance to laboratory manuals and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Operate and maintain laboratory instruments. Calibrate laboratory instruments, prepare reagents and maintain inventories of laboratory consumables. Maintain a safe and clean working environment by adhering to safety procedures and regulations. Hiring_Company: Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Research and Development of a Sustainability R&D Evaluation Framework What you will be working on The intern will carry out a global landscape study of the Research and Development Evaluation frameworks relating to environment and resource sustainability. In doing so, the intern will assess the applicable aspects of these global frameworks (e.g. evaluation criteria, method etc) and propose to apply it to the inaugural MSE R&D Evaluation framework. The intern will have the opportunity to propose, steer and influence the MSE R&D Evaluation, which aims to guide and track S&T investments for the MSE Family. in addition, the intern may also aid in the data analysis and data cleaning of the MSE R&D/Innovation & Enterprise Database, in order to yield insights for the MSE R&D Evaluation Framework. What we are looking for Resourcefulness Global perspective and awareness Critical thinking Experience in independent research projects is a plus Internship Period: May - Jun 2022

Hiring_Company: Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Research on Sustainability-Related Pre-Employment Training (PET) and Continuing Education Training (CET) in Singapore What you will be working on The intern will carry out a landscape study of the sustainability-related PET and CET courses in Singapore. The sustainability-related fields to be covered will include water supply and wastewater treatment; energy efficiency; carbon services; agritech and aquaculture; environmental services (waste, pest control, cleaning). The intern will then identify the key skill sets and capabilities being built up in the course participants (including frontier skills, or cutting edge skills that will become mainstream in future as companies evolve to adapt to new trends and technologies), as well as assess potential gaps, taking reference overseas case studies where applicable. What we are looking for Resourcefulness Good reading and writing skills Attention to details Experience in development of databases (Excel) will be useful Internship Period: May - Aug 2022

You should have excellent written, spoken communications and presentation skills. Meticulous attention to details is necessary as well as the ability to multi-task, work as a team and work well under tight deadlines. Candidates who are not fully vaccinated and do not intend to get vaccinated have higher risk of COVID-19 complications and will not be considered for the position.

Job_Title: Business Partner/Senior Business Partner, People & Culture
Job_Descriptions: What the role is At Enterprise Singapore (ESG)’s People & Culture team, our mission is to help keep ESG ahead of the curve. We do this by ensuring we have the right talent, and our people are growing, recognised and fulfilled. What you will be working on As the Business Partner/Senior Business Partner, you will be in a position of influence where you will have direct access to business units and feel the pulse of the organisation. You will engage with multiple stakeholders, facilitating talent discussions by providing HR perspectives and sound guidance on people challenges. In addition to partnering your divisions, you will also design, review and execute ESG’s strategic People policies and programmes for a dynamic, bright and diverse workforce passionate about growing Singapore enterprises. The policies and programmes include one or more of the following: Leadership & Talent Management; People Experience & Culture Building; Workforce & Resource Planning; Organisation & Career Design; and Operations Support & Systems Management, with an emphasis on optimising user experience and harnessing the power of people analytics. If what you’ve read excites you and you think you fit the bill, please write in – we’d love to hear from you. If you are shortlisted for the position, you may be required to take part in a written assessment. Successful candidates will be shortlisted for an interview. What we are looking for We are looking for a highly motivated and resourceful, digitally-savvy self starter. You should – like us – believe that People are the most critical and valued resource in an organisation. And that the right People policies and processes have the power to drive staff engagement, build a joyful workplace, and deliver strong organisational performance. You should have at least 2 years of related experience in Human Resource and related discipline. You should be engaging, happy to help others, able to communicate and write well and accustomed to delivering strong presentations. You should have a spirit of experimentation and the tenacity to drive change. Knowledge of and/or experience with data analytics and process optimisation would be a strong advantage. Prior experience in public sector HR would be helpful. A healthy sense of humour wouldn’t hurt, either.

What we are looking for Business Partner Responsibilities (2 years of related experience) Conduct campus engagement activities to build a robust early talent pipeline Manage the end-to-end recruitment process of our early talent programmes, particularly in identifying the best and most passionate talent as ESG Global Executive Scholarship award recipients and/or Management Associates Provide an exceptional and delightful experience to our candidates and internal partners in the recruitment process Partner our scholarship award recipients and/or Management Associates closely to ensure their success Enhance the efficiency and robustness of our selection process (e.g. by experimenting with recruitment technology)

What the role is The Public Service Commission (PSC) was constituted in 1951 as an independent organ of state to appoint, promote, transfer, dismiss and exercise disciplinary control over public officers. The PSC Secretariat provides support to the PSC. This includes formulating conduct and discipline policies, to ensure that officers maintain the highest standards of personal conduct and integrity. One significant non-statutory role of the PSC is the award of PSC scholarships for undergraduate and postgraduate studies. Under the Talent Management arm of the team, we formulate scholarship policies and oversee talent attraction and development of PSC scholarship holders as potential future leaders in the Public Service. What you will be working on [Specific Job Responsibilities] Reporting to the Assistant Director (Talent Management), you will be part of the team supporting and facilitating the PSC’s work in developing top-tier talents through PSC scholarships and maintaining oversight on scholarships throughout the Public Service. Your role entails: Outreach, Branding and Media Relations Manage the PSC scholarships brand through media/public communications/branding and outreach strategies. Plan and implement outreach efforts across multiple platforms to enhance PSC scholarship value proposition to key stakeholders. Scholarship Selection and Management Handle the end-to-end administration of the Lee Kuan Yew Scholarship, from talent attraction to selection and assessment of candidates. Oversee, plan and execute high-signature scholarship events/ceremonies and milestone development programmes for scholarship holders. Mentor, coach and advise scholarship holders on their development plans and career paths, including overseeing their academic progress and participation in academic and non-academic programmes to ensure an all rounded development. Manage the day-to-day administrative matters pertaining to their finances, legal agreements, university relations, etc. Research, Network and Policy Development Develop expertise and specialist knowledge in careers in the Singapore Public Service, local and overseas tertiary education landscape, and various HR methodologies for developing top-tier talent. Network with partners such as local and overseas tertiary institutions and build strong rapport with university partners. Promote sharing of information and best-practices in scholar development methodology and scholarship administration with partners in other Ministries. Explore potential Gap Year and/or internship opportunities in the private and public sector for scholarship holders’ development. What we are looking for [Values] We are looking for self-motivated individuals who can work independently and value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service. [Work Experience & Competencies] The ideal candidate should possess basic appreciation of the strategic role, purpose, objectives and challenges of PSC’s Talent Management roles in the Public Service. In addition, we are looking for an individual who possesses the following: [Recruitment & Branding] The ability to design and implement branding and outreach strategies to articulate and enhance the value proposition of the scholarships to stakeholders across multiple platforms. [Talent Management] A good understanding of the talent needs in the Public Service. This includes the ability to implement talent management processes and initiatives to identify, engage and manage talents. You should be open to new ideas and approaches to talent development and be able to translate them into operational processes. You have experience in mentoring and managing talents in areas such as onboarding, training and development and managing their well-being. [Thinking Clearly and Making Sound Judgements] The ability to think on your feet, adapt flexibly to different operating situations, navigate different viewpoints and work under pressure of seasonal tight deadlines. [Working Effectively with Stakeholders] The ability to reach out, influence and mobilise internal and external stakeholders towards a common purpose; and engage them to better understand their needs and co-create solutions that work. You have experience designing and facilitating networking sessions and are a confident communicator who can interact with local and international partners to foster positive working relationships and identify opportunities for collaboration. You also possess strong interpersonal skills. [Analytics] Strong analytical skills and ability to leverage the use of data and research to generate insights for planning of policy and programmes. [Other Traits] An understanding of the local/overseas universities and education systems, and/or fluency in foreign languages (Japanese, French or German) would be advantageous. Keen interest to work with scholarship holders and a good understanding of the psyche of youths today. Organised, meticulous and able to multi-task. A team player who can thrive in a fast-paced environment. Applicants will typically be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of the job posting. Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

Job_Title: Development Partner/Senior Development Partner, PME Talent
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Industry Human Capital (IHC) Division in Enterprise Singapore contributes to the growth of Singapore enterprises through the development of talent, leadership and manpower strategies and capabilities. You will get a chance to work on macro national issues one day and zoom in on practical implementation issues of companies and stakeholders the next. Join us and be MAD! (I meant Making A Difference!) What you will be working on At the PME (Professionals, Managers, Executives) & Leaders Department: We believe in enterprise-led PME talent development efforts so that they become catalysts to accelerate the growth of enterprises. We engage enterprises to support their internal leadership bench strength development, understand their unique challenges and recommend solutions. We feel the pulse of industries and create solutions with our partners to uplift sectoral capabilities. We build an extensive ecosystem to help enterprises equip Singaporeans with in-market knowledge and operational know-hows in their internationalisation journeys. What we are looking for You will develop a broad perspective and gain deep insights on global human capital trends, national manpower and education policies, and talent and leadership opportunities and challenges faced by companies. You will acquire skills in policy development, programme design and management, problem solving and stakeholder engagement. We love to have data substantiate our proposals so there is a need in every department to run data analysis and data storytelling. If you are someone who loves a challenge, not afraid of crazy hours, resourceful, communicates well, collaborates well, respects others no matter how smart you are, a keen learner and teacher, has an agile and analytical mind, has a sense of humour, we want you! Some of our current key projects: Leadership Development Initiative to support enterprises' grooming of rising leaders Industrial Post-graduate Programme to support enterprises in developing deep research and technology talents Develop and manage PME Leadership programmes with a focus on understanding China and ASEAN markets to drive market expansion Research, analyse and suggest solutions to encourage more Singaporean to take on overseas assignments through data analysis, stakeholder engagement and cross-agency collaborations
