Job_Title: Assistant Manager/Manager (Contact Centre Operations & Planning), ServiceSG
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Context of the Role The operating environment of the Public Service is undergoing fundamental and rapid change. The issues we face are complex and multi-faceted, which impact the way the Public Service operates and organises itself. To prepare the Public Service for these changes, we have begun the journey towards Public Sector Transformation (PST). As part of the current phase of PST, ServiceSG aims to be on par with globally leading companies in our delivery of public services. A key transformation in the delivery of citizen services is to take a citizen-centric service journey approach to organising services in an integrated manner via a) a digital concierge via the LifeSG app, b) a physical concierge via an expanded network of Integrated Public Service Centres (IPSCs); and c) a national contact centre. Our aim is to transform the current citizen experience of having to navigate across different public agencies to an experience of the Public Service “knowing, understanding and interacting with me as One”. There are currently more than 100 hotlines across the Whole of Government (WOG). The Contact Centre team in ServiceSG aims to work with agencies who own these hotlines to streamline and integrate these contact centres, especially those that provide related services. The goal is to establish a central ServiceSG contact centre that can address the queries of citizens across over 400 citizen related services, serving as a “outsourced shared service” for selected agencies. The team will also support surges in contact centre call loads for key agencies during peak periods, and act as the crisis call centre in a national pandemic or crisis. What you will be working on Responsibilities Reporting to the Senior Manager, you will be part of a team that manages the performance of a 180-seat outsourced contact centre that operates the remote service touch points of 6 agencies. You will build strong partnerships with agency stakeholders, understand their business, and operational processes, manage call surges, and ensure that the outsourced partner meet KPIs. you will also be responsible for setting up processes and systems to enable the contact centre to work seamlessly together with PSD’s counter and mobile app touchpoints to provide omnichannel service to the public. [Specific Areas of Responsibilities] Monitor the contact centre’s performance KPIs for all stakeholder agencies’ service channels Handle the onboarding of stakeholder agency contact centres, and new service channels Work with vendor to ensure adherence to stakeholder agencies’ requirements and processes Review and close knowledge and process gaps at the contact centre Support the daily operations to enable PSD’s service channels to deliver omnichannel service Organise regular activities and provide updates to establish strong partnership agency stakeholders Ensure that contact centre adheres to stakeholders’ escalation protocols Investigate all poorly rated calls and complaints, ensure that all replies issued promptly. Work with the contact centre and stakeholder vendors to implement improvement plans Prepare monthly reports to update agency stakeholders on the performance of their service channels Handle procurement, contract management, finance and other administrative duties. What we are looking for We are looking for an experienced and motivated individual who can work autonomously in a fast-paced environment. You should be comfortable with ambiguity, be action-focused, and be comfortable to explore new ideas and work them to deliver desired outcomes. [Work Experience & Competencies] An ideal candidate should possess the following: [Customer Service and Case Management]: Demonstrate care and empathy in understanding citizen’s underlying needs and going the extra mile to help, and escalating issues/feedback to relevant agency stakeholders as part of the close-the-loop process for policies/services implementation. You should possess the ability to communicate effectively through written and oral presentation. [Customer Experience Strategy and Engagement]: Transform service delivery through identifying and translating new technologies to new ways of delivering contact centre services which are more customer-centric and productive. Reimagine the delivery of contact centre services from a customer-centric perspective, identify improvements and redesign the operational or service recovery processes. [Thinking Clearly and Making Sound Judgements]: Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities. Able to work with ambiguity and loosely defined problem spaces and synthesise data points and ground realities to sense-make, propose and implement sound and timely solutions with stakeholders in mind. [Working Effectively with Stakeholders]: Able to work closely with other Public Service agencies to drive the service transformation initiative and achieve better coordination and integration of technology and processes. [Procurement and Contract Management]: Proficient in procurement, contract and vendor management. Applicants will typically be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of the job posting. Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

Job_Title: Snr Exec/Manager (Strategic Workforce Planning & Labour Market Intellligence
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As the Public Service continues to face rising complexity and volatility amid tighter constraints, we need to accelerate efforts to deepen and broaden the capabilities of our Public Service Workforce to support business needs. To help the Public Service ensure a tighter translation between our business needs and workforce strategies, we are looking for a Senior Executive/Manager, Strategic Workforce Planning and Labour Market Intelligence. Reporting to the Senior Manager (Strategic Workforce Planning and Labour Market Intelligence), you will be part of the Workforce Development Cluster in PSD. What you will be working on You will work with public sector agencies to lead a range of exciting workforce development projects: [Functional Leadership] The functional leadership framework seeks to transform key cross-cutting functions (e.g. HR, Finance, Procurement, and ICT) to better support the business success of agencies and uplift the contributions and capabilities of each function. You will partner our functional leaders to drive workforce capability building efforts in their function and be responsible for conceptualising and putting in place an ecosystem of workforce strategies and enablers to support this transformation effort. [Labour Market Analysis] We need a data-driven approach to inform our workforce strategies for in-employment upskilling programmes or career development or career transition efforts. You will be responsible for conceptualising and putting in place the labour market report for the public sector to distil key insights such as (i) sunrise and sunset work areas, (ii) implications for competencies and skills for the workforce. You will be working with the PSD Data Office to drive this effort. [Strategic Workforce Planning] We need to ensure a tighter translation between business needs and workforce strategies through strategic workforce planning covering three big areas: (i) what the business need are, (ii) how these translate to key capabilities to build (including deep expertise) within the workforce, and (ii) sizing of the workforce and strength of the talent pipeline for succession planning in the capability areas. We are currently partnering key public sector agencies to look at a few key workstreams across the public sector, such as Science, Technology and Engineering, Green Economy, Digital Economy and Care Economy. [Crisis Manpower Deployment System] The COVID-19 pandemic has shown how important it is for the public service to be able to stand up large inter-agency operations and deploy manpower nimbly at short notice to meet surge crisis functions (e.g. call centre). You will be responsible for conceptualising and putting in place a crisis manpower deployment system to: (i) formalise a system of decision-making on manpower deployment issues to be operated by PSD during the crisis, (ii) identify the workforce for specific crisis functions within the public sector to train them during peacetime; and in the private and people sectors to mobilise them when needed. You will be working across key public sector agencies to coordinate this effort. [Strategic Planning] As part of exposure, you will also help to oversee how the three workstreams in WD cluster, from strategic workforce planning and labour market intelligence, to in-employment skills upgrading, to career development and transitions, can be better synergised. This includes participation in cross-cutting workstreams such as One Talent Gateway. You will assist SD(WD) to help position WD cluster as the [email protected] SERVICE. What we are looking for [Values] We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service. [Key Competencies and Experience] [Strategic Workforce Planning]: The ability to align HR strategies and policies by determining and developing the workforce capacity and capability, in order to achieve organisation goals, now and into the future. This includes the ability to proactively identify and manage the impact of workforce risks to the organisation. [Analytics]: The ability to use data and analytics across a range of HR functions to generate insights for business intelligence and foresights for planning purposes. This includes the ability to understand both quantitative and qualitative datasets. [Working Effectively with Stakeholders]: The ability to foster strong relationships with stakeholders, communicate effectively, and build trust, so as to effectively influence and mobilise them towards a collective purpose, engaging them to deepen understanding of issues and co-creating solutions together. Excellent in presenting and translating information/insights succinctly and effective in stakeholder engagement to obtain buy-in amidst competing priorities. Good at negotiating and resolving conflict in order to develop and engage employees (e.g. convey policy rationale). [Serving with Heart, Commitment and Purpose]: The ability to display care and empathy in how we serve, translate ideas and executive policies, and to deliver decisively and persevere through challenging situations. Passionate about helping employees raise their employability. At least 3 years of work experience in related areas including policy, human resources, career development and partnership engagement. [Personal Traits] Resourceful and driven to put forth new ideas and get things done Comfortable working in an ambiguous, fluid and fast-paced environment with tight timelines Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date. Successful candidates will be offered contract employment in the first instance.

Job_Title: Business Partner/Senior Business Partner, Financial Planning & Analysis
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Finance division in ESG oversees all financial policies, reviews, accounting, reporting, budgeting, grants and loans management and compliance for Enterprise Singapore and its subsidiaries. What you will be working on You will be assuming a challenging and exciting role and will be tasked with the following: Lead and manage the full set of accounts including liaising with other finance staff for timely closure of monthly and year-end accounts, periodic reporting of financial performance and preparation of audited financial statements. Responsible for budget planning, monitoring, and management reporting as well as payment processing. Drive resolution on issues related to accounting operationsfor the company. Responsible for all corporate secretarial and legal matters, liaising with company secretary and lawyer to ensure compliance with local regulations for subsidiary matters. Oversee the financial operations, with overview of the financial performance, internal control and governance. Responsible for financial year-end closing, leading to the timely preparation and analysis of quarterly and annual financial/statutory reports, in compliance with FRS and other statutory, legislative and regulatory requirements. Responsible for ensuring the consistency of accounting treatment across subsidiaries and statutory board. This role requires in-depth understanding and practical implementation of the Financial Reporting Standards. Responsible for the overall governance of all subsidiaries of the statutory board. Review and update the Corporate Governance Practice handbook for compliance by subsidiaries. Review of subsidiary fee and funding model if applicable. Liaise with internal and external auditors on audit/accounting issues. Participate in ad-hoc projects as assigned. What we are looking for Meticulous with a strong analytical mind and ability to work under pressure to meet tight schedules At least 3 years post qualification experience gained in an accounting firm and/or commerce. Having both private and public sector experience will be advantageous. Strong interpersonal, communication and business partnering skills are required in order to work across functions and levels of management. Candidate must be a pro-active, independent, meticulous, and hands-on team-player. Highly analytical and motivated individual with good work ethic.

What the role is At Enterprise Singapore (ESG)’s People & Culture team, our mission is to help keep ESG ahead of the curve. We do this by ensuring we have the right talent, and our people are growing, recognised and fulfilled. As one of three Deputy Directors, you will lead a team to design, review and execute ESG’s strategic People policies and programmes for a dynamic, bright and diverse workforce passionate about growing Singapore enterprises. What you will be working on Your responsibilities may include Leadership & Talent Management; People Experience & Culture Building; Workforce & Resource Planning; Organisation & Career Design; and Operations Support & Systems Management, with an emphasis on optimising user experience and harnessing the power of people analytics. You will also take the lead in the Strategic Business Partnering of teams across ESG, working closely with Executive Management to assess and address their respective resource needs. As a Deputy Director, you will coach and develop your team to unlock their potential; you will also work closely with the other Deputy Directors to deliver the People & Culture mission, and to build a joyful workplace. If what you’ve read excites you and you think you fit the bill, please write in – we’d love to hear from you. If you are shortlisted for the position, you may be required to take part in a written assessment. Successful candidates will be shortlisted for an interview. What we are looking for We are looking for a highly motivated and resourceful, digitally savvy self-starter. You should – like us – believe that People are the most critical and valued resource in an organisation. And that the right People policies and processes have the power to drive staff engagement, build a joyful workplace, and deliver strong organisational performance. You should have at least 8 years of related experience in Human Resource Management and be energised by the prospect of leading a team. Supervisory experience would be a plus. You should be engaging, happy to help others, able to communicate and write well and accustomed to delivering strong presentations. Knowledge of and/or experience with data analytics and process optimisation would be a strong advantage. Prior experience in public sector HR would be helpful. A healthy sense of humour wouldn’t hurt, either.

Job_Title: Development Partner / Senior Development Partner, Engineering Services
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The team spearheads the development and transformation of the Process Construction and Maintenance (PCM) sector, a critical supporting ecosystem to the Energy and Chemicals (E&C) manufacturing sector on Jurong Island. The Energy and Chemicals manufacturing sector is a significant one to Singapore, accounting for one-fifth of Singapore’s manufacturing output and generates direct employment capacity in excess of 25,000. The E&C sector is at the cusp of a transformation, to move into a low carbon future. What you will be working on You will be directly involved in shaping the strategies and policies the PCM sector for the next decade. You will get to work across government agencies, MNC clients, SME companies and industry captains to chart out and execute plans to strengthen Singapore’s position as a globally competitive and sustainable Energy and Chemical hub. Importantly, you will also need to strategize and open new global opportunities to plug our companies into, so our companies can likewise participate in the growth opportunities in the Energy and Chemicals manufacturing sector outside of Singapore. What we are looking for You should be independent, hungry for growth, demonstrate strong learning capacity and equipped with a passion to make a difference. Candidates with excellent execution skills (e.g., analytical, problem solver, effective communicator in verbal and writing), knowledge of the PCM and E&C sector and keen understanding of business workings will have an advantage.

What the role is The Industry Human Capital (IHC) Division in Enterprise Singapore contributes to the growth of Singapore enterprises through the development of talent, leadership and manpower strategies and capabilities. You will get a chance to work on macro national issues one day and zoom in on practical implementation issues of companies and stakeholders the next. Join us and be MAD! (I meant Making A Difference!) What you will be working on At the HC Capability Department (HCCD), we focus on both local workforce and enterprise HC capability development: Engaging and influencing Trade Associations and Chambers (TACs) to play a proactive role in supporting industry/enterprise transformation, and implementing programmes for job creation and redesign Monitoring the progress of such programmes, analysing relevant qualitative and quantitative data, and deriving actionable insights to improve processes and deliver positive outcomes Reviewing global talent mobility needs of enterprises, and designing and implementing corresponding programmes to meet such needs Managing human capital capability-building tools and programmes (e.g. Productivity Solutions Grant, Enterprise Development Grant), and offering the relevant guidance to ESG officers Identifying gaps in the human capital capability-building space, at both the generic and sectoral levels, and working with stakeholders to drive new initiatives to close such gaps You will develop a broad perspective and gain deep insights on global human capital trends, national manpower and education policies, and talent and leadership opportunities and challenges faced by companies. You will acquire skills in policy development, programme design and management, problem solving and stakeholder engagement. We love to have data substantiate our proposals so there is a need in every department to run data analysis and data storytelling. If you are someone who loves a challenge, is resourceful, communicates well, collaborates well, respects others no matter how smart you are, a keen learner and teacher, has an agile and analytical mind, has a sense of humour, we want you! What we are looking for Passionate about helping local companies Excellent stakeholder management skills At least 6 years work experience Prior experience in Human Resource functions or HR consultancy (e.g. in the area of global talent mobility), will be advantageous

Location: Funan, 107, North Bridge Road, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179105, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description At Paragon, we are much more than just a karate school, a sport, or a fun activity. We are a family that creates Superheroes. Our Australian School is growing, and we are looking for young, energetic, enthusiastic and passionate individuals to join us as we expand into Singapore. We teach our students that they can positively influence the world by focusing on their behaviour. Through our innovative programs, each of our students learns to unleash their inner Superhero to become the best version of themselves that they can be. At Paragon, we aim to make each class a positive, rewarding and motivating experience. We are a family school with a friendly, inclusive and welcoming community, providing exceptional karate training to students of all ages, backgrounds, and abilities. Regardless of ability, we believe that any person should be given the opportunity to participate fully, and our programs are designed to ensure this. ParagonInc Singapore's expansion has the primary objective of opening a SuperHero School in Singapore focused on a Martial Arts program for children aged 5-11. In addition, we will expand into teenager, adults, and pre-school aged children post the initial launch. We are looking for instructors to join us on this journey from the beginning! The offer: We are holding a comprehensive selection activity starting March 1st 2022, for two months. 8-10 candidates will be selected to join this selection activity. Candidates will receive two months of free training to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts. Following this, we will select 3-4 instructors for paid positions. - Join two months of free lessons (twice a week) to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts (March 1st to April 30th). - After two months, the head instructor will select Instructors to become part of the Paragon Instructor Team in a paid position. - If you are not selected as an instructor in the first two months, you are welcome to continue training with us at a reduced fee rate. Ongoing benefits: - Instructors will continue to receive free martial arts training. - Opportunities to travel to our sister school in Australia Applicants can be current university students, new graduates or mid-career. The successful applicant will be able to provide evidence of working with children and (preferably) martial arts. Overall Purpose and Objective of This Position: The Instructor positions at Paragon Martial Arts are a critical role responsible for maximizing the experience that all students have in class and with our School and ensuring the students learn the curriculum and see positive changes in their lives. This includes teaching class, leading by example and ensuring the space at Paragon Martial Arts reflects the high standards we demand of our School. Roles and Responsibilities: Leading Class – Instructors must be capable of leading a class (you will be trained in all aspects of Martial Arts required). This involves following the curriculum plan and designing and implementing fun and engaging classes that help every student make progress towards their goals. To do this, the Instructor must understand each student's individual goals. Student engagement – The number one role of an instructor is to ensure that every student in a class is actively engaged in the class and that classes are exciting. This should be done through frequent minor adjustments in behaviour through positive means. Every student and person who walks into our School should be made to feel like they are a valued member of our community, of our tight family. You will also be required to run specific drills explained to you by the Instructor. Cleaning – As part of providing our students and families with an experience that surpasses all expectations, it is important that the environment we train in is kept Super clean. Keeping the School clean is the job of every Paragon employee. Leading by example – You must maintain the standard of a superhero both in and outside of karate. You must maintain a minimum of two classes per week of training. You will be asked to hold yourself to a higher standard than others would. Any public social profiles or private ones that have any members of Paragon Martial Arts on them must be maintained at a standard acceptable of someone working with children, for example, no swearing, drunken photos, racist comments or anything demeaning to anyone. Anything that would lower our families' impression of you or the School should be avoided. Student Retention – An essential component of an Instructors role is ensuring all students are continually improving. You will also be involved in helping create a strong relationship between the student and Paragon Martial Arts. You will need to get to know all of our students remembering names is an absolute must. You will also be required to write at least one Great Job card per night of teaching. Sales – As a member of the Paragon Team, it is expected that you will assist with bringing in new students. This may be by referring new students, talking about our programs to people, or helping with getting advertising material out. You will also be required to do basic cash register activities selling uniforms, merchandise and events. You are also expected to interact with Paragon posts through social media and help share the message with your social circle. Expectations: The Instructor is expected at all times to: 1. Lead by example 2. Train minimum two times per week 3. Attend all instructor training sessions 4. Maintain excellent knowledge of the curriculum they have covered. 5. Be punctual on all commitments 6. Conduct themselves with a highly positive, energetic and contagious attitude 7. Be constantly adding value to the student experience 8. Raise the quality of instruction at Paragon Martial Arts 9. Be Punctual to all commitments 10. Maintain a high energy high expectations class. 11. Follow up with the manager or the family on any students missing class 12. Maintain student numbers in class 13. Bring in a minimum of 2 new students per month Characteristics and Skills Sets: 1. Strong and positive attitude 2. Hunger to learn 3. Energetic 4. Martial Arts Interest 5. Ability to interact and talk to children 6. Ability to interact and talk to families 7. Desire to do more than is expected 8. Strong teaching skills with a desire to continually learn how to improve 9. Ability to deliver the curriculum in an exciting manner Reporting Channel: The Instructor reports to the Director of ParagonInc Please apply now if you would like to be considered for the selection process. Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

What the role is As Data Engineer, you will partner subject matter experts from the Colleges and external parties to perform advanced analytics based on data that are generated in the system for various programmes, e.g. PET students’ participation in their internship programmes with companies in different industries, students’ learning behaviour with resources and activities in learning management system, students’ competency levels ranging from foundation to mastery levels in adaptive learning systems. These data can be structured or unstructured data from different sources. You will work closely with our team of Instructional Design Specialist and System Analyst to gather user requirement; design and develop use cases; customise, test and implement dashboards that are relevant to different stakeholders. You are expected to extract, prepare, transform and load data into an analytics software; build AI model with predictive capabilities; and create visual dashboards to present data that are relevant to different groups of stakeholders. What you will be working on - Support analysis of data for different stakeholders to gain insights into students’ learning behavior, performance gaps and learning needs in the various programmes relating to internships, learning management and adaptive learning systems - Provide training and consultancy to different stakeholders on how to use the dashboards - Conduct knowledge transfer on data analytics and AI modelling to staff What we are looking for Skills and knowledge in software engineering, programming languages used for statistical modeling and analysis, data warehousing solutions, and building data pipelines. A strong foundation in mathematics and statistics. Skills & knowledge in statistical modelling software and programming languages that support model development, data mining, manipulation, aggregation and visualization is a bonus. Suitable credentials in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent Practical experiences in data analytics projects (including text analytics) or AI projects for at least two years would be an advantage. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written Applicants may check their application status at the end of 8 weeks from the closing date of this job posting.

Job Description : Diageo is the world’s leading premium drinks company with an outstanding collection of brands, such as Johnnie Walker, Smirnoff, Baileys, Captain Morgan, Tanqueray and Guinness. Our purpose – Celebrating life, every day, everywhere – has an important role in our company, for our people, our diversity, our brands, in how we perform and how we create shared value. The Diageo Prestige portfolio of luxury spirits is a collection of the most rare and exceptional Scotch whiskies from within Diageo’s vast portfolio. The brands within the portfolio share a richness of history, stories of innovators and prowess in craftsmanship. Our ambition is to create the best performing, most trusted and respected Consumer Products Company in the world. To achieve these, we need the world’s very best people. Feel inspired? Then this may be the opportunity for you. About You You will have a proven record of consistent performance, experience selling high-value luxury goods, a deep understanding of luxury consumers and be confident in high-pressure sales conversations with influential and wealthy individuals, and have your own network of loyal customers Function Diageo Prestige has the ambition to be a leader in luxury spirits, becoming the most trusted and respected provider of luxury products and experiences to aspirational and discerning consumers. Our success will be created by pioneering people passionate about crafting experiences and turning challenges into innovative opportunities. About the Role The Private Client Manager reports to the Head of Sales and is responsible for achieving personal sales targets and developing a robust lead generation pipeline. This is achieved by developing close relationships with, and long-term loyalty between our clients and our brands, while providing an elevated consumer experience. Consistently achieve and beat personal targets through proactive direct selling Expand and sustain the Diageo Prestige client database by identifying new, and reactivating dormant clients through various initiatives, including but not limited to collaborations with external partners. Contributing to a robust CRM programme to improve client retention rates while increasing average CLV (client lifetime value). Accountability for compliance with all channel-specific policies and controls and particularly those associated with personal data protection. Experience required/Skills/Capabilities/Languages Commercial knowledge and insights that deliver results whilst operating with simplicity and creativity. A positive 'can do' attitude with the ambition to win in a fast paced environment. Exceptional interpersonal skills and an ability to seamlessly adapt to new environments. Strong values and integrity with a customer first approach. Exceptional organisation skills. Diversity statement Celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture is core to Diageo’s purpose of “celebrating life every day everywhere”. This purpose is, in itself, inclusive in nature, as it values everybody irrespective of background, disability, religion, gender identity, sexuality or ethnicity. We know that for our business to thrive and for Diageo to realize its ambition, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills and capabilities in each of the 180 countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base. We view diversity as one of the key enablers that helps our business to grow and our values, purpose and standards set the conditions for us to respect the unique contribution each person brings. Flexibility is key to success in our business and many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, compressed hours, flexible location. Please talk to us about what flexibility means to you and don’t let anything stop you from applying. Character Is Everything Worker Type : Regular Primary Location: George Street Additional Locations : Job Posting Start Date : 2022-02-15-08:00

Job_Title: Content Marketing Senior Writer, SPH Media Limited
Job_Descriptions: SPH Content Lab is looking for a Content Marketing Senior Writer. The right person for the job is passionate about creating engaging content, from text-based articles in both digital and print to multiformat content involving video, audio and social media. You’ve got to understand what makes a story fundamentally interesting – and you must be able to create compelling work that fits seamlessly alongside editorial content across platforms, while meeting the client’s brief. Plus, you have a knack of selling that story on social media in a way that connects and resonates with the audience. Working with contributors, you own the ability to manage all the moving parts needed to bring stories to life. The job requires planning, project management, client management, and exceptional writing skills. Must play well with others. Core Duties Write, edit, proofread content; optimising copy and headlines for digital and social media according to best SEO practices Work collaboratively with Content leads to craft and refine ideas for stories, series, concepts, themes; creating digital content that’s relevant to the audience Project manage stories through their life cycles from concept to execution; assign and edit a range of stories and working with a pool of freelancers Ensure content is produced to brief at highest quality; adhering to in-house style guides Adept at composing pithy, on-brand posts, blurbs and messages for social media; ability to translate paid content to feel native to the different platforms on which they are published Cooperate and liaise with clients, sales teams, writers, designers, illustrators, etc Comply with media law and ethical guidelines Requirements Minimum 4 years demonstrated excellence in content creation, including digital and social media platforms. Must have experience in editorial and sponsored content Excellent command of the English language Proven familiarity with SEO and social media best practices Familiarity with analytics and a track record of creating viral content, a plus Understanding of social media trends across platforms Detail-oriented and a gift for multitasking to meet aggressive deadlines within budget requirements Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with both internal team and external pool of freelancers Experience with content management systems such as Wordpress and Drupal, a plus Please apply to *****@sph.com.sg with your detailed CV and portfolio

ABOUT US ShopBack : Better Shopping, Every Day. The ShopBack Group is Asia-Pacific’s leading shopping and rewards platform, serving over 30 million shoppers across ten markets. Growing from a team of six back in 2014 to over seven hundred today, ShopBackers across the region come together with a singular mission: to make shopping rewarding, delightful, and accessible for all. More than half a billion shopping trips start with ShopBack each year. The Group powers over US$3.5 billion in annual sales for over 10,000 online and in-store merchant partners, across categories ranging from fashion, beauty, F&B, electronics, travel and more. ShopBack is continuously enhancing our suite of shopping services and solutions, to bring more value to our shoppers and merchant partners. ShopBack is continuously enhancing our suite of shopping services and solutions, to bring more value to our shoppers and merchant partners, and we are looking for world-class talent around the globe to be part of our exciting journey. If you are passionate in building and scaling up businesses in this fast-growing landscape, come and join our growing ShopBack team! We are looking for an experienced and entrepreneurial Learning Partner to build and lead our Learning & Development (L&D) function. You will drive all of ShopBack’s L&D initiatives with the goal of directly impacting our business growth and people capabilities across our diverse workforce. You are experienced at designing learning strategies and building a ground up culture of learning from onboarding to development, and yet you enjoy being hands-on in designing and delivering training programs across all levels of the organization. This may include introducing impactful learning programs using the latest technology and design solutions which are virtual, classroom-based or blended. You thrive in a fast-paced operational environment and are passionate about providing excellent internal client support and driving people operational excellence along with the People team. This role will serve as a subject matter expert and main point of contact for all issues related to L&D for ShopBack. You will build and communicate L&D programs, policies, processes and practices that deliver long-term HR strategy and support business goals. To be successful, you must be able to operate at both strategic and operational levels as an individual contributor.

Entity : Allianz Asia Pacific (Allianz SE, Singapore Branch) Job Purpose: Responsible for tax compliance and reporting, tax risk mitigation and tax planning for Allianz entities in Asia Pacific region. As the regional tax subject matter expert, you will be one of the key contacts for tax matters for all managed legal entities in the region and this role will involve significant cross-team, function and business liaison as well as interaction with regional finance and Allianz group tax. Key Responsibilities: Tax Compliance and Reporting •    Responsible for tax accounting and effective tax rate analysis including review of quarterly IFRS tax reporting delivered by OEs to ensure compliance with IAS 12 and related accounting standards. •    Ensure a consistent approach to tax compliance, liaise with external tax agents who are preparing tax computations, returns and submissions. You will play a key part in advising the respective tax team in Operating Entities (OEs) on tax compliance matters, managing tax audits and advising finance on internal tax reporting obligations. •    Ensure compliance on transfer pricing regulations and avoid any potential permanent establishment risk to businesses across Asia Pacific region. Tax Planning •    Support M&A transactions and provide input in due diligence, structuring and implementation phases. •    Provide proactive support to implement opportunities for enhancing tax management effectiveness and appropriate tax risk mitigation strategies •    Work with the global tax team to implement strategic tax initiatives and policies. Key Requirements: •    Minimum 5 years of tax experience, preferably in an insurance company or Big 4 accounting firm •    Experience in tax accounting/reporitng (practical knowlege and experience of IAS12 and related accounting standards) •    Good understanding of insurance products and the impact of IFRS 9/17 standards. •    Experience in tax compliance practices for both direct and indirect tax, structuring and corporate tax planning actions •    Strong tax technical knowledge and commercial acumen •    Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal •    Strong team player with good interpersonal and relationship building skills. •    Fluent in English, additional Asian languages desired. •    Strong analytical and conceptual skills. •    Self-motivated, demonstrating initiative and a pro-active approach •    Accounting or related degree and additional tax qualification would be advantageous Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, it owns and manages a global portfolio worth S$131.7 billion as at 30 September 2019. CapitaLand’s portfolio spans across diversified real estate classes which includes commercial, retail; business park, industrial and logistics; integrated development, urban development; as well as lodging and residential. With a presence across more than 200 cities in over 30 countries, the Group focuses on Singapore and China as its core markets, while it continues to expand in markets such as India, Vietnam, Australia, Europe and the USA. At CapitaLand, we advocate fair employment practices, and recruit talents based on merit and fit with our Corporate values. We provide equal opportunity for all qualified persons and build an inclusive workplace regardless of race, gender, age, religious belief or nationality.

Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading IT solution and service provider headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Leadership experience is a plus Expert developer in either Android and/or iOS Will be customer oriented and skilled in developing a strong understanding of customer needs and marrying those with optimal technology solutions A-team calibre and mindset Ideally to hit the ground running, you should have the following: Degree in Computer Science or equivalent Knowledge of Object Oriented Programming and SQL Strong experience with native mobile features such as GPS, accelerometer, push notifications Strong experience in cross platform mobile development tools such as React Native Framework and Titanium Appcelerator Experienced in developing on Unix/Linux environments Enjoy constant learning and working with new technologies If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you! Job_Title: Treasury Planning and Analysis, Associate Manager
Job_Descriptions: Your Job Responsibility Reporting to the Planning & Analysis Manager, responsible for building and developing group-level capital and liquidity analytics and forecasting. Enable and ensure the company maintain a strong and sustainable capital position sufficient to support its strategic aims and hold an adequate buffer of high-quality liquid assets to survive extreme but plausible liquidity stress scenarios. Design and implement technology systems, automated reports, and processes to provide analytic and insights on balance sheet trends to senior management. Deliver robust liquidity and capital forecast (short term and strategic long term) ensuring strategic decision making for senior management. Establish controls and processes to monitor compliance with regulatory and covenants ratios, and alert and propose management for necessary actions. Contribute to implementing all the necessary Treasury technology to automate workflows, controls, and processes by collaborating with internal stakeholders. Work closely with the business and their leadership teams to ensure a sound understanding of business strategy and associated risks, challenge commercial plans. Supporting any statutory / regulatory reporting from Treasury points at consolidation level. Our Ideal Candidate You have at least 5-7 years experience in banking or Non-banking financial institutions with exposure to balance sheet management. Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in liquidity and capital management, especially for those (not limited but to); capital planning and forecasting, liquidity management, key ratios control, optimization of balance sheet. Willing to take on new challenges and be adaptive to a fast-growing and dynamic start-up environment. Detail-oriented with the ability to work under pressure and tight schedules, cope with several tasks simultaneously, and be deadline-oriented. Structured thought process, self-initiative, and strong analytical abilities. Strong communication and high level of English proficiency Postgraduate in Finance and/or any financial analytical certification as a plus. Exposure to non-Indonesian ASEAN countries as a plus. Apply Now and Join Us Traveloka is Southeast Asia’s lifestyle superapp with a mission to fulfil the travel and lifestyle aspirations of our users. Founded in 2012 by ex-Silicon Valley engineers, we set out to solve a central problem: simplifying travel from Indonesia to the world. That’s how we became Indonesia’s leading travel platform but today we are so much more. Our suite of products and services – spanning travel, local services and financial services – provides our users with an end-to-end solution for their travel and lifestyle needs. From transportation to accommodations, attractions to eateries, and insurance products to financial services, we want to empower the region’s fast growing and highly aspirational consumers to enjoy new experiences and explore the world around them.

Job_Title: Global Wealth Management Asia Platform Adoption Head
Job_Descriptions: Global Wealth Management (GWM) is a newly created business integrating Citi Private Bank and the Consumer organizations into a single platform enabling Citi to serve its clients across the wealth spectrum and capitalize on Citi’s industry leading capabilities. As we embark on this journey of being the leading wealth management provider in Asia, it is important to have a best-in-class Technology Platform. The GWM Asia Platform Adoption Head will play a pivotal role in this journey and manage the overall development, execution and adoption of Technology roadmap. Key Responsibilities: Work closely with GWM leadership team to define and deliver the technology product roadmaps aligning to strategic business priorities. Prioritize and manage annual technology investments of over USD 60MM. Work in close collaboration with the product, sales and segments, regional and country teams to understand and anticipate business needs and translate them into technology product requirements. Work closely with GWM & GCB technology teams to oversee all stages of product creation including design and development. Acts as a trusted advisor to the leadership team and addresses high impact strategic issues across its portfolio of businesses. Work in close partnership with business heads and senior leadership. Lead the planning product release plans and set the expectation for delivery of new functionalities. Spearhead the Technology strategy and prioritization conversation with Global CGW COO Team Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of Release/Sprint Goals Create and maintain a product backlog according to business value or ROI. Ensure customer launch of implemented technologies and drive adoption. Create pragmatic frameworks for measuring business value of implemented technology – iterate on roadmap basis the results. Analyze market, the users, and the roadmap for the product; follow competitors and industry Requirements: 15+ years relevant experience in Wealth Management and/or Technology Strategy In-depth understanding of Wealth products and Wealth Management business Good understanding of technology processes Outstanding communication, presentation and leadership skills Excellent organizational and team management experience Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills In-depth understanding of the business and financial drivers. Ability to lead and direct a team of knowledge professionals. Problem structuring and analytic capabilities; ability to take a complex problem and organize it in discrete pieces for solution. Ability to size and prioritize large-scale initiatives across businesses. Ability to work effectively with senior and middle level managers and with large interdisciplinary teams.
